19.description: Fan of pollo guisado?  Come to Ponce!Ponce serves up the BEST pollo guisao that I've ever had (flavorful sauce, lots of chicken and yummy potatoes).  It's also served with either rice and beans or the yellow rice.  At $7, this is a STEAL.My bf has been a fan of their steak jibaritos since forever. (Like...since high school.) They're also a steal at $4 and, even though they don't come with rice, you can add an order for less than $2, I think.  They also have an assortment of $1 "appetizers" like relleno de papa (meat stuffed potato ball), empandas and alcapurria (fried plantain ball filled with meat).  And passion fruit juice.  Don't forget that.Food comes out fast!  Even though it's usually crowded in here, you never have to wait long for food!  Great home-y atmosphere with friendly waitresses.  This is one of my favs!

28.description: Truly authentic and very well done, you can taste the thoughtful care in every bite! This place deserves ten stars, super inexpensive,  it's a huge steal! Be patient, it's small and may take some time to get a seat; but it's worth the wait!

45.description: It's really hard to find good PR food in Chicago.  So happy we checked this place out.  This place made my husband and I feel like we were back in the Bronx!  Ah good times.  Can't wait to return!!

33.description: Went here with 5 of my family members a couple months ago and it was packed with people. They only had a table for 4 and a table for 2 that didn't have peaople sitting at them so thats what we took. This was the first time going there and We all thought this was the best Puerto Rican resturant that we have tried yet. There wasn't anything we tried that wasn't fantastic. Everything was so good we ended up orders tons of food to go, we spent almost $100.00 on to go food. I had lunch for the rest of the week at work. I plan on going back on 12/24/14 to pick up a large order for Chrismas. I CAN'T WAIT!! If something changes from the last time I was there I'll post another review.

43.description: Love walking over to this place for a quick bite.  Okay, so the service here isn't the best (I know I've said before that this is a must for me) but its not HORRIBLE.  This food is so good that I'm willing to overlook the lady with attitude in the back. LOL. Most of their menu items are YUMMY.  Love their tostones (but then again how can you screw those up) also love their $1 alcapurrias and pasteles. Not crazy about their jibaritos though, they're a bit on the dry side :/  ***WARNING*** ITS CASH ONLY

2.description: I'm giving two stars because their customer service is nonexistent. We came almost at opening time. There was only one more table besides us, and it took 35 mins for our food to come out. They apologized stating their gas tank had gone out. When we finally got the food, it was delicious. However, it was overshadowed by the lack of organization, and service. When it is time to pay, you have to barge your way to the counter cutting people in line waiting to order, which kinda sucks if you are in line. The lady at the counter, while a great multi-tasker, did a mistake and overcharged us. We will go back, but if this experience repeats, we will definitely stop.

18.description: The food here is awesome! The fritura is cooked in small batches so its usually fresh, their jibaritos are the best in town, and the guisados are delicious as well. The ingredients here are all of good quantity. And I don't see how they are making a profit because the prices are so low. I laugh when I see the comments about service. There are tables here to dine at, but restaurants like these are set up for takeout. If you are dining in, just go to the counter, place your order and be patient. The food is so good, that it's worth any small aggravations. I used to go to the P.R. place at Fullerton and Kimball, but with the cockroaches and the declining quality of the food there, I definitely recommend a visit to Ponce instead.

41.description: Good Puerto Rican restaurants are hard  to come by in Chicago but when I find one it's automatically put on rotation. Ponce is one that does not disappoint. The only bad things I can say is that parking sucks big bacalao (lol) and I try to not to go there when it's dark out due to my own paranoia. The alcapurrias are close to my Mami's and the portions are huge!

52.description: Wepa!So nice to be introduced to a restaurant other than Borinquen. Ponce is the go to now. Better quality and better everything. Had the jibarito and the bistec sandwich and ive been wanting it everyday since. Prices are so ridiculously low to me and just by eyeing the clientele I know this place is legit. Big ups to my cousin for suggesting.One thing though, as with most islanders, service can be slow at times. I don't usually trip but sometimes as humans we have things to see, people to do... you just might need some lechon and tostones before you get on with that though. I've been to some PR restaurants where the service exceeded statute of limitations before but Ponce has yet to get there with me. Another mentionable would be the pasteles.  Specifically during the seasons greetings holidays. They taste the way you remember they should so get your orders in early.

50.description: Just a disclaimer, they only accept cash but boy is the food delicious here. Its literally my favorite Puerto Rican restuarant and the prices are not bad. I love their alcupurrias (spelling?). I totally recommend anyone to give it a try, you will not be disappointment.

4.description: This is the only Puerto Rican restaurant in Chicago that I genuinely like. I won't usually pay for PR food because I can get it at home, but Ponce is perfect for the more complicated/rare dishes that are hard to make on your own. They make the best jibaritos and they're only $5. They are always fresh and flavorful. The fritters are great too, they run out fast so they get replenished frequently. This spot is very popular, especially on weekends, so there is almost always a long line. I definitely think they're worth the wait!

6.description: Worse service in all of Illinois.   I've been there a couple of time and they make you wait without acknowledging you, whether they're busy or not.  Just plain rude.   No food is worth that.   They're not that great or giving it away.   Good service and manners towards customers count.

22.description: The food here is awesome! The fritura is cooked in small batches so its usually fresh, their jibaritos are the best in town, and the guisados are delicious as well. The ingredients here are all of good quantity. And I don't see how they are making a profit because the prices are so low. I laugh when I see the comments about service. There are tables here to dine at, but restaurants like these are set up for takeout. If you are dining in, just go to the counter, place your order and be patient. The food is so good, that it's worth any small aggravations. I used to go to the P.R. place at Fullerton and Kimball, but with the cockroaches and the declining quality of the food there, I definitely recommend a visit to Ponce instead.

15.description: Love the food I've been going there for years since I was 11 now am 30....Love the girls there.. they are like lost family members. .. now I move by melrose Park. ..You guys have to make a restaurant on this side of the world. ..just saying

57.description: Poor service, disgusting food!!!!! DON'T EAT HERE!!!!!!!!!!!

20.description: They have great food, the price is reasonable. I have order trays of food for different occasions and people love it. Everytime i put order over the phone is correct. I highly recommend to try their food.

36.description: I eat from ponce all the time. Hands down the best jibarito I ever had, but I'm so disappointed because I can't go back there because there was ROACHES crawling across the counter today when I went. Tears!!!!! I didn't want to give any stars but you have to

14.description: I LoVvve this place amazing food . I always leave here satisfied. When they make the you can really taste the seasoning of flavor.

1.description: Lady working the bar had a huge attitude.  A scrooge older lady in her grandma years. Then I asked her to make a mix drink with rum and told me she didnt know how to make it. Like seriously your behind the bar and dont know how to make a mix drink??!! She didnt care to offer me anything else. Right away I could tell she didnt care to service me. Just wanted to stay to watch a game and have a few drinks. Bar only had 2 customers and I see why. I didnt bother staying.. took my business elsewhere by armitage and kedzie where I stood almost until closing because I had great service and the environment was friendly. Definitely wouldn't recommend anyone to waste time at the establishment.

2.description: Some day, a Logan Square hipster whose nose for craft beer is as a bloodhound's for deer will cross the tracks and realize that they have Revolution Anti-Hero and Gold Cross on tap here. If they bring volume geometry skills with them, they might be disappointed to realize that the consistently short pours here are much closer to 12 oz. (i.e. bottle/can size) than the full pint typical of draughts east of the tracks. Might as well settle for bottles and cans.But, a better reason to come here is because it's the kind of solid, friendly neighborhood bar which is becoming increasingly scarce to the east and it's not at all seedy like some spots on the western fringe of Logan Square that you might walk past to get here. Recently rehabbed from its prior incarnation as Trier's Lads, this is easily the best-kept bar within at least a mile west past Weegee's on Armitage. With numerous TVs there's not a bad seat in the house for watching a game (or horses at off-peak hours). Though Hermosa is a predominantly Latino neighborhood, English is the dominant language amongst the white & blue collar mix here, and this is your place to go if your Spanish isn't ready for La Posada across the street.So that's what they do here, they provide a social setting, they show sports on the television, and they serve beer. Friends for the friendless, drunkenness to the sober. If you happen to need something more, you can snack on the tasty plantain chips from La Casa Del Jibaro, stare at the disco ball, or reach into the box of free condoms provided courtesy of the Chicago Community Condom Project.

0.description: What can I say about it. I love it! This became our go to neighborhood bar. Nothing fancy. Restrooms always clean.Great to have a beer and watch sports.I do love their great selection of beers!! Not your typical Coronas and Miller choices. Instead some local IPA's and Pale Ale is what we enjoyIf you are from the area you know you don't find that anywhere else.Our favorite bartender,Yoli,is always friendly and attentive to all her customers. If you want specially mix drinks this place ain't for you. It's a sports Bar! Hands down,Love this place.

A friend referred me to Rhina a few years ago and I've not gone to anyone else since.  I love my hair pin straight but I have major frizzies.  Like Diana Ross in the 70's frizz.  Rhina takes very good care of my hair every time I come.  She tries new things but keeps my hair healthy.  3 years ago she did the Braziliana Keratin and I've kept up with it.  It really does work and lasts longer as you continue doing it.  Rhina is great and I let her do what she wants with my hair.  I recommend her to anyone especially the ones who ask how I got my hair straight.  She is the only other Dominican that I've trusted with my hair.  The other salon closed and it's been a god send to have found Rhina.

3.description: Alright, the first thing that comes to mind is PERFECT Jager Bombs in a FROSTED mug, they still do the glass shots if you ask. I hear the apple pie shots are really good, but I don't like appie pie. LOLTacos are some the best in the whole Chicagoland area. Back patio for smokers.

1.description: I've been here twice, the first time for a friend's birthday party and I enjoyed myself, food was great (especially the wings and tacos).However, I came here last night and was very disappointed.  The food was ok (wings and an order of chips and salsa, the chips were fresh and hot).  The service was HORRIBLE.  The bartender was not friendly at all, rarely came by even though I waved her over several times, they messed up our order, and when the bartender gave me my change she just threw it on the table.  Will not be back.

2.description: This lace has great service and the people here are say to get along with. Best tacos. Brest late night food!

5.description: Triple D just shot an episode here so I HAD to be the first to review it. I mean, how else am I gonna make myself seem cool if I can't even be hip on the interwebz.In my early twenties, I spent a lot of time in the bars up and down Western Ave. Out of all them, Harry's was my favorite. But no matter which place we started at, we always ended back up at Harry's. Mostly for the tacos. I can't quite put my finger on what makes these soooo much better than others, but they're super delicious. It turns kind of clubby on the weekends, and they charge a cover. Please don't go then. But for football, with beers, and amazing tacos - this place can't be beat.

6.description: Went here with my mother and father who have both lived in Blue Island for over 30 years but have never tried Harry's.  My mom was looking forward to having some good ol' pub food but as soon as we walked in we were given the cold shoulder.  My mom moved a chair from one table to the one next to it to be closer to the window.  When doing so the bartender was giving her a weird look.  When I asked..."is there a problem?"  The bartender responded back in a very smart ass tone..."no problem here but are you ok" and then continued to look at me funny and then said something under her breath that made the gentleman sitting in front of her laugh.  So when I saw this I told my parents lets get up and go to Double Play down the street which was a much better experience and were very friendly.

0.description: I love Harry's. I like to go on Tuesdays and Thursdays for $10 domestic pitcher and 10 wings. I f***ing love their wings!!!! They're perfect EVERY time. Extra crispy and flavorful  and their cheese fries with the Harry's sauce. I wouldn't expect tacos to be that great here but they are delicious! After coming here so many times, the bartenders are cool too.

4.description: GREAT FOOD!  Live entertainment on the weekends and great Bartenders!  Local bar with friendly faces and the owner will walk in and say hello to everyone in his bar!  It makes you feel like one of the family! As far as what one other guy wrote (AJ.W) I'd never seen any of the bartenders disrespect any customer or customers! And that blonde bartender your talking about has been working at Harry's for some years now and I've only seen her be the utmost friendly to every and anyone that walks into Harry's!  Four Stars from me!

1.description: Really looking forward to their special - pizza with wings & fries. When I called, the person answering the phone only said "hello". I questioned if I was calling Daddy's pizza and he didn't seem to understand English. I know some Spanish so I asked if I was calling a business. He said yes. So I can be sure, I asked where his business was located. He said on Central Park. HUH? I checked the number I called and it was correct. I wasn't comfortable placing the order so I hung up immediately. Sorry.... my money went to Mama Luna's instead. Beware!!!

0.description: Daddy's Pizza placed an advertisement on our door a couple of weeks ago which included a coupon for a 16" Thin Crust Pizza with one Topping & a liter of RC for 10.99.  The other day we decided to give them a shot. The order was placed during prime hours on a Friday night.  The person answering the phone was very difficult to understand and had a hard time understanding me.  When I gave our address he had no idea where we were.  I gave directions and he still was unsure.  We're less than four blocks away from this establishment.  We ordered a 16" pizza with cheese and garlic toppings and were told that it would arrive within 35 minutes.  An hour later we received a phone call saying they were unable to find the house and asked for directions again. I could excuse this to some point but at the same time . . .  If you open a delivery business in Chicago you need to know Chicago's streets.  To top it off they were the ones that dropped off the advertisement at our door, they don't know where we are?  I've never taken an order over the phone so I don't know but don't places like this usually have a map in front of them?  Maybe in this day and age an internet connected computer with access to Google Maps, MapQuest or any of those other sites would be in order?An hour and 15 minutes later we had our pizza.  It was still warm but the pizza itself was just average.The total cost came to $14.17 plus $3 tip.  I think I can do better for $17.17

3.description: My daughters and I have been coming here for quite some time.  Amy and her hubby are the nicest people.  The quality of nail work is the best in this area.  I tried to go somewhere cheaper to save money only to have to come back to have them fix what the other place did despite the damage they did.  (That was a lesson learned never doing that again) I highly recommend them!

1.description: I have been to this location twice and both times I have had a great experience. The staff is quiet but they are nice. On both visits I didn't have to wait more than two minutes. The place is also clean and nicely decorated.

2.description: I will never come back here again. Came in on my lunch break there were only 2 workers in the entire salon. I waited an hr then decided to make an appointment for later in the day. I came back for my appointment at 4 and waited again even though I made an appointment. Absolutely ridiculous service, how can you run a business with only two workers.

5.description: Took my daughter here for a birthday party treat with her friends.  Friendly owners, good skills.

0.description: Clean and quick service, Infinity Nails comes recommended by this Logan Square Pioneer for mani pedi services.  Make a reservation and you're be in great shape!

4.description: I came here not knowing that they close at 7pm and showed up at 6:50pm. I asked if I could get a no chip mani and pedi and to my surprise was not turned away. The girl that did my nails was fantastic! She was very friendly and did an amazing job, without rushing. I will definately be back :)

58.description: Usually crowded but for a good reason  -  food is yummy even the non-breakfast food. My grandmother is is 89 and very old school Mexican. She liked the chilaquiles. Nina our waitress was very prompt and helpful! Definitely coming back to try the breakfast menu. My corn beef was pretty awesome though!

56.description: I've been here a few times for breakfast and I love the Fiesta skillet! The abuelita skillet is amazing too! The Abuelita has everything the Fiesta has but they add pineapple(takes breakfast to a whole other level). I've had version of Mexican breakfasts at other restaurants but Cozy corner has the best tasting! I had mine with a side of pancakes. The pancakes are kinda dry but a little butter and syrup soften them up a bit. Service is always great! Full of friendly people!

29.description: Good spot for breakfast or lunch. Take advantage of the early bird specials before 9am during the week. This place gets really packed on the weekends. I used to loveeee their spicy green salsa chilaquiles. But then I got sick to my stomach and I've never ordered them again. Recommend the banana Nutella crepes. Pancakes are good too!

42.description: My husband and I dine here almost every week. It's a cozy place and although there is a wait on the weekends it's worth it. We tend to arrive before 9 am (sometimes 9:30 am) and almost never wait. The service is great and food is tasty for the price you pay. There is one server that doesn't write the order down so it's kind of annoying especially when she forgets something. They usually make it right, but the inconvenience of having to return the dish leaves you wondering what hands it went through to arrive back on your table. It's just annoying.There is a separate parking lot to the east of the establishment, coffee is good especially now with the flavored creme, weekday early breakfast specials are great, chili is the best but sadly only available during fall/winter.Recently I went on a sunny, warm vacation and didn't come here for 2 weeks!!! I was extremely excited to come back to cool, gloomy weather just so I can have my Cozy Corner breakfast. There's not a lot of places that have that affect on me.

23.description: It always my favorite place to eat breakfast and lady's are very nice and so kind and very helpful

47.description: Not sure where the 4 star rating is coming from here, our experience was extremely blah.  Poor service, bland food, even the atmosphere left a lot to be desired. Don't get me wrong, I LOVE diners.. Cheap, no-fuss breakfast food is one of my favorite things, but this place sucks and we won't be back.SERVICE: Our order sat in the pass for at least 6-7 minutes before anyone brought it to us, and when it arrived I let the waitress know the order was wrong. She said "oh" and walked away with no further comment. Our corrected order did arrive quickly but the eggs were overcooked and the whole thing was under-seasoned.FOOD: Tastes like it was barely salted, scrambled eggs were overcooked to the point of being browned and rubbery. Also, what they're calling "salsa" here tastes like spaghetti sauce. Maybe OK for people who haven't had or don't like actual Mexican food, but it was pretty gross to us. ATMOSPHERE: It's a diner, I'm really not expecting much, but the servers all seemed like they were panicky and one of them stood at the pass and SHOUTED across the entire restaurant everytime another server's food would come up. Listening to someone scream VICTOR!!!!  LUPE!!!!  VICTORRRRRR!!! was pretty obnoxious, would be way more efficient if she just took the food to the tables instead of standing there screaming.

8.description: Please be careful people, I had a very bad experience today, I went to breakfast and when it comes to paying the woman who is the cashier  put my bill on top of the other bills , I was unprepared looking for money to pay but I could see what she tried to do.She  puts my bill on top of the other bills and grabbed one of down with a higher amount than mine and made me believe that was my bill but I realized and said that was not mine I just gave you mi bill. "BE CAREFUL PEOPLE WATCH CAREFULLY YOU BILL BEFORE TO PAY."

31.description: If you reference my review of the location in Logan Square, you'll see why we came here. The manager at the other location was rude but we really wanted delicious Cozy Corner breakfast/lunch. So we came here and explained our situation. We got sat right away and the waitress listened to our poor experience at the other location, apologized, and told us she would speak to her manager/the owner. Apparently these two locations have the same owner or they're related. Anyways, the staff was friendly and prompt and our order was correct and delicious! We'll be coming back to this location even though it's a little further from our place.

34.description: Our regular breakfast place. Good for lunch, too.Decent, not expensive. They do close early,  though.They are not open for dinner.

16.description: A great breakfast spot at a reasonable price. Nothing fancy but it's a great diner with tasty traditional breakfasts. It's perfect for friends, family or kids if you want a quick bite to get you started.

13.description: Our server today, Victor, was amazing! He was quick, nice, funny and apologetic about restaurant blunders that were out of his control (our meal coming late). It is really close to where I live and it has two parking lots for your convenience.

11.description: Love this place! Now that they have an extra parking lot I am def going back more. The service has always been great and the food is always on point. I always get either an omlette or the skillet (meat lovers skillet is my fav!). I also like that the waitress/waiter always keeps the coffee coming while you are there. The location itself is super clean which I like.Just be ware that on Sat/ Sunday mornings it gets really crowded so be prepared to wait or just come in early  (before 10am). Enjoy!!

39.description: I've heard a lot about this place...The eggs, the bacon, the pancakes...A must try! Well, I would have loved to try it but after waiting for 10 minutes without as much as a glass of water I left. I can understand if it was a weekend day or during breakfast, lunch, or dinner...but it was during the week in mid afternoon. Thanks but no thanks. Customer service is a must!!!

37.description: Love this place! Now that they have an extra parking lot I am def going back more. The service has always been great and the food is always on point. I always get either an omlette or the skillet (meat lovers skillet is my fav!). I also like that the waitress/waiter always keeps the coffee coming while you are there. The location itself is super clean which I like.Just be ware that on Sat/ Sunday mornings it gets really crowded so be prepared to wait or just come in early  (before 10am). Enjoy!!

0.description: Food was good service was fast and friendly. Pricing was descent for breakfast.4 of us. Got our food the way each asked and all very quickly

38.description: Excellent diner. Service and food was really good. I got the greek omelette with pancakes and hash browns. The omelette was moist, which is what a omelette should be like.  Orange juice was freshly squeezed too. Plenty of seating. Breakfast time its usually very busy. They are in a parking lot but thats almost always full. Terrific choice if your in the area.

51.description: Gypsy skillet and pancakes with fresh squeezed oj!!  Yum!!!  This place was delightful!!

27.description: Love coming here on the weekend for a delicious and laid back breakfast! It gets pretty busy (service doesn't reflect that) so be mindful of that.

32.description: I love this place. They have amazing food!! Their chicken supreme sand which is really good and they give a lot of fries with the order (you probably won't eat them all though) the cheese burgers are big and really juicy! And my favorite is the meat lover skillet I mean Its great, they put a great amount of hash browns meat cheese and of course two juicy eggs on top :) the waitresses are normally sweet and nice but once in awhile they can be rude and un-expectable but understandable because it can get extremely busy. Sometimes you wait 45 mins just to sit down and the line is out the door literally.

54.description: The most amazing breakfast that you will ever have... It doesn't matter what you try from here just know that whatever it is will be delicious! I'm a repeat customer because of the excellent service, the superb quality of the food and the fact that they have such a diverse menu. Parking can be a problem some times, but definitely check it out!

48.description: Yeah I mean, ok it's decent but give me any other option I'll take it. It's always super busy, the coffee is decent. The wait staff is rushed and sometimes forget about you.  Eh, two stars may be a little of a kick to the groin but this place kinda sucks

44.description: I have, sadly, eaten here too many times, including yesterday (my boyfriend will eat their omlettes since he's not very particular about breakfast).  The food is horribly bland at best  and pretty bad at it's worst.  I have had undercooked pancakes several times, including yesterday - you know, when you cut into them and the batter runs onto the plate.  The bacon is rubbery and their coffee is undrinkable - it would help if they actually put some coffee in their coffee.  I'm not a big fan of hot brown water.  As for their service - too eratic, sometimes decent and sometimes brutally bad. My last comment is to warn anyone away from eating their "whole grain toast!" We sat at the counter  in front of the grill yesterday and I watched as the various cooks handled the bread as they put it in the bin under the warmer - after they touched their faces, etc and then watched as the young woman calling out the orders played with her hair, wiped her mouth with her hands - and then touched the toast as she moved it around to make room for more.  So gross -and I had a lot of time to watch since it took them 30 mins. to get our order.  In short, if you don't care about the quality (or safety) of your food, this is the place for you.  If you do, avoid this place!

24.description: One word: Delicious! ! Great food and good atmosphere. Staff had great customer service and are pretty nice. But food definitely takes it, you must try.

7.description: Solid breakfast place. Great price and great portions. The service is always good, but there are days that are better than ever. Nice staff, clean and parking is always available. One of my families favorite spot for a good breakfast and great start to the morning. Treat your taste buds!

49.description: I stumbled across this diner while looking for a place to kill some time on a Sunday morning.  I lucked out and found a parking spot right in front (their parking lot fills up fast on a weekend morning!) The line for seating was out the door and down the block. I walked in to give my name and saw open spots at the counter.  Sweet!  No waiting to sit at the counter - this is a great option if you don't have a group.I'd never been here before, so I asked my server what she recommended.  She asked if I wanted savory or sweet and I had to go for sweet.  Her choice was the stuffed pancakes or french toast and I picked the Cheesecake Stuffed French Toast with eggs and bacon.  Service was fast and friendly and I love that they have flavored creamers for the coffee.When the food arrived, I had to take a picture of it.  It was as good as it looked. The sweet cheese stuffing in the french toast was much more like a cannoli filling than cheesecake but it was delicious, with just the right amount of strawberries on top.  My eggs were cooked perfectly and the bacon was crispy, the way I like it.The only complaint I have is minor - I had trouble getting my server's attention to get my bill, since she was swamped at the cash register.  I recommend getting there either very early (they open at 6) or around lunch time.  The mid morning after church crowd is tremendous and if you have a group, you'll wait at least 30 minutes at peak time.

40.description: I've found my new favorite breakfast place in Chicago in the wake of Dillmans untimely closing. Diner? Check. Perfectly cooked hash browns (crispy, but still slightly chewy)? Check.Fresh Avacado for my omelet? Check.Willing to accommodate a fussy customer who likes a skillet with ingredients in the kitchen, but not necessarily on the menu? HUGE check.Friendly service? Check.The only knock I could say about this place after two visits thus far is that they can be a little slow to refill the drinks, but if that is the worst thing you have to deal with for a reasonably priced, high quality breakfast in Chicago, you'll endure. Plus, the waits have been super short on my visits (a Saturday morning and Sunday morning), though I'm sure their other location is more crowded.Thanks for a great meal Cozy Corner; I'll be back soon!

53.description: I love it here....friends even joke and say I'm part owner because I go so much. Food is always good. Some of my favorite choices are Country friend steak,  country friend steak skillet, and the typical egg hash brown and sausages, and the Fiesta skillet (it's chorizo) mmm. The sausages are fat and juicy. Also you can substitute them for turkey sausages.  They make great sandwhiches. They only thing stopping me from giving it a five is the fact that sometimes it gets so full I've had to leave like twice because of the wait times and that's usually just Sundays. Other than that awesome place!!! Check it out

30.description: A great breakfast spot at a reasonable price. Nothing fancy but it's a great diner with tasty traditional breakfasts. It's perfect for friends, family or kids if you want a quick bite to get you started.

46.description: Ugh, $9.50 for a Denver omelet w/ cheese, hash brown and a couple pieces of toast. We're talking about breakfast, right? Here's the kicker, when I opened the container, I had not only a half order of hash browns, but they were overcooked and extra crispy.  You'd think for what they charge, you'd get some decent food. Sadly, no. I usually go to their location on California and Milwaukee (never had a bad meal there) and order their "$3.99 meal deal before 9am", but they were closed for remodeling.  Here at this location the "before 9am deal" is $4.99. It was past that time but I figured how much more could it be. DOUBLE!  Wish I went with my gut and hit the ol' Breakfast diner on Armitage and Cicero instead.

1.description: What can I say.. This place has delicious meals. Usually get the chilaquiles verdes. Really spicy served with rice and beans plus carne asada.Nice flavored with a good variety of food. Today I tried the Hawaiian Omelette recommended by the waiter. Bacon, pineapple and mozzarella cheese melted inside. Great balance! So good and can't wait to try the other omelettes.Our server was very attentive and the wait time was not bad. The only downside to this place is the parking. The lot is always full but they have a 2nd parked next to the restaurant. Seems like a very popular place for the area and they stay very busy.Wish I could visit more often!

55.description: Awesome food ! I'm in love with breakfast it's my favorite meal of the day and this place especially :D So I thought I should try working here as a part time job. I never got called which is ok. I'm still an addict of this place .. I'm not going to stop going. I just don't understand why they're always running short on their cashier staff . I don't want to sound like an upset unemployed costumer I just don't understand why they're always looking for people to work and then get applicants and never call them back. And this year alone at least every month I've seen their wanted sign up. :( kinda sad I love the food industry and working with people is my strength . Anyway I'm not saying this because of myself I've had family and friends told me that they've applied there too and never gotten called. My dad worked with the company so does my uncle. He's still in the company. But anyway Cozy corner you guys are great! Like I said I love the food ! It's the hiring managers that need to realize you need to hire people diversely not just the ones they like ..... Other than that can't wait to be back there soon !

9.description: Not the tastiest food but pretty decent. I definitely don't see why the long wait sometimes but I'm assuming it's because there's really no other breakfast spot around .Double check your phone orders ! And I have patience when calling in.

26.description: My family and I have been coming in here for the last 12 months and it's always a great experience! We usually come for breakfast/brunch hours during the week...there's never a long wait and the staff is always nice , fast and friendly. Everything on the menu is delicious, big portions, and reasonable prices. Our server today was Victor, he was super professional, attentive, and friendly! Victor you rock!!..and thank you  for the great service! :)

25.description: I came in from out of town and heard this specific location was a must. I went on a weekend and it was a little busy but counter space was available so there wasn't an issue. The servers all seemed pleasant and the french toast stuffed with cheesecake was ridiculously good. The only bad thing is knowing there isn't a Cozy Corner in Las Vegas. This place is a must for breakfast.

12.description: I always come here for breakfast. This morning I checked online if there were open. It said yes, from 6am to 4 pm. I show up and it's closed. Why put a false   statement online. Getting my hopes up for that meat lovers skillet I won't be having this morning.

59.description: Ordered a veggie breakfast, it was cooked just right. Many places either cook the vegies too long or not long enough. So I was impressed when I didn't have any complaint. Price is a 2 thumbs up, coffee is better than Ihop! Parking is so convenient, servers are attentive.

21.description: Pretty much my favorite restaurant. The food is made quick and is delicious. Occasionally I've had a bad waitress who is slow or doesn't check on the table but usually they have great customer service. The only con is that this place gets full quickly!! But it's to be expected, like said it's a great place.

17.description: Your classic Dennys. Nothing about this place stood out. It was very basic and offered pretty much the same food you would find at any other traditional breakfast spot (ie. iHop, Dennys, Golden Nugget, etc.) I highly regret going here. I would have much rather have gone to a non-chain restaurant with at least something original on the menu. The only plus side was that the total bill was only $19.

10.description: Service is OK, food is awesome... But by far the best thing from this Cozy Corner is Blanca! She makes your visit the most pleasant of all! SHE IS NEVER IN A BAD MOOD NO MATTER WHAT DAY IT IS, Whatever time or if it's packed or not! She is ALWAYS Courteous, Energetic, Friendly! This woman puts this Cozy Corner on the map! I come to this location and this location ONLY because of her!! #teamblanca

5.description: Cozy corner is a gem. The breakfast menu is amazing. Anything you order is yummy. My personal favorite is the Razzle Dazzle waffle with raspberries, strawberries and blueberries. The fruit was fresh and the waffle was crisp. Pancakes and French toast also are great. Absolutely will be back again for more

3.description: I've been here quite a few times, and it's definitely a gem. It's a great place to go for a quick delicious breakfast. They are only open for breakfast and lunch. And I can't speak towards how their lunch is, but if it's breakfast your looking for then your in the right spot. I am not a huge Pancake person, but when I do have a taste for pancakes I want to go to the right place. This place cures my pancake cravings every time, they're fluffy and delicious. They will continue to be my go to breakfast place.

35.description: Great food and unbeatable prices!  I haven't tried something I didn't like yet.  The Santa Fe salad with the cilantro dressing is my new obsession.  And the half soup/half sandwich combo is the perfect amount of food.  Get the chili - you won't regret it.

19.description: Love the abuelita skillet, the chilaquiles, & the banana, strawberry, & nutella crepes. simply to die for!!

28.description: There are two cozy corner restaurants.  This location is FAR superior.  Why? The employees. ..they're old fashioned Chicagoans who 'get it.'They're happy and genuinely concerned about not only the customers, but their fellow man/woman. They smile, talk ask questions like, "How's your day?"Therefore, it makes your day better and you're happy to go back to 4356 W. Diversey. On the other hand the cozy corner on Milwaukee Avenue hired a NON Chicagoan and she's the 'host.' She has the personality of a 'doorknob' and she works the customers like a factory worker (who hates their job), works the assembly line. The reviews for the Milwaukee cozy corner reflect these comments.I've been to the cozy corner twenty times on Milwaukee ave (never once saw the 'doorknob' smile). She (doorknob) has made snotty ignorant comments on several occasions, in front of customers. There's one owner for both locations...a nice enough fellow named, Peter. Someone needs to tell him about the 'doorknob' he has hosting the cozy corner on Milwaukee Avenue. I live a half mile from Milwaukee Avenue cozy corner and 3 miles from 4356 W. Diversey cozy corner.  But I'll drive the 3 miles to stay away from the 'doorknob.'---------They did get rid of the doorknob, finally. They said she got a job as a bean counter, where she was better suited...versus dealing with human beings who are paying her salary. Rumor has it, she gets along much better with the beans than she did with cozy corner customers and her co-workers.

45.description: I have visited this location a handful of time and it was just okay, it wasn't the greatest but it did the trick. A week or so ago I ordered the Veggie Skillet and I picked it up (didn't eat at location) went back to work to enjoy my meal so I thought. I am eating my breakfast and a few bights into it I realized there was a NASTY HAIR in my food. Of course I stopped eating and called the location, to my surprise they offered me a new meal anytime I wanted it. At first I was thinking nope not going to do that again but I wanted to give them another shot. I ordered the same thing again today but this time they screw the order up. I am beyond disappointed at this point and will never ever give them my business again. If your smart you'll stay away. Oh I forgot to mention this was the second time I found hair in my food!!!!!!!!!!!!!

33.description: The food is just ok, for any morning you really don't feel like cooking yeah it's eatable but not wow so I was ok with eating in or picking up food however the last time I ordered a skillet to go which comes with salsa tell me why the manager charged me an extra dollar when I asked for extra salsa to go?!?!!! What the heck!!! So you're telling me I can have all the salsa I want only if I eat it but if I'm doing take out you charge me for the extra salsa?!! As if the freaking salsa were amazing, NO IT IS NOT so get your act straight management I AM DEFINITELY NOT paying for extra salsa... and no it's not about the $1 it's the trying make money at any cost, next time friends suggest your place I will suggest another and spread the word.

43.description: I love breakfast at this place. They give you a ton of food for a reasonable price. Only problem i have is waiting in line for seating because they do not accept reservations.

2.description: I have been to this location various times and I have learned that day and time is very important. As any good breakfast place, weekends are always particularly busy so do expect there to be a wait time. On a typical weekday you will be seated right away. The staff is very friendly and attentive. On my last visit I ordered the Vegetable Omelette with cheese. It comes with either a side of fruit or hash browns. You also get to pick if you want toast or pancakes. I went for the pancakes and the hash browns this time around. I always and for my hash browns well done and I always receive them just to my liking.

18.description: I stumbled across this diner while looking for a place to kill some time on a Sunday morning.  I lucked out and found a parking spot right in front (their parking lot fills up fast on a weekend morning!) The line for seating was out the door and down the block. I walked in to give my name and saw open spots at the counter.  Sweet!  No waiting to sit at the counter - this is a great option if you don't have a group.I'd never been here before, so I asked my server what she recommended.  She asked if I wanted savory or sweet and I had to go for sweet.  Her choice was the stuffed pancakes or french toast and I picked the Cheesecake Stuffed French Toast with eggs and bacon.  Service was fast and friendly and I love that they have flavored creamers for the coffee.When the food arrived, I had to take a picture of it.  It was as good as it looked. The sweet cheese stuffing in the french toast was much more like a cannoli filling than cheesecake but it was delicious, with just the right amount of strawberries on top.  My eggs were cooked perfectly and the bacon was crispy, the way I like it.The only complaint I have is minor - I had trouble getting my server's attention to get my bill, since she was swamped at the cash register.  I recommend getting there either very early (they open at 6) or around lunch time.  The mid morning after church crowd is tremendous and if you have a group, you'll wait at least 30 minutes at peak time.

41.description: I love the Cream of Broccoli and Cream of Chicken with Rice Soups served on Mondays and Tuesdays.

52.description: This place is amazing! this is my go to spot on Sundays  for brunch. Their coffee is not the best but it's decent, but my husband prepares it to make it extra delicious.  He makes it just right. We always try to order different things, but I usually go for their chilaquiles rojos which are thee bomb! If not, the fiesta skillet is just as awesome! He usually gets the crepes de cajeta combo. The staff is always friendly and we've never had to wait more than 20 mins to be seated. I give this place 2 thumbs up! Keep up the great work cozy corner!

50.description: I'm really struggling to understand how this place is rated so highly...!  I've only visited once and I'll try one more time just to see if it's worth revising this review, but I was unimpressed.  The place looks really cute from the outside and it's awesome that they have a parking lot, but that's about where the pro list ended for me.  My boyfriend got the corned beef and hash with eggs and the moment he took his first bite he made a face and a "thumbs down" - I took my first bite in my Greek omelet to find zero flavor, and the hash browns were equally bland.  I did get chocolate chip pancakes and they were delicious...but those are pretty impossible to mess up.  There was plenty of seating but with the set up and non-carpeting it was SO loud.  The diner was far from full and we were struggling to hear each other.  The service was decent but not overly friendly or attentive, food was cheap but still not worth it, and both of us left thinking about how much better our next meal will be, regardless of where we went.  I'll give this place another try just to see if I'm being too harsh, but I'm in no rush to revisit...

4.description: Great food,  awesome coffee, comfortable seating,  and fast service.  Had the Mexican omelet and my girlfriend had the 222. Both dishes were very tasty and cooked just like we asked. No complaints and all impressed.

6.description: I was in the crave of sweet and salty so decided to order the cranberry walnut grilled chicken salad and it was perfect! I love this place- good prices, big portion :)

22.description: My go to when I'm hungover on a Sunday.  Grab the country skillet (hash browns, cheese, your choice of eggs, country fried steak, country gravy, with a side of toast).  A little too much hash browns for me, but I just don't it all of it.  Service is quick with a smile, food is consistent.  I've told two of my friends about this place as well, and they walked out happy and full of delicious breakfast food.  Fair warning though, that Sunday church/family crowd pack this place quick in the morning.  But every other morning, I've only had to wait 5 minutes max.  I miss this place already writing this review.

15.description: My only complaint is that sometimes it's hard to get a seat but worth the wait. The food is good and they pay attention to my special orders I have never had to send anything back. The staff (though busy) is friendly and attentive. If you are looking for good diner food I would recommend this restaurant.

57.description: When you're good you're good!  What else is there to say...  This place is so good and by the looks of the line, it shows.  Doesn't take long to get seated, so don't let that stop you from checking it out. The service if spot on and the food even better.

20.description: Love the abuelita skillet, the chilaquiles, & the banana, strawberry, & nutella crepes. simply to die for!!

36.description: I have had so many things on the menu. I love the Red chilaquilles no meat (green are too tangy for me) Cheesecake french toast is very good. The Tortilla Soup on Thursdays is delish. Skillets are good. oh and the Country Fried Steak is very good. Service is always good Iv never had any problems.

14.description: I travel from Peoria to Oak Park about once a month to visit my daughter's family. My grandkids - ages 6 and 8 - and I made a project of trying a different restaurant for breakfast each trip for a few months. We would rate the individual breakfast items, service and atmosphere. Cozy Corner scored highest in all categories and was awarded 5/5 points from both the kids and me. The whole family as been there since and my daughter and her husband agreed with our findings. Great food, generous portions, terrific service and the big windows make for an airy and open atmosphere. We found other places to be good at this or that but the Cozy Corner did everything well.

1.description: Paid for convenience and not quality!I ordered from this place because it was down the street, although the prices really turned me off. I took a chance and I must say WOW, never gonna make that mistake again! I feel that this place is trying hard to be a more upscale place than regular taquerias, but I feel that they need to work on their food quality before presentation. So here's what brought them down:1. They put my horchata in a bag where it easily spilled and the paper and bag fell apart.2. The horchata was not horchata. I've had gallons of horchata in my lifetime and something just tastes off about it. I can't put my finger on it...maybe because it tastes more milky than rice water. Idk.3. Anyone who knows me knows my absolute fav is mexican rice. Epic fail. The race had absolutely no taste to it. It's like they didnt even add salt either. Just terrible.4. The tortas were made like small burgers. I wouldn't even call these tortas they had ingredients that do not come in traditional tortas and they used a type of bread that absolutely did not help the taste of the "torta"As a plus my fiance did feel the taco tasted good, but neither of us could finish the "torta" and rice we purchased. It was an expensive test run and we won't be going back. Sorry.

2.description: Very good food. The queso fundido is more fundido than queso, but was still very good with a lingering kick. The complimentary chips and salsa was fresh, and the salsa was the most flavorful I've had although also the least spicy.

0.description: I've been here 3 times, and each time the food has been better than expected. I think it is really delicious, fresh, lots of veggies, etc. The reason I'm not giving it a 5 is because the service has been slow for me each time. Granted yesterday I was part of a group of 7, but we were the only ones in the restaurant. We were there for lunch and it took over an hour. Our orders were pretty simple also. A few tacos, a couple of orders of nachos, that's about it.I'll go back, but only if I have extra time to kill.

12.description: I had a scratch on my eye and i called at 9am. I got in there around 9:20 and I did have to wait for about 20 minutes.The Doctor was very Nice. I had a scratch on my Cornea and she prescribed some anti-biotic. I was very happy with this office. I usually go to Tropical Optical but Im coming here from now on, The woman at the front desk also said to bring my daughter back so they can fix her glasses. Her name was Karla, she was very nice. I will most definetly be returning to Spex!!!!

7.description: Doctors are overbooked and literally rushing through appointments. I had to get fitted 3 times in order to finally get my prescription right. All 3 times I came out with completely different prescriptions and if I wouldn't have said anything, they would've just let me go. I went in February and it's now mid-April and they still haven't order my lenses. Please don't waste your time.

3.description: I came to Spex on a recommendation of friends who had been to the Oak Park location.  Here's a quick rundown of my experience:1. When I asked the optometrist for a prescription of the same brand of contacts, she told me it was old technology and the brand was being discontinued.  Looking into it, it's not.  I had to call back and have the prescription changed.  She then did not write the diameter on the prescription and had to call again.2. Optometrist was texting while examining me.  Picked up my glasses and the prescription was wrong.  When I returned for the follow-up appointment, I started to say that something was off with the glasses.  The optometrist said to me, "Well, you are 44....." So I need bifocals, yes.  But if she hadn't been texting during the appointment, perhaps the conversation could have happened then and the question of my age would not have come into play.  She was just awful.The women at the front counter were really great and helpful, but they did not make up the entirety  of the experience.  When I called their headquarters to talk about my experience, they apologized profusely, but it also doesn't take away the experience.  There are better choices for service, in Chicago, for eyewear.

1.description: This was my first time at Spex and I will definitely be coming every year going forward. They provides excellent service and everyone was very friendly and accommodating. Also, they have a very good selection of frames!!

2.description: I've been going here for 2 years now and the staff is great. They've looked into my insurance to ensure I am getting the right coverage. Plus they have a great selection of frames!

9.description: Great service  very knowledgeable staff . I've been going there for many years I highly recommend

18.description: Fucking rip off. Ok so i go in there for a check up er w/e. i see the doctor, she asks me if i need any more contacts i tell her no i would order them off line b/c they are cheaper. She then asks me if i brought my glasses. I told her i never got glasses because i would never wear them if i had them. She then rudley says well what if I told you that you had an eye infection and couldnt wear your contacts for a month. To which i responded well then i guess im going to be blind for a month b/c im not gonna wear glasses.So i get an exam and everything and they charge me 80 something dollars for it. then the lady asks me if i want to place an order for more contacts. I respond no online is cheeper. She then responds to me that I will not be able to order offline because I didnt get their contacts test, and when the place i order from calls for approval they will decline me. So i ask them well what did i just get a test for and they tell me you were tested for glasses. WTF! well i tell them i need an contacts test or w/e also. I wait again. then i go into the office she looks in my left eye asks me to blink then the same with my right. She then tells me they fite fine. Well no shit they fit fine ive been wearing contacts for about 2 years. So after that 10 second exam i exit the examining room and the receptionist prints me out another $100 dollar bill. Are you fucking serious 100 bucks for that shit that i didnt need? I ask what it was for and she responded "You pay for the chair time." really? gtfo  never going there again.

10.description: Oh " The Horror, The Horror." Thank you Joseph Conrad for the most adequate quote in which to describe my experience at Spex on Diversey. As this is the first truly sub-par review I have written, let me keep it as concise as possible. Initial visit=OK My insurance takes a month to approve one's eyewear. Fine. Spex received  my glasses, at which point they sat at their location for 20 days. Bad. They said they "tried to call could not get hold of you.." At which point they then sent a postcard to THEMSELVES with my home as the return address. YES. The postcard was returned to sender- me?!?! When I phoned I explained the most ridiculous situation I have ever encountered to the manager. I then asked for my glasses to be shipped overnight. She refused. Trust me on this one: Save yourself a journey into " The Heart of Darkness" and avoid this place at all costs. Tragic!

13.description: I took my 3 year old daughter here for her very first eye exam.  The staff was very nice and Carla (Karla?) was really great and fun with my daughter.  We were in and out of our appointment and I was happy with a very smooth checkup for my little one.  Thank you Spex!

16.description: I've been going here since I was 12 back when this was still just dr lieberman and assoc. Now its spex, while the new paint job outside and out make it look chic, that ranch style wood bar interior still exists. The docotors here have always been nice and will usually work with you.  You just need to tell them your situation i.e. spending limit, no insurance, contacts or glasses etc. I usually get glasses and contacts but today I only went in for glasses. The lady that helped me wasnt too pushy at all. She just checked what I had on my previous prescription such as scratch resistant and asked if i wanted the same things. She also broke down how the price would change if I wanted to add any other special coatings and such. Price including the frame lenses (my eyes are really bad) and special coatings at retail was $577 but after my vsp insurance I only paid $167 out of pocket thats $410 less! I also wanted contacts but since I exhausted my allowances on the glasses I was qouted a $133 contacts eye exam plus the cost of the contacts which at the time the lady didnt want to go into detail. She simply stated that "we'll talk about it some more when I come back and decide to get them".... which made me feel they didnt want to be bothered with questions pertaining to a service your not purchasing at the time...so im giving the rating one less star other than that I had a great experience. And I will be back for that contacts exam in a few weeks and will update on that experience.

17.description: Issue was resolved after a call from my insurance. The administration seems to be open about discussing any complaints.

15.description: This office used to be called Lieberman Daniel Dr & Associates. I've been there once and I don't think I'm going back. It looked kinda dingy before with all the wood paneling. Now it looks better in Spex colors, but still far from hip. I wanted to get glasses, but after checking out their selection and prices, I changed my mind. They didn't have a good selection of frames and I couldn't find a decent one for under $400!  This office is way overpriced in my opinion. Exam and year supply of cheap contacts cost me with vsp insurance $225 (w/o $475). I used to paid the same with out insurance at Americas Best. BTW Spex does give you a yearly supply of contact solution, the only catch is that you can get only two 3 oz. sample containers at a time. Not so convenient. Bottom line, if you like nice doc, ok front desk, dingy feel and overpaying, this place is for you!

0.description: I have been coming to spex for several years.  They always provide great service and the receptionist are very friendly and accommodating.

5.description: The location is clean and everybody was friendly and helpful!  Also they do accept medicaid :)

11.description: I have been driving past this location every day and never thought of stopping.  I had exhausted all the typical chains and even a boutique frame place. - Didn't see anything different.....stopped on Friday on my way home from work only to find they were closed.....but went back on Saturday and so glad I did.  All three ladies working the front office were welcoming and helpful.  I ended up working with Karla, she assessed my choices with honesty.  Since I am a decision making challenged person- the other two ladies and even a customer helped to nail down the perfect pair.  Karla then worked well at  explaining how my insurance worked and broke down all steps of the pricing.  Now I'm not going to lie....I do wish they were a little less, but I guess that is the price at most places.   I can not wait to pick them up!!!!  Great customer service and cool frames......I love that they let you look - and when your ready for advice step in with their expert advice.

8.description: I've been coming to this location for about 7 years and every year they are very friendly and professional. Every doctor I've seen has been really nice and happy to answer my questions regarding eye health and biology.

4.description: I've been going to this office since it was Dr. Lieberman's. I honestly don't notice the decor - I go for the quality of the eye care and the customer service. Everyone there has always been great. It can be a little pricey but I get very reliable eye care, the doctors always answer my questions and provide suggestions for healthy eye care, and I feel like the staff who help with frames are wonderful. They give suggestions for frames but never pushed me to pick something I didn't want. I'm always happy with the frames I select, and can stop by for adjustments at any time.

14.description: Not a big fan.  I have totally decent vision insurance and it still cost me almost $500 to get new glasses and contacts here.  Their frames are ridiculously expensive compared to a place like Lenscrafters, and they wouldn't let me buy less than 6 months' worth of contacts, which I thought was completely bogus (I wanted to get just a couple months' worth at the time since I had to shell out major money for the glasses).  The ladies who work there are all very nice, but the office itself is kind of dated and dingy.  Overall, I wasn't impressed with the experience.

6.description: Bought a pair of glasses here. The manager was very pushy about having me purchase lenses and getting an eye exam. I told her I only needed frames my lenses are a week old and I just received a eye exam. She then tried selling me on sunglasses. Lady! I only need frames! Finally got them. Gave her my insurance info. Everything cleared and paid. TWO days later, the Manger calls me and says I need to come back in ASAP and pay an additional $15 dollars. Because she made a mistake and my insurance didn't cove the $15. Lady! It's your mistake. Take it as a Loss and you figure out a way to fix the $15 dollar mistake on the $250 frames I just bought. Please Google customer service and figure out how to make a repeat customer. Your not doing a very good job!

3.description: Good caldo de pollo (Mexican style chicken soup)...but if you stop in definitely try their steak gorditas!   Freshly made orange juice is great when you feel under the weather.

1.description: Okay, so I have been coming here with my family since i can remember. MANY, MANY, MANY years. I've seen all the changes over time. It was our FAMILY restaurant. Every Christmas morning we spent there. When i was smaller, I would go with my parents and now i go with my boyfriend and his kids. One of the waitresses still asks me how my parents are. Many months ago, while having dinner with the kids, we noticed a group of gangbangers walk in and pretty much run the place. They even went into the kitchen and made it clear to the chef, to make sure he gave them the good meat. The owners son even said "what's up" to them as if they were friends. This has always been a family restaurant to me and at that moment i knew it was time to go. The whole feeling of the place just left us uncomfortable. I gave it the benefit of the doubt because we knew the owners and everything and just brushed it off.Over the next couple of times, we noticed we kept getting charged differently. The same meal would basically fluctuate from high to low. In conversation with a friend he said he had noticed that they would add in the tip without telling you (that's why they never give you a receipt). I still didn't believe it, I mean I can basically say I grew up there!!Then i went again, same meal we always have with my boyfriend and kids, something that cost us $40 ended up at $60!!!! I mean that's more than Chilis!!!! and this is a hole in the wall place!!! So I was clearly upset and vowed to NEVER go there again!!!!I went again last night, i love the place the food is DECENT, NOT SPECTACULAR, but convenient, fast, and good, sio i gave it another shot. Well i had the usual which would cost about $20 for just me and the boyfriend, well it ended up being $30 and i physically seen him put in $14.99 for my plate which in the menu was only $11.99. So i got charged basically for the steak plate instead of what i ordered because i noticed the steak plate was $14.99. so what if i did order the steak plate!?!?! Was he going to charge $19.99??!?! Granted, yes, it does say in the menu that prices are subject to change without notice, but damnnnn!!! are they catering it to how much $ they want today! At that the son drives a nice custom truck!!! Must be what i paid for, so can i drive it too?? So yes it is good food, but make sure BEFORE you order if that is what they plan on charging you and ALWAYS ask for a receipt!!!! Make them make you one!!So, as for me and my family, i'm OFFICIALLY DONE, with this place!!!!! They just PERMANENTLY LOST a good maybe 15-20 customers!!

2.description: I been coming here before they change their name ( they changed it cause three blocks down there was another restaurant with the exact name ) I been coming here since I was 5. I remember this place only having 7 booths! Was super hard to sit and it. The day they completed a full on dinning place was like the best day of my life. I go here one ever two weeks. The owner,waitress and one cook knows my whole family. This is my favorite restaurant. I've brought numerous dates here and none of them are mexicans.  They've all loved it. Guaranteed if you go, you'll go back. If you drive, screw the parking meter. I've never paid for it since they put them up three years ago.

5.description: I go here regularly for lunch. One of the main reasons I started going (besides the fact that the greasy, nasty, [but super tasty!] hillbilly [it's ok, I'm one too] joint with the poker machines [that actually paid out!] that used to be here closed) is because when they 1st opened I realized that it is only a one story building and, with no apartments upstairs, that significantly cuts down on the cockroach possibility. And, for once, my theory seems to have been correct. Yes, the food is good. Yes, the service is good. YES!!! It's clean!! And I take comfort in that.

6.description: Am I surprised I'm the first to review.  No, not really.  A cursory glance of the restaurant during my meal, I could tell that none of these patrons were Yelpers nor did they require someone to tell them where to get some good Mexican food in Hermosa.Once I entered, I was quickly greeted with confusion.  Is it sit down and order or counter order and take it to your table.  Looking at the tables, the one piece four-person metal and laminate wood tables, I thought it was the order at the counter process, but I was wrong.  But the super friendly hostess / cashier let me order with her anyways.   I ordered breakfast for lunch which consisted of three over medium eggs coated with some non-spicy sauce, a few thinly sliced steak strips with a side of beans, lettuce, tomato and rice.  The name of the meal escapes me, but I believe it was the house breakfast specialty because 'Poncitlan' was in the name of the dish.  Service was quick, food was hot and the telenovela on the tube was dramatic.  What else could you want?Maybe some damn delicious chips and spicy salsa.  Don't miss out.  They make it in the restaurant.  Worth every cent (free, comes with the meal.)

7.description: I love the food at this place and the service is just as great. The best thing to order are the steak Gorditas. They are so good. They also have chicken, al pastor and cheese Gorditas. Nice small place to have a fast bite with friends, family, or your significant other. Very laid back environment with subtle decorations. I totally recommend it. There is no parking available so you will have to park out on the streets. I suggest that unless you're planning on eating inside, you order your food fifteen minutes before picking it up. This way you're not driving around searching for a parking spot.

0.description: I've been eating at this family owned business for 15 years, since it was a small hole in the wall named Lindo Poncitlan , and on past their expansion and name change. I like this place for a couple solid reasons. First reason being it is a very clean restaurant. It is consistently good and taco dinner is cheap. They have the best chips and salsa in my opinion and sometimes go in just for an order to go. If you are a fan of local, quality family owned business and this is definitely one of them!!

4.description: The food is better than average, but expect to be frustrated with the waitresses and the people who take your order over the phone. I have ordered from them twice (nothing complicated - enchiladas with no beans), and both times the order was messed up. Considering that there is a better option just a block away, or the other great Mexican restaurants in Logan Square, I will not go here again.

1.description: I stumbled into these guys at pitchfork festival and have been a big fan ever since. The first thing I bought was the Black and Tan soap bar. Lets just say if they could find a way to offer samples of how it smells over the internet, it would always be sold out. I bought it for a friend who is a beer lover but we ended up keeping it because it smelled so good. We did end up getting the chicago flag soap the next time and gave that as a gift, though.The owner, Jack, spent some time explaining to me how they do business and what they are all about, and that really makes a difference to me. Definitely a local company I am proud to support.

0.description: This review is for the Internet site, as I've not ever seen these guys in person or at their storefront. I picked up a coupon from a groupon-type site to try the shampoo/conditioner no-bottle gift set. Vegan, not tested on animals, environmentally friendly hair care? Sure, sounds great!The products shipped quickly and came in a cute gift box. I didn't get around to using them for a bit, as I had other products already opened, but today I cracked open the plastic wrap and gave them a try.First off, the smell is just *divine*. I was in love when I started lathering up the shampoo.  It's weird to feel like you're washing your hair with a bar of soap, but that's where the similarity ends. This stuff bubbled like crazy and the smell was amazing (yet not overpowering).  It rinsed out cleanly and my hair felt squeeky clean.The conditioner bar also lathered up like soap, which I found very odd. I was originally wondering how it would work as a bar, but it actually did ok. It too smalled wonderful. I was a bit less pleased with the end results of the conditioner as it didn't do well for detangling, but the overall feel of my hair afterwards made up for it. I had to use a bit of moisturizer spray to get a comb through afterwards, but I was still happy with the final result.I'd be quite happy to purchase more of their products as I need to restock. Their website says they're distributed at Whole Foods as well as given the option to shop online from their site. The site doesn't indicate the shipping cost until you fill in your information though. I'll be checking my local Whole Foods to see if they're available, as I can support their cause and ethical practices.

3.description: Dirty, smelly, overpriced, and rude people.

1.description: This is a neighborhood-sized grocery store.  There are better and bigger Cermak Produce locations in the city, so I don't recommend you to make a point coming here if you don't live in or near Hermosa.  Nevertheless, you can still find quality fresh produce regardless.  I personally don't suggest shopping there on Tuesday evenings.  The new promotion starts on Wednesday, so whatever was left may not be as fresh as what they had at the beginning of the about-to-go-away promo.  Yes, I used some retail jargon and I've been conditioned to say that since I manage a retail business at the mall.  Whatever I said on the previous paragraph may just be my mere observation.  It may not be absolutely true, but it doesn't hurt to share my opinion with all of you since it's what Yelp is supposed to be used for.  We purchased a dozen medium eggs ($1.79 since there weren't any large or jumbo eggs left), pears ($0.79/lb; $2.16), green seedless grapes ($0.89/lb; $1.39...great price), tomatoes ($0.79/lb; $1.88), cucumbers (3 for $1), and apples ($0.79/lb; $4.23).  The total after tax was $13.74.  I'm not eager to go back to this location, but Cermak Produce is always one of my recommended grocery stores in the city.

2.description: Great selection of any type of fresh produce!!! I don't go anywhere else!!! They have anything you need.

0.description: My favorite Spanish grocery store in this area, hands down. I believe the owners are Greek and they definitely know how to run a business. Typically when I walk into a Spanish food store the first thing to hit me is the stench of the butcher department. The last thing I wanna smell while shopping for fruit is rooting pig flesh and no matter what Spanish market I go to I always hate the smell. NOT this Cermak Produce. This is the cleanest grocery store in the neighborhood with some of the freshest fruits and veggies you will find. Th prices here are a bit higher in comparison to other Spanish Markets in the neighborhood, but the quality of the meat and produce and the cleanliness of this grocery establishment makes the price totally worth it. Very often I go to the butcher department and I see them removing all the meat and sanitizing the display case. I was very pleased to see that because I had never seen it done and it made me feel like the food I was about to purchase and cook will be safe for me to serve my family. I am a BIG FAN of clean establishments and especially when it comes to food its a make or break for me. I will always only shop at this Spanish Grocer as long as I live in the Hermosa or Logan Square neighborhood.

4.description: This store has a wide selection of veggies and fruits, and a great meat counter. Specializes in hispanic grocery products. I usually get their specials - good prices on meats, sometimes on eggs, too.

58.description: We decided to try FBR based on the generally positive Yelp reviews. Now, I cannot say anything better than 4 stars because this was my first "adult" furniture shopping experience and it is hard to say if I got a good deal or did everything right, but for the four stars I'm giving, I think they did great.The positive:The couch got in early.Delivery was on time.They took the old couch away for free! (Not their usual practice.)The couch is very comfortable and we love it!Super easy to use the Yelp coupon.The negative:We had a lot of questions about couch construction that they just couldn't answer and had to spend a lot of time looking up online. During delivery, the paint on our front door frame got pretty wrecked.All of the couches are custom orders, so to an extent you are trying out what is there and then hoping for the best. The so-so: We think the price was good. It was definitely within what I was prepared to spend and the couch is really delightful. Overall, if we had to go couch shopping again? We'd totally go back. It was basically a good experience.

56.description: The staff is awesome!  They are honest about what is available and what takes time to deliver based on your wants and needs.  I walked in sore from sleeping on the floor and left with a mattress, with the owner [because I walked to the store], who delivered my mattress right then. Tony, I am so glad you are in Chicago!  I am sure LA misses you, but I am glad that you are here and have helped me!

29.description: My boyfriend and I had a great experience with Far Below Retail.  They have great furniture for excellent prices.  We got a 93" sectional for $800 and we love it!  Delivery was set up for the next day, was seemless and they were right on time! I would recommend this place to anyone looking for affordable furniture!

42.description: I showed up in Chicago without any furniture and came here in search of a bed, so I walked into the store not really knowing what I wanted or needed, but Tony and Erin were both extremely helpful and very friendly. After they gave me a brief tour of the store, they let me explore at my own pace (and even offered drinks) without ever pressuring me to make a purchase. I ended up buying a mattress that day and I was able to get the mattress delivered early the next day. Overall my experience with FBR was a positive one. I might have been able to get a lower priced mattress or found a bigger selection elsewhere, but great customer service is often hard to come by.

23.description: Erin and Michael were incredibly down-to-earth and helpful. My boyfriend and I waltzed in right before closing on a Sunday, told them exactly what we were looking for, and within minutes they had found us a good couch at a great price. They even offered us beverages and a place to store our recently-bought groceries so we could take our time choosing. We had gone to Roy's Furniture TWICE, but they had nothing in stock that we liked. Far Below Retail is a small little store, but they have quality items and more in the back. When Mark came the next day to deliver our couch, he was careful and fast. At first it didn't look like the couch would fit in our apartment doorway, but he tried various angles and eased it in, put it together and left. I've never seen such a pro-- thank you Mark!

47.description: We were looking for a deal on a desk for our apartment and I found this place on Yelp.  They were open later on a Saturday and when we got there, although there wasn't a huge showroom, the deal is there are catalogues with many pieces of furniture to choose from.  They go to their warehouse every Tuesday to pick up items that were ordered, and they either deliver or you can pick it up.  Well, small showroom didn't bother me a bit.  I found the PERFECT cofee table for our new sectional and it was a good price, as well, considering that it folded up so that you could use it to eat dinner at or play cards at the couch, but also folds back down to normal coffee table height.  I can't wait until it gets delivered.  There's usually a delivery fee.  Let me just say that the customer service is extraordinary and to me, that's something I truly value.  I want to know people appreciate my busines and they, for sure, do!  Please support them the next time you're in the market for furniture.

8.description: We moved to a high-rise condo in Chicago earlier this year from the suburbs in San Diego and found Far Below Retail on Yelp.  Allison, Erin and Tony spent a lot of time with us helping to select the right pieces for our condo.  They were patient and had some fun ideas for us.  Here are a few photos - black end table, couch and rug are all from FBR.  Great people, great company to do business with!

31.description: This place couldn't be better. Erin is the best! We were in the market for a sleeper sofa for a new second bedroom. We couldn't decide if we wanted to go with a cheapy one or get a nicer one for when guests stay. We had looked all around at the big furniture stores and had a couple of "finalists" in mind.
