11.description: This restaurant quickly became my favorite Mexican restaurant the first time I visited, replacing...what was it called?  It doesn't matter, this place is TOPS.  I work close by and so I come here regularly for my steak tacos and/or cheese quesadillas.  Parking is available in the back off the alley behind Armitage, but it does become congested at times.  Parking is almost always available for a fee of course on Armitage (Pay To Park). The complimentary salsa they serve is simply the best salsa I have ever had, period.  It is hot, so beware!  Plenty of freshly-chopped jalapenos and cilantro, it goes down great with any of the main dishes.  As I mentioned, I love their steak tacos, and this is one of the only places where you won't find fatty peices of gristle.  Order a Mexican Coca Cola out of a glass bottle (natural sugar in place of high fructose corn syrup) to top off the experience. The waitress staff is very helpful and cheerful.

8.description: they never skimp on meat, possibly the fattest tacos i've ever had

3.description: This used to be the place to go when Pedro was the owner, ever since his kids have taken over its just a shame. The prices have gone up, the drinks aren't all that tasty, and the staff is just rude.! I grew up coming here every sunday after church and let me just tell you it has gone just down to the gutter. Never again will i step foot in this place. The tacos arent what they used to be. Thanks but no thanks going down the street to the other taco place, BYE.

14.description: The best carne asada in town!

4.description: Food is good but the service and attitude of waitress is the worse i have ever experienced

0.description: An excellent sample of Puerto Rican culture! Fun for the whole family: it's got dance, singing, events and more. The interior is lovely, with really nice paintings and murals! I highly encourage people from the area and those visiting to Coke give this place a shot, it's really worth it.

1.description: I really love this place super nice . The owner doesn't speak that much but her job is great! She's very detailed with her job.

9.description: Totally inconvenient to be called to reschedule an appointment. Pointless for me to even buy groupons if  making an appointment is so time and effort consuming .

23.description: Really nice and clean place. The lady that attended us was super nice and patient.  She took her time. They offer beverages as you walk in.  I got a mani pedi and the work really good!

12.description: The owner clearly resents groupon customers even though she has made a deal with groupon to get customers.  She gave me attitude the first time I went to get mani-pedi on the groupon. Then when i called to schedule my second (unfortunately, i bought a package of 3 mani-pedis), after confirming I could come in at certain time, once she finds out I'm a repeat groupon customer, she tells me the time slot is suddenly not available. I tell her that she just told me it was available and then she says, it's not available anymore because you are a groupon customer and tells me I can come in only on specific times. I tell her that's not what the groupon deal says. then she yells, "GROUPON IS NOT MY BOSS!".

21.description: What a great find! The owner did my mani pedi and she did a fantastic job! She has tremendous attention to detail. I love it when a manicurist gets a really clean line that does not touch the cuticle, which is exactly what she did. My nails look fabulous! The salon is really cute--inviting and immaculately clean. I'll be back!

16.description: What a great find! The owner did my mani pedi and she did a fantastic job! She has tremendous attention to detail. I love it when a manicurist gets a really clean line that does not touch the cuticle, which is exactly what she did. My nails look fabulous! The salon is really cute--inviting and immaculately clean. I'll be back!

17.description: I bought a Groupon long story short. I would not go back to this place. Owner is rude, equipment not sterilized. My nails looks awful so now I have to go out and get another mani.They don't put flowers in your water for pedi....

10.description: The Spa is new and very clean.  The lady that did my mani and pedi did a very good job and was very pleasant.  They also offer waxing services and I got an eyebrow wax, my brows have never looked better!  She shaped them so well!  The only thing that could make it better is if they had a larger polish selection - maybe that will happen, but know that if you really want a certain color you might want to bring your own.

5.description: Red Tech Nail Spa is a small business, and it's mostly run by the owner.  She's skilled, and I feel that regular mani-pedis last longer than normal (a week for mani's and a month for pedi's).  My manicures always look perfect.  I love that she takes the time to clean up the edges.  If I were to be picky, I would say that she never asks how you want your nails shaped - sometimes I like my toe nails more square, but she usually just makes them round.  The nail colors  are limited so I would consider bringing your own.  The nail salon is very clean and new.  I think she just needs to play some music for more ambiance!  My appointments have run 1-1.5 hours.  There is easy meter parking on Diversey, but I've never had a problem finding an open free spot on the cross street.

11.description: I came in yesterday for a mani/pedi, which I found using groupon.  It was $19 for both.   I made an appointment a few days in advance.  The whole thing took about an hour and 15 minutes and it was very relaxing.  D did a great job and was very friendly.  My only complaint was the bench for the pedicure was pretty uncomfortable for me- I felt like the plate I was resting my feet on kept sliding off, probably due to my height (I am 5'6"). I feel shorter women may have a more comfortable sitting position but if you have long legs you will feel a little cramped.  I was happy with my service and would come again.

22.description: The Spa is new and very clean.  The lady that did my mani and pedi did a very good job and was very pleasant.  They also offer waxing services and I got an eyebrow wax, my brows have never looked better!  She shaped them so well!  The only thing that could make it better is if they had a larger polish selection - maybe that will happen, but know that if you really want a certain color you might want to bring your own.

0.description: I decided to check this place out on a Groupon deal and I must admit I originally went in with not too much of an high expectation. I mean really a quality mani-pedi for $15? BUT I must admit my tech Azaa did a really good job! The pedicure was basic, which I expected. I really like the little cute pedicure bowls that they use. It's different from your standard oversize pedicure massage seats. The manicure was your typical style manicure, but again no shorts were taken because I was using a Groupon. Their color selection is a little weak from what I am used to, but all in all I am sure you will find a color you like in the popular nail color departments, blue, green, red, purple, and neutral. My manicure also did last close to a week with minimal to no chipping and that I was shocked and impressed on. The decor is really nice and different for your Asian style nail salons. All in all the experience was pleasant. Would I go back and pay full price yes I probably would.

20.description: Very pleased. Aza did an amazing job on my mani pedi. Very clean place. Can't wait to go back. Worth the drive!

19.description: Second time I've been here n I'm very satisfied. The place is nice n clean.. I was very happy with my no chip.. Lasted 3 weeks!! My last no chip at another location started to crack after just few daysDefinitely coming back!!!!

2.description: I found this gem in the neighborhood in December while my girlfriend from New York was visiting.We came in for a mani pedi spa services and I have to say we were impressed! It is a BYOB -yay ! And Azaa and De did an amazing job! It is so hard to find a good nail technician in Chicago and I am happy I  found my go-to  place now. The salon offers  modern zen ambiance, healing copper bowls for the pedis and relaxing music. I went back yesterday and my light pink nails have never looked so impeccably done!

18.description: I was going to buy a Groupon so I called ahead and not only did I spend half a day calling that when someone answered I couldn't understand anything she said.  She hung up on me and didn't answer again. Rude! Horrible customer service

13.description: I purchased a groupon for this place since it is on my way home.  I called to make an appointment and was asked for the groupon number.  I thought that was strange and had a bad feeling about giving it to her prior to receiving the service, but she said this is the way they take reservations, so I gave it to her.  BIG mistake!  My appointment was for 6:30 pm and when I arrived the door was locked even though the sign said open 'till 7 pm.  There was a woman in there and I know she saw me knocking on the door, but she ignored me.  When I called she did not answer the phone. I called back numerous times and the phone was never answered. A few days later I saw that my groupon had been redeemed!This is a new one on me!  Lesson learned DO NOT give out the groupon number. I called using a friends phone and guess what? The woman answered right away!  I explained who I was and she remembered me. She had no explanation for why she ignored me at the door but said she's see me so in order to get the service I had paid for and despite how angry I was I decided to make the appointment. The day of my second appointment she was running late. She also decided to sweep the floor in between my mani and pedi. Overall she did an ok job on my nails and gave me some discount coupons but that is not enough to make me EVER go back there again.

4.description: I got a Groupon and I wasn't sure if I wanted to go to this place since I read I really bad review but now I understand why that person gave a really bad review. When I called I had a hard time understanding the last that answer I was getting a little frustrated making the appointment. But it all worked out . there is only one technician doing nails and answering the phone and making appointments I guess because they recently open .I loved it. She did a great job I was out of there in exactly one hour. Nice ,fancy , and super clean place !!!!I guess you just gotta be patient when making the appointment!!! :)Streets parking is not so bad just got to feed the meter I paid $2.75 for one hour one and half not bad at all!!Totally recommend this place !!?

6.description: I purchased a groupon here for the fact that I needed to get a mani/pedi done for my best friend's wedding THIS WEEKEND.  I called and made an appt for Friday (today) at 11a.  I called 2 days later to reschedule.  I remember our specific phone conversation when I called to reschedule - I asked if 230p was available and she said 3p was available instead.  So I took the 3p.When I walked in for my 3p appointment, she asked if I had a groupon.  I told her yes and my name.  She then proceeded to tell me that I missed my 11a appointment.  I told her I had called to reschedule.  She asked who I talked to (I spoke with her) and she immediately told me "NO, you didn't call!" - in the most rude way.  Don't tell me I didn't call - I DID CALL!  She had her hand on her hip - defensive - and her attitude turned sour.  She told me I was "lucky" because she usually doesn't take groupons on Fridays/Saturdays/Sundays, but that I already missed my appointment.  NOWHERE on the groupon does it say that you can only use it on the weekedays and she did NOT tell me that on the phone or that I was the exception to the rule.  I stormed out of there so angry.  yes, FUCK this place.  I bought the groupon so that I could save money, but not only did I waste $ on parking, I had to go to another nail salon and spend more dough.REALLY BAD business ethic.  REALLY shitty attitude.  NO ONE was even in the salon, so it's not like the place was packed!  I will never come here and I hope no one else will.

15.description: Got there before my appointment. Was asked if I had an appointment I said yes. About 45 minutes later still sitting there, another woman asks if I had an appointment I said yes 12. She said she thought I cancelled. Basically I was there for 2 1/2 hours. No apologies.  I was annoyed.  However they did a good job.  They were nice. The place is cleaned. I believe in second chances. So I will be going back in hopes that this situation will not occur again.

7.description: I didn't catch her name but she is the owner and she did an awesome job. I upgraded my groupon with a no chip and she did an awesome job on my nails. It's close to home and I will def be back. Just an FYI she is the only tech onsite so be patient and schedule wisely.

8.description: Azaa created an amazing shellac manicure! She was super kind, caring, and thorough with her work! I got my nails done before a weekend camping trip with my girls, and I am confident I will be looking sweet out in the wild! My nails look better than ever!

3.description: I got a great deal at groupon.The place is very clean has nice decor.I really liked that when I told them that the no chip light hurts they offerred another polish that last long about 7 to 10 days with no chipping but uses no ligth.I will be going back.Please remember to tip on the full price even if you bought a coupon deal b.c. its only fair.And great service should be rewarded.

14.description: I made an appointment. Came in, waited for 35minutes. I got up to ask the nail tech how much longer since i had made an appt and i had been waiting so long. She said 30 more minutes very nonchalantly. No sorry, nothing. Now if i didn't get up to ask i would have probably been waiting an hr or maybe even more. So rude. Very disappointed. I'm giving an extra star so they could fix the process or at least let the customer know an approximate wait time.. Just something so that it's not wasting anyone's time. Or maybe if you do go, be the first customer of the day or something.

29.description: I had their Xoco churro (an unfilled churro covered with warm, gooey chocolate), and an Abuelita hot chocolate, and both were excellent.  Neither were too sweet, and the churro was super fresh (fried while I waited) and not too greasy.The only downside is that I came to hang out for a bit in between plans, and the place is not very cozy: very spare interior with hard plastic chairs, and no WiFi.

42.description: Was looking for churros one day on the internet and came across this place.  Fresh churros, ice cream and hot chocolate served here.

23.description: Good ice cream churros are freshly made.....  But service may vary @ times so be nice if you want to be treated nice.... Otherwise whatever you eat it's pretty good!!

47.description: Yes, it is a little more expensive than other churro places & it is a little hidden but the place has some of the freshest; least greasy churros I've had in a while!  Their fillings rock & they even make cafe con leche like grandma used to make & funnel cakes too!  My mom brought me here a while ago & I have only gotten to go a handful of times but each time I do go, I go prepared to spend & get fat!  My fav churro so far is their apple filled one  ; )

8.description: I was in heaven walking into a place that smelled like funnel cake! I love how they had a very creative menu. On certain days they have different churro filling flavors such as peanut butter or even Nutella.The cashier was very helpful explained to me what each and every different kind of churro they had. I'm glad I came across this place. I will definitely visit again.

31.description: Xocoatl is amazing. Their Churros and funnel cakes are great. I barely found out about this place less than 6 months ago and I've been here a couple of times, everytime I come here, I'm left satisfied with everything I order.  The Churros in xocoatl are made nice and warm, in other places it's not even warm or fresh. I recommend it to anyone one who are fans of Churros and funnel cakes!(: p.s the employees are always welcoming.

34.description: I actually live next-door to this establishment they have the best funnel cakes and Churros. I never tried their other flavors of ice cream because it looks like it's been sitting for a while but I do get the vanilla because it's the most used ice cream there because of the funnel cakes.  I get the strawberry topping which is awesome.

16.description: The funnel cake , Ice cream, and churros really are amazing! the atmosphere is not great but its not horrible, now the "Customer service" leaves a lot to be desired.. Not very friendly,no eye contact, this was my first time there and I felt like I was being rushed and there no customers behind me, my son got a churro sundae and I didn't know it came with only a plain churro with no filling so I ask my son what kind of filling did he want the cashier said "well you didn't pay for any , that cost more" I'm like you didn't ask and there is no sign , then rudely ask AGAIN "is there anything else" I'm sure when this place opened they were really nice, giving menu recommendations, advising the customer on the product!

13.description: Fried dough and ice cream have never gone better together.My brother and I were exploring the new Bloomingdale Trail, and I wanted to stop here before heading back east. This turned out to be a very good idea.Xocoatl is pretty crowded, so it took about 10 minutes to pull the churros and the sundaes together. I got a churro sundae with brownie ice cream and a café olla / coffee with cinnamon.First of all, coffee with cinnamon is really good. The coffee itself wasn't strong but the coffee flavor gave it a certain kind of sweetness. I'm pretty sure they didn't use cinnamon syrup; with the amount of cinnamon in the coffee the sweetness would have knocked my socks off.But the churro. The churro was very, very good. It was warm and a bit doughy in the center, in a good way. Great flavor. The exterior was quite crisp. Cinnamon and sugar doused each stick in abundance. This was probably better than a funnel cake sundae, and that's saying something.Xocoatl sells a bag of a half dozen churros. You should get it, because a freshly fried churro here is about as good as it gets.

11.description: The churros are fresh and as amazing as you would imagine for a place that specializes in churros. While there I saw a lady getting a couple dozen so keep this place in mind when you're trying to think of ways to impress your colleagues and don't want to bring donuts again.

39.description: My friends and I had a churro and abuelita hot chocolate. Their churro was fresh and great as always, but the abuelita hot chocolate was gross. Now that abuelita makes powder packets, it seems that used that instead of the tablet and used water instead of milk. $2 for powdered-water not worth it.

37.description: After going the the Navy Pier to find that the Churro factory was shut down, I was hankering for churros. Xocoatl was the key to quench my churro craving!!Churros (~$1.14): These can be filled with strawberry, chocolate, cream cheese or other fillings they have available. I personally prefer plain churros so when I tried the chocolate and the cream cheese churro, there were too rich and overwhelming. Still okay if you like that stuff - Churritos ($2.05): comes with 8 small pieces that were good if you prefer more of the cinnamon sugar coating and crunchy exterior. Personally, we felt as though the normal original churros were much better. Churro Sundae (~$3.20) - Ice cream was sub-par. Nothing out of the ordinary and I actually feel like it clashed with the churro we had. So next time, I would omit it or get Vanilla Ice Cream. Overall, the quality of churros here was quite good, fresh, and crisp. The cinnamon sugar crystals were a bit larger and not fine sugar crystals, compared to other churro places I have tried. Nonetheless, Xocoatl has great prices and available year round! I'm excited for Xocoatl because they have a nice parking area in the back so it makes it very convenient for their customers. Additionally, they have FUNNEL CAKE! I can only ever get those at fairs so I'll DEFINITELY be back to try that in the near future.

0.description: There is a God.....and he created Xocoatl. This place restored my faith in the world. If a place like this can exist, everything will ultimately be ok. The store itself looks kinda grungy and sparse, but please do not let this fool you. The tables and chairs weren't really clean, and overall, the atmosphere was lacking. But never mind, because the churros were bomb. I am a churro purist; I do not like anything in, on, or around my churros. So I ordered three plain churros. They have a huge variety of churros, and all the types of ways you can eat a churro: in ice cream, filled with cream, filled with chocolate, in a hot fudge sundae, the works. It took a while to receive the churros...BECAUSE THEY MAKE THEM FRESH!!!!! They are not just sitting under a warmer. I came in half an hour to closing, and they still made them fresh. Holy mother of god I have found the holy grail. I want more churros.

38.description: Stopped in here while walking the neighborhood for a drink to go. The place looks clean enough and the treats looked ok. I had to wait a bit for someone to come out from the back and ordered the Mayan mocha and handed over the $3 for the cup. They definitely have a machine like you'd find in a 7-11... Press a button out comes a premixed concoction. My coffee was super syrupy and a little burnt tasting. Oh and no restrooms for customers.

27.description: So I live about a block from this place and never knew it was that good.  So your probably wondering why the 3 start review?  Well,  we ordered and waited 10 minutes,  just to find out that our order wasn't even in the works.  When I and my wife asked about our order, after watching 3 people order and leave, the person behind the counter asked what we wanted on our sundae. Something she could have done from the beginning, when I ordered and paid. So 5 stars for food, 2 stars for service = 3 stars for me.

32.description: Amazing, fresh churros!  If only I lived a little closer...actually, it's probably a good thing I don't.

48.description: so happy the churro factory moved to my neighborhood. delicious, hot, fresh and vegan!!

44.description: Great customer service both workers Eddie and dulce made me feel right at home, best funnel cakes and churros! Everyone should stop by! :D

24.description: I moved around the corner from here about 2 years ago.  (Little less than.)  When I first moved here, from about four minutes down the street via car, I was like, "Oh, noes!, I will gain so much weight, living right next to here!"  Fortunately for me, though, one of their employees is so completely inept she keeps me from coming in probably 2-3 times a week, at least.  When we first moved here we probably came in 1-2 times a week, for either a coffee drink or churros.  Now it's less than once a month, because every other time I come in this lady is working.  She has NO idea how to make even the most basic of coffee drinks.  I'm not expecting high end coffee house quality, here, just the ability to properly mix a coffee drink and the ability to understand the most basic of English in order for me to place my order.  It's obvious she's connected somehow to the owner, otherwise I can't see why she would have a job here.  Other employees are fantastic at their job, but can be a bit surly from time to time.  The churros, freshly made, are excellent.  The coffee drinks are A-OK, if you can manage to get someone behind the counter who ISN'T that lady.  Anyone from the neighborhood who frequents the joint knows exactly who I'm talking about, and yes, I hate calling her out like this, but SERIOUSLY, sometimes I want a coffee drink made for me and she just can't do it.  It's so disappointing.

7.description: My wife and I went here when she bought some groupon that saves us a dollars of some churros. We did not know it was only a dollar but that's fine, not a big deal. She wanted some churros bad anyways. We ordered all the flavor and ti took a few mins for it to come out. It did come out very nice and hot and tasted great. We also had the funnel cake which was also great. Overall great place. The decor needs to be updated but the quality of food is there.

49.description: Delicious!  Went here on a groupon and got a lot of churros!  They have many filling flavors (pineapple, strawberry, chocolate, cream cheese)  Severed fresh and made to order!  It's also a cheap snack!

40.description: Good, freshly made funnel cakes every time. The inside could use a little more pizazz but..I rarely eat there so it's not too much of a bother. I really appreciate the customer service. Always polite and welcoming! My hubby and I walked in 10 min before close tonight (yes, jerk move I know) and we were still greeted and taken care of in a timely, polite manner. I know people hate when customers walk in right before close but I'm so appreciative of the fact that the girl helping us showed no sign of attitude about it. Something simple, yet it stood out to me. But if you're just wondering about the treats, they are delicious! So are the drinks. Try the different lemonades btw!

30.description: Hands down the best churros ever!!! The only bad thing is that you just can't have only one! Usually get a dozen to share with the family and everyone enjoys them. They have different fillings such as vanilla, chocolate (my personal fav), strawberry, cream cheese, nutella, etc The girl that works there needs to smile a little more and be more chatty since she is the restaurant industry but other than that the place is awesome. Note they also sell other items there such as specialty drinks, ice cream, and yogurt however I have only ordered churros from here.

46.description: Actually sitting here in the joint as I write but the service here is SO bad that I have to leave a review before I even TASTE the churro. I think the owner should really rethink whom he/she has running this place.

1.description: I'll give 5 stars to the churros. They are freshly made as you order. So, you have to wait about 5min. You won't regret the wait or the price because they are just amazing!This place is small, with a lot of options to choose from. I was a bit disappointed that they offered 3 or 4 different kinds of hot chocolate which is made from "chocolate Abuelita" and they did not have any to make. I was really thinking a churro with hot chocolate would be so good but they had no hot chocolate. As a business if you offer something as easy to make as hot chocolate you have to provide it. Damn, you can send someone to the nearest store and get it. I noticed there were two big food markets with in minutes from this place. So that gave me the impression that they don't care. I will come again just for the churros and with the hope they have chocolate abuelita.The place has tables and chairs to sit but does not have a garbage can. What's with that? I like to clean after my self so eather you leave the garbage on the table or take it with you. I don't like eather.The young girl did not smile at all. She seemed a bit bothered but took care of our order promptly.

9.description: The churros are good if eaten right away. The cream cheese churros is my favorite but the strawberry one is also pretty good.

26.description: Wooo amazing churros, though with a bit too much sugar coating (but it's churros I know ). The dulce de leche was very flavorful though I would not recommend strawberry and cream cheese. Chocolate was decent, but not the best

25.description: Amazingly good churros! I didn't like the vanilla filling, but the chocolate and strawberry were good. I bought a dozen to bring to work for Mothers Day and EVERYONE loved them, even the picky eaters.

12.description: First time, good experience. My coffee and churro were fresh and tasty. Place and seating is unaesthetic, very run down, but I'll let that slide because we're in a recession and it seems like a small family business. Their whole concept is nice and creative; the menu is simple but to the point. The people working there were polite and attentive. Can't wait to try their funnel cakes. Seems like this place would be great to stop by during the summer. Thank you.

21.description: Tried this for the first time about a week ago. I liked my boyfriends spice Mexican coffee better than my macchiato. It's different! The churros were good and freshly made. My only complaint is that when I got there the girl was stuffing churros with filling and saw me standing there for a few min with my boyfriend waiting. A family walks in after and when she finishes filling she turns around and looks past us and takes the other guys order! Hello I've been standing there 5 min clearly before anyone else. The guy realized it after and apologized for ordering before us  but I told him not to worry it wasn't his fault. I'll be coming back for more churros so hopefully I won't be ignored!

17.description: So I live about a block from this place and never knew it was that good.  So your probably wondering why the 3 start review?  Well,  we ordered and waited 10 minutes,  just to find out that our order wasn't even in the works.  When I and my wife asked about our order, after watching 3 people order and leave, the person behind the counter asked what we wanted on our sundae. Something she could have done from the beginning, when I ordered and paid. So 5 stars for food, 2 stars for service = 3 stars for me.

10.description: Not sure how ppl write a review on the churro and funnel cakes when this place is a dump.  I don't know about y'all but I'd like to purchase food from a tidy place. This place had garbage all over the floor and looked like it hadn't been mopped in months, barely any tables yet filthy, wall falling apart. I could just imagine how  dirty the kitchen is too. I mean where's a inspector. How is this place still open. Disgusting. Walked in and out.

5.description: Mighty tasty churros. Hot, lightly rolled in sugar with yummy filings like custard and jelly. You can't go wrong for a homemade pastry.

3.description: Freshly made churros , with great tasteful fillings. .. Made as you make your order...

35.description: Good coffee, nice little place, and friendly staff. AND FRESH BAKED CHURROS. I bought six churros from them a few weeks ago (don't judge) and began the short walk home when the bag broke and I lost my precious churros on the sidewalk. This is a testament to how good their churros are: in the time it took me to run back and get six more (they didn't charge me) someone happened upon them, picked them up and ate them.

19.description: Decided to come here one day and the churros were good but the funnel cake sucked. I didnt even finish it ..I was very disappointed because it looked really good and I spent about 20 minutes in line. Maybe will go back for the churros thats it..

28.description: Cute ice cream and churro shop, with the latter made and filled fresh when you order. We tried the cream cheese and the chocolate. Much to my surprise, the cream cheese was so much better! It gave a much-needed hint of tang to something otherwise a little boringly sweet. Definitely drop by and give the cream cheese a chance.

45.description: I only went here for one reason and one reason only...that reason was the freshly made churros. They will fry them up right as you wait, bathe them in cinnamon and then fill them with your choice of cream cheese, strawberry, regular cream or chocolate fillings. And having freshly made churros is probably one of the best mid afternoon treats in my opinion. They also seem to sell ice cream here and coffees but I didn't have any because I was zero'd in on the churros. So no comment on the coffee or ice cream...Also, the churros cost like $1.25 a piece which is pretty good but you can also get 6 for $6 which is even better. I anxiously await the time when my guilty conscience (leftover from my last trip here) subsides so I can go load up on some more.

33.description: I was in the mood for dessert and nothing that required going to Wicker Park, Bucktown, Lincoln Park, Lakeview, Lincoln Square, or downtown to find. And I would find that there is a Xocoatl in Logan Square.Funnel cake. Churros.I had the funnel cake and since I hadn't had one since 1986 -- don't laugh -- it was pure heaven. I returned a few days later and ordered churros filled with chocolate. I was expecting cinnamon sticks the thickness of my finger. What a surprise to find that the churros at Xocoatl are substantial. And because I could see kitchen where they were being made, I was instantaneously transformed into a regular customer.Soy contento.

43.description: Churros, hot chocolate and ice cream. I used a Groupon or Living Social for this place..can't remember which. Anyway, I've been twice with friends and was able to please 3 people off of 20.00 bucks during my second visit. So, it's not that expensive either way. The drawbacks are that the staff sort of act like they don't want to be there. The young lady at the counter seemed to not want to be bothered. Also the place is small..which could be cute if there were staff and decor to make it feel cozy. The actual churros are okay. One of my friends asked to have her churro covered in chocolate and nuts. The girl didn't really bother to chop the nuts up. Which is not that big of a deal but we were the only people in the place. It wasn't busy she could have taken the time to make her feel special. The mexican hot chocolate gets 3 out of 4 stars. The ice cream is better. I got strawberry and it tastes like pure cream, milk and sugar with fresh berries. In other words .. Homemade.

2.description: The churros are amazing, super warm and soft!! If the review was strictly for the churros then yes 5 stars for sure!! Buttt the reason it gets 3 stars is bc I came in on a Sunday afternoon and it was super dead. There was 5 visible workers behind the counter and the girl who helped us worked EXTREMELY slow. If a turtle was making my churro sundae the turtle would of taken the win. She moved super slow and she dragged her feet back and forth between ingredients. ... super annoying!  Also, to have 5 employees just standing there doing nothing there should be a reason why ALL your tables were dirty -__-

18.description: I have been going through a bit of a churrofaze lately.  For some reason churros scream summer to be more than say, a cupcake.  I stumbled upon xocoatl aka the churros factory once day while yelping.  I decided since it was just a hop skip and a jump from my house I would check it out.  Pleasantly surprised! These are what churros are all about, this small unassuming shop is half ice cream parlor, half churro heaven.  They have standing vanilla, chocolate and strawberry filling flavors but also a rotating flavor of the day, fom peanut butter, nutella, guava and a few more.  I opted to keep it simple with chocolate and vanilla and they were both great, the churros are made to order so they are piping hot and covered in cinnamon sugar goodness.  I will definitely be back for some of the other flavors!

41.description: Awesome sundae funnel cake and churros!!!!! This place is small and easy to doubt but don't be fooled its amazing. Everyone in our group fell in love and we had to drive 45 minutes to get to this place so believe we had high expectations and they were met. The service is slow and it's not the nicest place to sit in but after one bite you forget about all that. We had one chocolate and one vanilla sundae funnel cake and I can't pick one over the other they were both amazing. This place is a must try!

4.description: Almost positive this is the best churro place in town. The service was quick and the CHURROS had that perfect outer crunch and inner softness to them. It wasn't oily or greasy feeling at all. There was just enough sugar on the outside, and if you had them with icecream it's pure bliss.

6.description: Coffee was DELISH! Hot chocolate was DELISH! Churros were DELISH! The people (if you can consider them people) were NOT DELISH. The people in there were very ghetto, very rude, very filthy and very loud. They took every seat and left their things on them, hence leaving us standing to drink and eat like plebeians. I was very disgusted by the customers inside. It makes me not want to come back again. But again...the food was DELISH. There wasn't much space to even sit down honestly. Two tables and maybe 8 or 10 chairs. As I'm writing this a boy about 15 is smoking weed in the parking lot and others are throwing up gang signs inside the restaurant. NOT DELISH. I won't say what color or race these people were, nor does it matter, but they were as black as the night. Overall 3/5.

22.description: Warm,  fresh,  made to order churros with 6 different fillings to choose!  Omg I went crazy the first time here. Sundae churros my favorite. It's like a Mexican version of a funnel cake sundae to me!  Delicious!

15.description: I was in the mood for dessert and nothing that required going to Wicker Park, Bucktown, Lincoln Park, Lakeview, Lincoln Square, or downtown to find. And I would find that there is a Xocoatl in Logan Square.Funnel cake. Churros.I had the funnel cake and since I hadn't had one since 1986 -- don't laugh -- it was pure heaven. I returned a few days later and ordered churros filled with chocolate. I was expecting cinnamon sticks the thickness of my finger. What a surprise to find that the churros at Xocoatl are substantial. And because I could see kitchen where they were being made, I was instantaneously transformed into a regular customer.Soy contento.

20.description: Fried dough and ice cream have never gone better together.My brother and I were exploring the new Bloomingdale Trail, and I wanted to stop here before heading back east. This turned out to be a very good idea.Xocoatl is pretty crowded, so it took about 10 minutes to pull the churros and the sundaes together. I got a churro sundae with brownie ice cream and a café olla / coffee with cinnamon.First of all, coffee with cinnamon is really good. The coffee itself wasn't strong but the coffee flavor gave it a certain kind of sweetness. I'm pretty sure they didn't use cinnamon syrup; with the amount of cinnamon in the coffee the sweetness would have knocked my socks off.But the churro. The churro was very, very good. It was warm and a bit doughy in the center, in a good way. Great flavor. The exterior was quite crisp. Cinnamon and sugar doused each stick in abundance. This was probably better than a funnel cake sundae, and that's saying something.Xocoatl sells a bag of a half dozen churros. You should get it, because a freshly fried churro here is about as good as it gets.

36.description: Well My review is for the location in cermak stThe churros was delicious hot & freshI orders   fresas con crema and they are the worst i ever hadA big plastic cup w/ few cut strawberryesLot of condense milk toooooo muchhhhhToooo  Swett

14.description: THE best churros! I never ever liked the stuffed ones, im a plain jane churro girl but these cream cheese filled ones are AMAZING!  i also needed some in bulk (300 to be exact)  and they were so accomodating even though it was short notice (1 day).  Plus, they are very affordable. Yum!

0.description: Great place to get your Zumba, eat, drink (healthy) on! Zumba classes held Mon.-Fri. 9:30am - 10:30am and 6-7pm. Saturdays at 9:30 - 10:30am. Johanna is a great instructor. They offer salads, sandwiches, coffee and Herbalife products...teas, shakes & protein bars. Come shake it and get a protein shake with that

12.description: Not a fan of their tortas but their tacos of cilantro and onion are delicious! Love that it's open past midnight for those long nights !

3.description: I love that they have late hours,burritos are decent when it comes to taste and size.Really didn't like the chorizo taco and also tortillas where to hard from leaving them too long and the flat top,oh but salsas are bomb!

1.description: I will never again come to this place. I normally go to the taconazo on central and they are awesome. But this one I only came to a few times This last time I went with a big group of people about 20. We all ordered and one of my girlfriends ordered a torta and she said it tasted wierd so after taking only two small bites and being grossed out we asked if she could switch it for something else the already rude and miserable looking waiter said no. We then spoke to the cook and he stated he would charge for both meals also very rude. Mind you we had 20 paying people. Anyhow she didn't order anything else we were all shocked of the horrible customer service. She paid for what she didn't eat we left and will never again eat there. No longer will support that location. I did get the name of the owner will Def call soon. Also they charged us extra for having more than one chips basket......whatever we paid it even though the 20 of us took up four tables. Ugh never again. Very disappointed being that I am a huge taconazo customer since I was a teen. :/Try the central location!!!!

2.description: This location looks very new so my girlfriend and I had to stop in and try it out. It is very authentic for a "fast food place." You get chips and (3) variations of salsa. Some of the chips were a bit stale but overall they were very good. The food was great, they serve "real" tacos that only have cilantro and onions. Maybe this is authentic, maybe it's them being cheap? lol.The only thing I don't like is the tables are not separated. It is one, large continuous 8 ft. table. So if it is packed do we have to eat like we are in a high school cafeteria?! The food is good and it seems like it works well for the people they get in there, but I wouldn't set up a date night or anything here. It's good tacos for $2. Don't get robbed. lol

9.description: So we decided to try this place cause it was open late. First notice floors are juat filthy. We just finished eating and food was bad. Torta had overloaf on onions we specified only cheese. The meat had absolutely NO FLAVOR!!! it was so bad it was borderline gross. We ordered pastor, carne asada and pollo. Gross, gross and gross. The horchata was just as bad. Would NOT go back!!!

10.description: Good prices, good portions. Tacos were flavorful, though they were a little heavy handed with the cilantro & onions. Nice that they're open late.

4.description: Horrible. Specially seen the waitress just refill the hot/salsa containers that everyone just double dips into after a waited table and put it back on fridge. Dirty floors and tables. Don't know how to give it 0 stars.

6.description: The waiter was nice. The tacos were OK. The place looked sketchy, and was filthy. They should focus a little more on the overall cleanliness of there establishment. A clean atmosphere is extremely important especially in the food service industry.

0.description: Great food, tacos are great, the green salsa is also delicious. The delivery is fast, although maybe that has to do with me living so nearby. The Milanesa de res is sometimes dry, but de pollo is amazing.I do recommend.

5.description: I've tried steak tacos from a lot of places, but by far this place has the best. I literally live about two blocks away and can't get enough of this place.

13.description: If you're extremely hungry, get the steak burrito! Great size and authentic flavor! Hardly any fat on the steak. Comes loaded with beans, cheese, sour cream and avocado (price for avocado already included). Get the green salsa and ask them to put it back on the grill to get a nice crispy, charred taste.

11.description: The food is great I love the torta dinner it's great amount of food for the price and I specially love there salsa called pico de gallo  I recommend it!  And they open at 8 so it's great for me that wakes up hungry.

8.description: Just noticed that they took the salsa from a table that just finished, refilled it with more salsa and gave it to another customer. That's so gross.

14.description: One of my favorite places for some delicious tacos! Also, it's open late for those of you who want a late night meal or snack!

7.description: This is my taco spot. I love the steak tacos and the pico de gallo. My daughter love there burritos and my husband loves the tortas. Great place awesome prices and let's not forget there horchata and the tamarido water, they're great. Love love this spot!

0.description: Came here on thanksgiving and they were open I was looking around for a place to cut my hair and I surprisingly found this. From outside the place looks like a small place, but once you step inside you will realize that it is very spacious plus it looks nice inside. Great haircut! I definitely will be coming here more often. They also have a set of magazines to read and some tv while you wait.

12.description: They are open on Sunday so that is a A++++. Good prices and great work !!

3.description: I've been going here for almost a year every other week to get my nails done. I used to get great service and I gave the two stars because the people who do feet are really personable. Although I feel lately the last 5 times I've went I've been rushed or unsatisfied with the service. So I went in to get a full set, take off and pedi, my usual. I walk in tell them what I want, write it down and go pick my color. They do my pedi, great. Then I go to start doing my nails. The guy that usually does my nails tells me he can't take them off and I should just get a fill because he doesn't have time. I personally feel like they should have told me that when I first walked in. Instead of telling me after I got my toes done. I didn't want a fill because I wanted my nails to be longer. I thought about just getting a fill and so 5 minutes later I told him it was fine and I would get the fill. He said no I waited to long to make my decision. He wouldn't have time. Seriously that really pissed me off. I ended up having to leave with just a pedi and my regular nails not done. For being a repeat customer I feel I should have been treated way better. I think they're starting not to care and let the money go to their heads. Too bad, I will not be going back and I'm on the hunt for another nail salon!

1.description: Shout out to brandon for the great service today.. It was my first time there and I'm satisfied.. thanks a bunch.

2.description: Please ignore the negative reviews! There's nothing bad you can say about this place. They are amazing! Clean, professional, friendly, and just overall good!!! I have friends traveling from across the city to get their nails done here. Check them out! Trust me, you will not be disappointed!!!

9.description: I went for the first time today because of the yelp reviews and how it was really close to me and I really enjoyed it! It was very clean and they had many employees working. I really liked my pedicure and I look forward to going again for a manicure! The only thing I suggest is for a price list on everything they offer, at first I was worried about how much it was going to be since on yelp there is no price list only to see there was no price list on the wall! The pedicure is $20 for any one wondering. No idea for anything else. Overall, great place!

10.description: Vegas Nails is my go to shop.  I love my pedicures and no chips each and every time.  Everything is always done to my liking.  I'm constantly purchasing gift cards to this place because I want others to experience how awesome this nail salon is.

4.description: I normally have my nails done at Vegas Nails and don't have an issue. But this last time I was very disappointed. I requested only a mani this time around and the only conversation that the nail tech and I had was, "did you pick your color" and to "sit down" at her station. I understand they are busy and I definitely did not want a whole long conversation but really only a few word is really not good. I then was very bothered as she rushed through the steps of her mani process. I can honestly say I sat in her station no longer than 7 minutes. It took me longer to dry my nails then to even get the mani completed. I truly was very disappointed and I hope that this does not happen again. I will try them once more to make sure it was just an off day rather than the norm for them.

6.description: Vegas nails have gave me excellent service. I want to give a big shout out 2  Brandon, Logan ,Julie and Cindy. If you are looking for a good nail salon with excellent service Vegas nails is the place. Donna

0.description: I came in after reading the reviews and was not disappointed. They have a huge selection of no chip and regular nail polish. The service was great! It's a walk in service. They don't take appointments. So you have to time it well so you don't wait that long. They accept cash and debit card. Make sure you have your ID if you use your debit card or they will not accept it. They are very detailed in their service and very friendly. Even though it was busy I did not feel rushed whatsoever. I had a regular pedicure and a no chip manicure. I will definitely come back again.

5.description: One of my favorite places to go to ! Many no chip colors, which is the best. Their no chips are nicely done. I recommend Logan and Christy for no chip

13.description: Brandon is the best nail technician in the World. He makes my nails perfectly square and polishes them to perfection. The facility is clean and stocked with ample polish brands and colors.  I just love Vegas Nails!!!

11.description: I have been going to Las Vegas nails  for a long time. The last few times, I noticed a change.  I asked for a certain tech, only if she was available and she was, she ignored me, they gave me to someone else and she pretty much ignored me while I was there me although she has done my nails several times and knows me. (Lots of chatting in their language :)  One of the reason I was so happy this place came into the area was it was new and CLEAN.  I don't get it, is it policy for all  nail salons to NEVER clean?  Is this how they live?  I got a bottle of nail polish and the entire rack had visible dust on it, the station supplies all had dust on it, the lamps, the jars, not new dust from that day, it was old and had been there for a while.  If this is how they clean, how do I know how they clean what they use on my nails?  The "blue light" is a sanitizer, what is the policy on that?  The place is getting dirty, a once a month thorough cleaning, including bathroom would be good. Wipe down the whole pedicure chair.  A sweep with the fan broom is not enough.  I hope they read this and take it to heart.  Its a nice place but going downhill fast.  I am sad to see that happen.

8.description: I tried Vegas Nails for the first time today after reading other Yelp reviews and I wasn't disappointed!  There were a few people ahead of me and the technicians take their time (which is a good thing when you're the one in the chair).  My technician, John, gave my feet the TLC they deserved and I will definitely be back.

14.description: This place was named AP NAILS with previous owners. Now they are Vegas nailsI always go maybe every 1-2 weeks sent about 5 girls to them and I went in yesterday  for a Gel full set fill-in and pedicure I get the pedicure from the man w a hat w a piercing in the bottom lip/chin and he polishes my nail w the color I picked but I changed my mind after he polishes them cause I didn't like the color on my feet and he charged me $8 more I will never go back besides that they are RUDE they start talking abt you in there language and forget it, it never ends they don't appreciate there customers and there's never parking, very, very rude people .

7.description: Went for the first time today..and they are great shoutout to brandon and Logan they are amazing and did an excellent job.the place is nice and clean and i wasn't there all day long.this is my go to spot now

3.description: Personally, I don't keep going back to Guadalajara for the baked goods. No- I keep throwing my money at them for their sandwiches. They're GIGANTIC, cheap, and incredibly delicious. True, the service is sometimes slow, but it's definitely worth it when you get to unwrap the behemoth and take a bite into it.I consider my self a bit of a sandwich connoisseur, and the turkey, bacon, and egg is one of the best sandwiches I've had in Chicago.

1.description: Bakery but great for huge breakfast sandwiches under $6.  No frills place with no seating. Take out only.

2.description: Sorry, I have gone to bakeries all over the city, but this one was by far the worse of the worse. Yes, its hard to get parking since you have to pay on Armitage they will ticket you faster than a flea jumps on a one legged dog!  The breads were not fresh, although my mom asked the lady. When we got to my aunts house, all others brought bakery goods also, but ours were not touched! Well they did pinch for freshness, and might I add, breads don't crumble when you poke. These did! No way will I go back, and this is definitely the no no of bakeries in the city.

0.description: First time coming here the sandwiches are amazing they a full with flavor and are huge I had to split it with my husband because I got full of half the slice. The Mexican bread is so yummy. Las conchas are simply perfect with a cup of hot chocolate or coffee. Highly recommend this place. Best part about this bakery is that everything is fresh!!

3.description: Got a great set of luggage for cheap! I got a three piece for my family trip and because of the great color variations I was able to spot my luggage easily! The material is well made like some of the other expensive luggages i've purchsed in the past. Tim also got me a great deal with a duffel bag for the gym!

1.description: Bought two carry ons yesterday with 360 wheels-hard case. Manager/owner was there. Did not try to sell me something more expensive(my pet peeve). Saw what I wanted immediately. They have a big selection. Saw similar luggage at Marshall's and Target for about $20-$30 more! Big selection. If you are in need of luggage, come here! Glad I did :)

2.description: Fantastic little luggage store. They have a huge selection of bags in every color, size, and shape you can imagine! Parking is readily available for free on Belmont or nearby side streets. Best thing about this place is the prices! They don't have a bag in there over $60. Even their highest quality and biggest bags don't push you over that budget. The same bag you could get at a department store for $150 on sale, costs you $30 at TPI. Customer service was fantastic as well. If you're looking to save money on luggage for your next trip without sacrificing quality, look no further than TPI! Thanks guys!

0.description: These guys are the greatest! They have a good selection and their prices and service are amazing! We were visiting Chicago and the weather changed - and we left with more clothing than we anticipated. Needless to say... we had to purchase another piece of luggage. They had exactly what we were looking for! Thanks guys!

4.description: This is another outlet store that can be found in this ever-changing neighborhood. The sell luggage, napsacks, blankets, purses and alot of general merch. There is alot  of items that are geared for children as well.

3.description: Small pizza joint in the neighborhood. Got off work late last Friday evening, and didn't really feel like going out. I had decided to order a large pizza for the family with pepporoni and bacon, large order of fries and fried calamari. The food arrived within 45 minutes and got a free 2 liter of 7-Up with it as well, which doesn't hurt. I think I paid only about 25.00 and some change, which isn't bad for what I had gotten. The calamari was delcious and the pizza was great too. It was thin sliced but a bit thick too, with just the right amount of sauce. Can't wait to order from here again.

1.description: Has great pizza, and a great special! You get a football size cheeze pizza, plus a FREE 10 inch cheese pizza, and a 2 Liter of pop for $22.95.BUT they NEVER NEVER answer their phone.  I have been calling once every few minutes for the past hour, and no one has picked up.  It states that they open at 11. Why Mari's wwhhhhyyy?  I love you guys, but please answer!

2.description: Ordered from this place off of GrubHub and what I got was just less than satisfactory. I ordered a gyro sandwich with fries, jalepeno poppers, and had a coupon for a free 1 liter soda. First I would like to state if your gyro meat comes in a box, pre-formed in "gyro patties" you should not be able call it a gyro. In Chicago gyro meat is cut off a gyro spit, not that pre-cut box garbage I was fed. The tzatziki sauce, if you could call it that, was just sour cream and grilled instead of raw onions were used. My friends, this is not a gyro, needless to say I threw away 80% of that sandwich. The coupon stated a free 1 liter soda with an order of $10 or more. So I ordered the jalepeno poppers to meet the dollar amount on the coupon. What I was given was a CAN of soda. I would like to attribute this to the lack of understanding of the unit of measure ,since no one in the US uses the metric system, but that is obviously not the case since a can and a liter of soda are both listed on their menu at different prices, so why would they give a coupon for a free liter and only give a can? To make you meet the dollar amount on the coupon and rip you off that's why. The only thing edible from my order were the fries and the jalepeno poppers, and honestly those weren't all that good either. I'm never ordering from here again.

0.description: Fantastic place to get out with family and friends and have some Pizza and drinks.  The fried veggie baskets might not be the most healthy choice for an appetizer  but boy is it good. It is also nice to get away from the Lincoln Park - Lakeview crowd.  The walk through the liquor store and bar to get to the retro dining room is pretty neat.

3.description: Had a torta de pollo with everything and it was good moist chicken really tasty! Skip the salsa not the best by far BUT the chicken OH MAN! most def I will come back

1.description: I love this place. They have good tortas and tacos. And their orchata is always on point! But make sure you have at least one friend who speaks Spanish or something cuz they don't speak no English in there. They have a store that is connected to the restaurant which is great if you need to get something real quick but beware the line is extremely long they only open one register even if there is 20 people waiting.

2.description: i am a serious fan of their al pastor tacos. I could, in an ideal world, eat my weight and then some in al pastor tacos. When I first moved to the neighborhood, I was a little skeptical about venturing in to the taqueria attached to the grocery store, but I'm really glad I did. Even though the taqueria itself is quite tiny, it's got a nice, homey atmosphere, which gives it a leg up for me when compared to some of the other kind of dive-ier (yet still good) taquerias in the vicinity. I guess you could assume a taco's a taco's a taco, but if I had the choice, I'd prefer a more comfortable atmosphere and this little place delivers. It's no frills, but it's colorful and our regular waitress is great. Plus, wood fire grilled meats? I'm on it.

5.description: This place has the tacos you pick when someone asks you if you could only eat one food the rest of your like what would it be? And you can pick up toilet paper in the attached store on your way out!

6.description: The first time I came here it was by accident. My friend and I  couldn't find the taco place we had agreed upon so we ended up coming here.  Wow, I'm glad we got lost. The tacos and tortas are great. They grill the meat over a wood fire which gives it a  great distinct flavor.  The ingredients are definitely fresh since the restaurant is attached to the supermarket next door.  The prices are great too.  One of my coworkers and I went there for lunch today and the total for both of us was $10.05.  I had ordered two tacos and an horchata. She ordered a torta and an horchata.  We walked out of there ready for a nap. Good food, good portions, small price; that's my kind of restaurant.There's metered parking along Diversey and the supermarket has a parking lot. In the summer they sometimes have a guy out in the parking lot roasting corn on a huge grill made out of a steel drum.  The smell is amazing.Look past the crappy exterior and just GO!

7.description: Food is okay.  Las Isla Marias has better seafood but the other entrees are okay.

8.description: Stopped in here for some tacos from a friend's recommendation, and was really pleased! I had two tacos de carne asada and two al pastor, and all four were delicious! The quality of the meat was excellent, which makes sense, seeing as how they are connected to a grocery store. Also loved the spicy guacamole. Definitely fresh. If you want an authentic taco made with quality ingredients, this is your spot.

9.description: I love Ricardo's.  I live right down the street.  It reminds me of what Chicago east of Kedzie used to be like before Potbelly's and Cold Stone Creamery. There's a store attached to the restaurant.  I walk over to "Ricky's" all the time. They've got amazing fresh salsa and churros.  I was skeptical when the restaurant first opened because it looked like it was violating every fire law possible but wow! I love the roasted chicken, tacos, carne asada, and chicken soup. Oh and the horchata. This place is a gem.  The owner is always very nice.  So is the staff even when there english is a little limited. Don't let the exterior intimidate  you!

0.description: Three of us passed Ricardos on the way back from checking out cheap furniture at Big Lots. Given the prevalence of Spanish signs in the area, we suspected tasty Mexican food might be at hand. We've had positive experiences at other restaurants-connected-to-markets so decided to give it a shot. Ricardos did not disappoint. The grilled chicken is quite good, however the standout are the al pastor tacos. This is the best al pastor I've ever had: the pork is well seasoned, finely chopped, grilled to perfection and served with a grilled scallion. We also tried the carne asade tacos, they were good, but not outstanding, I think Allende is better. The decor is pretty basic, although they spice it up with some random tree-trunk chairs. It's connected to a Mexican market which has parking. The menu is quite expansive and we plan to explore more of it. I only wish it was located closer!

4.description: One of my top Mexican joints in the city, very good and worth the drive out. The smoky smell of wood in the meat of their bbq al pastor is divine. The restaurant is attached to a grocery store so I imagine they have a really good pick of ingredients in their food. I often eat heartily here with another companion where the entire meal for us two is less than a Jefferson. Seriously, try the Al Pastor taco and shrimp empanadas. The seafood platter looks really good, I will try it one of these days.

58.description: my boy went here to get his cell phone fixed after water damage, they did that plus gave him a phone cover for like 5 bucks.  hes a big fan!

56.description: I have an I-Phone 3G and had it in my backpack while mountain biking when a rainstorm hit.  My phone was in a water proof zipper pocket but somehow still got wet.  I dried it out and after a 1.5 days it started to work.  It worked for about 3 weeks but slowly got worse with being able to take a charge and rebooting sometimes and getting temperature warnings.  eventually it would not stay on so I decided to take it to the Skokie shop.  They took my phone in right away and for $100 did a scrub on all the corrosion in the phone and it is working great after about 2 hours.  These guys saved me from having to buy a new I-Phone at retail prices.

29.description: Great fast service. Took phone in, right away the employee identified the battery was fried and all I needed to do was replace the battery. Did not charge me a penny! Definitively coming back with all of my cell phone problems!

42.description: what's not to love about this place really? the people working here are straightforward and nice. they aren't trying to rip you off--they did a soft reset on my blackberry as they didn't think there was anything wrong with the phone. sure, it did crap out on me a week later, but at least i didn't have to pay until then. they also have a decent selection of unlocked and refurbished phones for sale...and they unlock phones for something like $35. to do a software wipe on my blackberry it was $60 and came with a 6 month warranty on the work which i thought was fantastic.i will definitely come back here should i need to in the future. i am so so glad to be rid of the blackberry and my tmobile contract, but i do credit their lack of customer care with me finding this place

23.description: Very courteous and nice, unable to fix my phone although every time I brought it back they said it was fixed and by the time I got it home it was dead and wouldn't charge, bought new battery, they said it was the wrong battery, it wasn't they put the old battery in and said it charged, charge lasted ten minutes without using the phone, I give up.

47.description: Nigel was quick and helpful.  Nigel fixed my broken lcd display on my 3gs white 32gb iphone for $120- my touch is not very sensitive but he told me to check back in a coupla days to see if they got new screens in stock!! I won this phone off ebay earlier this year for $725, so I was happy to know that they could help.

8.description: My iPhone screen was completely  shattered & now it is looking as good as new. Great customer service. Fast repair. Knowledgeable. Affordable. Highly recommended!

31.description: In a world where Verizon charges outrageous amounts of money for crappy insurance policies and replacing an I-phone costs $700, these guys are the ultimate solution.  During the summer, I dropped my phone and shattered the screen so bad it was leaking stuff. Took it to the Verizon store, got told I didn't have insurance even though I remember paying something for it, and that it would be $700 to replace.  Unbelievable how much money Verizon and Apple have and they can't even cut you a deal to fix your phone.  I found CPR and they fixed the screen in 30 minutes for an incredible reasonable price.  Just this week, my screen went out randomly and I took it to them and they figured out the LCD screen was un hooked from the phone inside and they fixed it in 30 seconds.  Thank goodness there are some honest people in the cell phone business providing a service without charging ungodly amounts of money.

34.description: After having my iPhone 4 for over 1.5 years, I dropped it for the first time and, of course, the screen shattered. First, I took it in to Verizon to see what my options were. They could only offer me 2 options: Add a line to my contract and pay an additional $40/month and they'd give me a new iPhone 4 for no extra cost, or buy the iPhone 4 for full retail price at $650. I started researching other options, and discovered CPR Cell Phone Repair, conveniently located in my neighborhood. The people there were super friendly and very professional. They were able to fix my screen in about an hour and it only cost me $105 - much cheaper than buying a new phone! Hopefully I won't have any future problems with my phone, but if I do, it's nice to know that they are just down the street. I'd definitely recommend their services.

16.description: My phone had water damage from falling in the toilet (go ahead and laugh). It was positively dead, stuck on this strange screen with weird script.These guys took it apart, cleaned it and now it's as good as new. My husband convinced me to try this business, I was totally skeptical, but it worked! Great job.

13.description: Dropped my phone in the bathtub, tried fixing it myself first with no luck. Cpr (Andy) was able to fix my phone Cost and timeline was all explained up front. I had it back in a day and a half 100% back to normal. With the crappy service at the service providers bring your phone here before you give up on it and buy a new one or go to the cell provider.

11.description: Friendly staff people and they know what they are talking  about, if you need to come, fix your phone andy is the guy to see. I will definitely come back if I have any issue about phones that are possibly hard to fix.  Five stars.........

39.description: AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS.I brought my I phone which was water damaged into the store on a Friday evening. I explained to the customer service guy at the counter what had happened to my phone(was not submerged in water; just a bit of water spilled on it.) I also went into detail that the sound in fact still worked, but the screen would not turn on( no spots or hints of color.) I asked the man how much of a shot I had at fixing this and he acted like no problem. This place charges a 45 dollar non-refundable fee for water damage phones, which I agreed to since he acted like this would be a fixable problem. I dropped it off and was told to come pick it back up at 2 pm the next day.Fast forward to next day; I go into CPR with credit card in hand ready to pay the 55 dollars they charge you for actually fixing the phone. When I tell the guy( a different guy) which phone I have he heads to the back and brings it back with a paper that says unrepairable. He states he is sorry and asks what happened to the phone; I explain the same exact thing I told the other guy, and he shakes his head and says well with the screen not turning on you didn't have a chance of fixing this..So in the end, this place knew they were ripping me off by taking the non-refundable fee, with the knowledge that they weren't able to fix it.I have told all friends and family to avoid this place.P.S JUST NOTICED YELP FILTERS OUT THIS PLACE'S BAD REVIEWS...WHICH EXPLAINS WHY THEY HAVE FOUR STARS. ALL THEIR FILTERED REVIEWS ARE ONE STARS!!!

37.description: I needed my Blackberry tracking ball clean and replaced.  They did it in 10 minutes for $25.  I was glad to pay it.   It had been giving me trouble for a month and now it works like a charm.  These guys are honest and fairly priced.   If your cell phone needs work these are the guys to go to.Nick GecanManaging Broker/OwnerGecan Realty Group, Inc.

0.description: I'm definitely giving Jeff and the business a 5. I bought a TMobile phone from eBay to use on Cricket Wireless. Despite speaking with them multiple times on acceptable phones, they never mentioned needing it to be unlocked by the carrier. After speaking with the original seller, and a snafu with the unlocking process, I had to pop into TMobile to see if they could help since the unlock didn't work. After almost an hour, they had no good news for me other than to check out CPR since they often send people there when they can't help. I explained, with difficulty, my issue. Jeff heard me out, made no guarantees, but said he'd see what he could do. Within 10 minutes and 1 call that they placed to Cricket, they had my phone unlocked glitch taken care of! And I have had no issues since. I would definitely go back again.

38.description: bought a cover for my I3gs Iphone about a month ago, the bottom plastic part snapped .Brought it back to store where the guy who sold it to me was uninterersted in assisting. He said to come back that they might have other covers shpped in by tomorrow. Poor customer service.Scott S.

51.description: I can't believe this owner.   My blackberry tracking ball wasn't working.   I've had this problem a number of times.   In the past i have ordered new ones on-line for $2.99 a piece, but figured i would save postage and not wait a few days for shipping so i went in to see if he sold the tracking balls.  The guy kind of had a cocky look to him.   I asked him if they sold tracking balls for blackberrys and he said yes.   He said for $45 a piece.   I could not believe what i just heard.  I was in shock and told him that i pay $2.99 on-line for them and he was like "so".   I laughed and walked out.  Hey,  i'm all for him making a profit, but come on....   This could be one of the biggest scams ever.   The guy should be arrested.   He figures there's no competition so he can charge what ever he wants.   What a slimeball...  Will never go to CPR again. This is a scam

27.description: I called to see if they would negotiate a price for a new screen for the Evo 4G LTE.  I know most places are a complete rip off, especially since the screen itself costs $30 and there are plenty of videos that show you how to do it yourself (like the one below).  The issue is if you're not familiar with taking apart phones, this will be extremely time consuming so I was trying to find out if it was worth my time to do.  You can get a refurbished phone on Ebay for $80 so obviously I would not pay more than that.  His tone was just such that I could tell he did not care if he got my business.  I ended up at Direct Repair...with their Yelp! specials they are very good!ebay.com/itm/HTC-EVO-4G-…youtube.com/watch?v=Ae52…

32.description: These guys saved my life! I smashed my precious Iphone 4S today by dropping it accidently... I did a quick google search for 'cell phone repair' and CPR was the closest to me, I called for an  estimate and headed over. Arthur took great care of me, I was given a very great rate and the best part of all was this took ONLY 1 HOUR, and my phone was good as a new again!  Excellent craftsmen ship/quality of work! Arthur recommended a better case that he personally uses.  It is somewhat of a generic Ottor case. I appreciated his recommendations and sensitivity to my dilemma. Also 6 months warranty is included! Last great point is that they offer insurance it's about $25 for 12  months-This sounds better than paying a monthly premium for insurance only to pay a deductible to get your phone fixed. I am going to wait out the 6 months and then go with one of their insurance plans. Beats the hell out of Apple Care. Superior customer service, competitive prices, excellent work, and very quick-I mean who can be without their phone for more than a few hours? My cell phone disaster was turned around very quickly by- "CPR" , very clever name too! Thank you!

54.description: I have had a handful of experiences with these guys with a few different phones.  They usually get the job done, but the customer service is awful.  I have waited hours in their waiting room for a phone that I was told was ready to be picked up on more than one occasion.  One phone they couldn't find for months! And make sure you call them because they surely won't be calling you to tell you anything about the status of your phone.

48.description: So my Blackberry's ring that holds the tracking ball was cracked witch caused the ball to fall out and of course my insurance from T-Mobile didnt cover that and they dont sell individual parts in their stores. Booo! I looked online and the cheapest one was a set of parts that cost over $40!! So I drove by C.P.R. and ran in only because I saw an open parking space. That neighborhood sucks for parking. I showed the guy my phone and he said "No problem I got one in back" he returned seconds later with a new ring that fit perfectly and he didnt charge me a thing!! Thanks C.P.R. i will be back!

44.description: When I refused to take the "but you can upgrade" bait at T-Mobile, the store Manager actually referred my irritated little self over here.   All the upgrading in the world wasn't going to get my data off my phone so regardless, I had to repair the dataport.  For $65 my Blackberry, which I love and finally mastered, was repaired, good as new,

24.description: A cracked screen on a brand new Blackberry set me back about 100 dollars. The guy in the store seemed a little confused and the part they needed to order didn't take 2 business days as they said, but four business days. But my phone is fine now.

7.description: Pure garbage.  We dropped our phone off for repair about a week later we received a call saying they weren't happy with the repair job and they needed to order another screen and it might take two more weeks.  We were OK with that.  In two weeks they called to say it was done and we could pick up the phone. Great!  We were out if the state for two weeks and explained that to the guy and he said it wouldn't be a problem.  Two weeks later we go to pick up the phone and this is where things go wrong.  First the guy behind the counter was rude, next he couldn't find our phone and lastly when he found it there was a problem, it had the broken screen on it. He said we took to long to pick up the phone so they gave (sold) the screen to someone else to "get out of a jam".   No apology, nothing but rude service and being told to wait.  Needless to say we can not recommend them to anyone anyhow.  There are so many options out there, don't risk it

49.description: This place is like  the cell phone pediatrician. You walk in and hand your little one to the nice male nurse. He does a little intake and gets a history. My little Virgin Mobile wasn't re-charging. The nurse  gave me back the umbilical cord, and took my little guy into the exam room to see the doctor. He told me to go to the waiting room. And, yup, it is a waiting room: long row of chairs along one side, flanked by a cocktail table with a nicely fanned-out collection of "Women's Day" magazines. Nice big screen TV across from the seating area. WGN was on. I watched the news and waited and watched other patients come and go. I heard little whimpers, cries and beeps from the back.Maybe one-half hour later, the nurse came out with my baby, and told me that the doctor had cleaned its little openings and checked it's battery. That was OK. We plugged in the cord again, and Voila, it's little red light on its head went on. And it exclaimed: "I'm charging now!" Problem solved, I thanked the nurse and asked how much I owed. Nothing he, said. Almost moved to tears, I thought this place is the Stroger Hospital for cell phones! What a nice guy. What a great place. And a great service and urgent care center for the cell phone-addicted .

40.description: These guys really helped me out in a pinch!!  I had my phone repaired there in the winter, and I went in in May for a minor adjustment, and they took care of me.  No price gouging or acting like they didn't remember me.  I have to admit, I would not expect a level of service from a cell phone repair shop, but these guys are awesome.  They definitely exceeded my expectations.And oh yea...their prices are THE BEST in Chicago.  Their quote for repairing my phone was 25% cheaper than even the closest competitor.A++

53.description: This place is great. They have the best prices around, and fast turn around. For a quick fix, like replacing an iphone battery, I was in and out in about half hour. I also did some quote shopping around Chicago and they had the best price.

30.description: I dropped my phone in sand and the power button was sticking and i took it to this place to have them clean it out.
