Upon opening the cell phone they said there was water damage to the phone and that they would need to charge me for a water damage repair. I was OK with that so long as my phone was functional. So the the next day I went back to the shop and they said that the phone was not able to be repaired! I opened the phone and noticed that my SIM card was missing. But thought that I had just misplaced it. In an attempt to not have to buy a phone to replace this one which was less then 3 months old I took it to another repair shop and they opened it up and said that the they could remove the sand but that the the phone was missing the speaker. I called CPR and asked them to explain what they did and the repair guy could not say anything. When i told him that I was going to cancel payment and file a complaint with the BBB he just said "go ahead." I realize that other people on Yelp have given this place glowing reviews but I would def not go back to them there is something shady going on here. If you do decide to use this place get a complete work order of what has been done to the the phone.

46.description: Mytouch 4G - Cracked Screen/ Cosmetic damage/$145 including tax This place is close to okay. The service took a long time. I asked ahead of time to check how long the repair would take and they told me 2 hrs but it took over 3.5hrs. And I think its expensive. I mean, I've gotten a quote from another place before and they were much cheaper but they didn't have it in stock and I didn't want to leave my phone unrepaired so I came here. I mean, the cost of the digitizer is only around $25 when you buy it from ebay, except you have to take the phone apart and put it back together yourself. But its ridiculous to how much they're charging for the service.  Next time I will do it myself, there are youtube videos that shows you how to and when you buy the digitizer, it comes with a kit that has the tools you'll need. Probably will never go back here again unless the screen stops working and its still under warranty. I don't recommend this place.

1.description: Ya don't trust this guy.  I went in and asked him if he could repair my phone.  He said they couldn't get the part.  I went home and did a search on the computer and found the replacement part for cheap in seconds on Amazon and pretty much every other major site out there.  I'm guessing he wanted to try and sell me a new phone instead of having to fix a phone he couldn't charge a lot to repair since it's inexpensive.Nope.  Sorry.

55.description: These guys were good! I broke the charging port of my BlackBerry and they fixed it in no time! I went there, no other customer at the Skokie location and they said about 40 mins, and $65.00! I thought it was alittle steep but i didn't want to buy another phone since i still had time on my AT&T contract and I didn't want to extend it! Anyways, they fixed it  fast and so far they did a good job! The price was steep, but the service and the convince of having my CrackBerry fixed within minutes is worth it! Others may take days!Overall a good place to get your phone fixed!

9.description: The guys here did their best to work out a small problem with my iPhone. They took a couple attempts at it - seemed trustworthy, knowledgeable, but were unable to fix it ultimately. They didn't charge me. Much appreciated - a business with integrity!

26.description: After reading some of the reviews here, I decided to call them first to ask how much they usually charge for a cracked iPhone 5 screen and how long it will take them to fix it. The guy that answered my call was very rude. He just hung up the phone after telling me the price when I wasn't even done talking. Sorry but I'd rather take my business somewhere else.

25.description: I didn't even know cell phone repair even existed... but hit up YELP when my Samsung Galaxy S2 decided it didn't want to stay working - went to the T-Mobile store at Clark and Balmoral (DON'T) and they called it junk and told me I needed a new phone for $400 that I could pay over time with a new 2 year contract or some kind of nonsense...  read the reviews here ... after 7 days of no phone...and phone shopping to no avail.... I had to do something - so I went over to CPR with little expectation it could be fixed... and... the nice (and kinda cute desk guy) says... no problem... it's the power button... you will be good to go in 30-45 minutes - 30 minutes later... Voila!!! Cost me $55... come to mama!  ($61 if you include  my stop at Subway across the way where I waited) An eBay phone was $180.... this was a DEAL to me.  I will recommend - and will go get an otter-box for my phone so I don't have any more problems!

12.description: Quick, affordable and easy!I dropped my new iPod 4 while running and completely shattered the screen.  Took it in to CPR Repair and they had a new screen replaced within 24 hours for $125.  At first they told me they would do their best to get the top screen off which would be $125 but if that didn't work it would be over $200.  Deep down I figured I'd be spending $200.  To my surprise they called a few hours later to tell me they were able to do the first repair for $125 without having to replace the whole thing.  I'm a fan.  Hopefully I don't have to go back (no offense, CPR!) but at least I know where to go should I find myself in the situation again.

59.description: I found them through Google and hesitated to go here because the Yelp reviews were so all over the place but I was desperate to get my Crackberry fixed so I took the chance. The place was very clean and the guy who helped me was helpful and friendly. I had to get the chrome circle around my trackball replaced and he said it would cost $15 (which seemed fair considering the other option was to buy the piece online for about $5 and pay about $10 in shipping). He replaced it within two minutes and I was good to go. The only thing I noticed was that it had to be a used part because part of the silver paint had chipped off and you could see the black. I'm not picky but I can see how other people might find this disappointing. I honestly didn't care at all. I was just glad I got my phone fixed right away! I'd definitely come back here in the future because they seem to be knowledgeable about Blackberries and they have walk-in service with good hours.

21.description: Overdue on my review I first came here in September and once Again in October of this year. Both times fast and friendly service and great price!!!Need to say Thanks to Andy! I highly recommend this spot if your prone to dropping your phone...

17.description: These guys were great. My son's iphone took a swim through our washing machine, but was still working (phew). He had some slight screen staining, but mostly I wanted to have the inside of the phone cleaned out to make sure we didn't get corrosion in a few weeks. The guys at CPR were extremely nice. Since they could see that the phone was working, they offered to charge me just for an internal cleaning instead of the regular price for a water-damaged phone. They had the work done in an hour and even had the tech show us photos of the inside of the phone and give us feedback on what we saw. I highly recommend CPR.

10.description: I called to see if they would negotiate a price for a new screen for the Evo 4G LTE.  I know most places are a complete rip off, especially since the screen itself costs $30 and there are plenty of videos that show you how to do it yourself (like the one below).  The issue is if you're not familiar with taking apart phones, this will be extremely time consuming so I was trying to find out if it was worth my time to do.  You can get a refurbished phone on Ebay for $80 so obviously I would not pay more than that.  His tone was just such that I could tell he did not care if he got my business.  I ended up at Direct Repair...with their Yelp! specials they are very good!ebay.com/itm/HTC-EVO-4G-…youtube.com/watch?v=Ae52…

5.description: When you drop your phone and shatter the glass and you have a flight that afternoon, you have few options.  Thats where I found myself and this business happened to be right around the corner from my house.  The phone was "fixed" in an hour, but the gooey, sticky black glue was still oozing out of the edges around the glass.  The phone unfortunately didn't really work as well as before, often with the glass not reacting to touches.  It was $305 for the service, a good $50 or so above market price for what they did.  Upside was that I had a mildly workable phone in 65 minutes.  Downside was that it turned a great phone into a mediocre one.I suppose I could have gone back for them to fix it, but I travel ALL WEEK, so I would have just preferred the phone be fixed right the FIRST TIME.

3.description: First I requested a online estimate to fix my phone screen, which was cracked.  I never heard back from them.  When I walked over to see if someone could fix my phone they were going to charge me $75 more than what apple said they would do it for.  The person at the font desk didn't seem interested at all. I ended up not using them and going through apple

35.description: My phone was being funky and occasionally useless and was dealing with it for months it since I was a year away from any upgrades.  I figured I could see what these guys could do so I wouldn't have to fork out $500 for a new phone.  $65 and 35 minutes later, my phone was back to its magical working self!  No longer am I kicking myself for not getting the fancy insurance with this phone when I know there is a place out there that is reasonably prices if a technical glitch arises.

19.description: My phone got wet and rice helped but the screen was still discolored so I brought it here to try to get it back to normal. They required a $45 fee just to drop it off, then any repair costs when you pick it up. They were very sure about the repair so I thought that was reasonable. Bad decision. I go back at the end of the day and they tell me that they can't fix it. They showed me photos of it having been taken apart to look at, like this is proof that they worked on it. I can't prove that they didn't though so I take my phone and leave, only to find that now it is worse. The screen is more discolored and flickers so much I can barely see what's going on, let alone use it! And the microphone is now broken also. So I payed $45 to make a warped but functional phone totally useless! Never using this place again!

28.description: I came here because I saw all the good reviews on Yelp. But my advice is to be a bit weary. I really wanted to like them, they were kind, and I thought quite helpful, but it turned out not to be so in my case. My iphone had a cracked screen and my husband's had gotten rained on.  I brought them in to discuss my options. Andy, the young repair guy, was kind, explained things well, and gave me what I thought was a good deal. The phones were repaired and all was good, the phones worked! Huzzah! But then I noticed that now my phone's proximity sensor was not working. I couldn't talk on the phone with it next to my face without accidentally hanging up, muting, or calling a third party. Very annoying. Then, my husband's phone screen went black, but the phone was still on. I brought the phones back. They said to come back at noon, so I did. The phones weren't ready, so I had to come back again (two more times, this happened). Finally, they were able to fix my husband's phone, but were missing a part for my phone. So to come back on Monday. Later that day my husband then noticed his phone's proximity sensor was also not working, even though it had been after the first repair. I had to go out of town, and when I got back, I brought my phone back to get it fixed, but now they said that the problem with my phone was my fault. That it was a problem because they had to fix my cracked screen. Basically, I would rather had a phone with a cracked screen than a phone I can't hold up to my ear. If this is a common problem with fixing cracked screens they should have warned me.I wanted to change this to three stars because they have a six month warranty and Andy is just so plain kindhearted, but after another run in with them. I can't. They said they would fix the sensor for $35 in two hours, since it was so annoying, i decided to go for it, even though i felt like i shouldn't have to pay for it. I came back two hours later, it wasn't ready. I biked home and didn't want to bike back to the store only to be told it still wasn't ready, so I waited til the next day. When I got there the next afternoon, it still wasn't ready. I waited two more hours. They said it was finally fixed. I paid my $35 dollars and left-- Only to discover the sensor still wasn't working. I had to return AGAIN and demand my money back. Which they gave me willingly--no questions asked--which made me think when they sent me home the day before with my phone they knew it wasn't working! Lame.

45.description: I brought my one month old HTC Sensation in for repair.  Within just a few days they were able to get the part, complete the repair and get my phone back in my hands.  Since my phone was just released a month or so ago and has a non-standard design, I was really impressed.

33.description: I went in to have my phone looked at for a broken power button.  They damaged the frame getting it open to look at the internals.  I didn't notice this at the time, and when the price was a bit higher than I wanted to pay, I left.  Got home and discovered they had taken the SIM card out and not put it back in.  Called from another phone but they were closed, so I left a message and they never got back to me.  Thankfully T-Mobile got me a new SIM quickly enough, but I was left very unimpressed by the service at CPR.

43.description: I went in with a broken trackball on my Blackberry, five minutes and $25 dollars later it was as good as new.  This is a no nonsense, reasonable store for all types of cell phone reapairs.  Highly, Highly recommended!!

2.description: What great turn around time.I gave them my HTC - which no one else wanted to touch because they "weren't designed to be opened and repaired". Less than 48 hours without my phone later, I have a perfectly working screen. On close inspection I can tell it has been repaired but it takes a good minute of looking at the seems where the LCD screen meets the phone and even then its not bad. Good service, easy to contact by phone, reasonably priced. Highly recommend.

18.description: Great service. Super nice staff. They said it would take 2 hours, but it only took one. I had also lost my headphones and they gave me a free pair. Will definitely go back there again if I need a screen repair (although I hope my screen doesn't break again!)

41.description: These guys are amazing. Took my iPhone 3Gs (don't laugh) in to fix a shattered screen. Phone was working just fine with the cracked screen (shame on me for texting on broken glass), but after they replaced the screen, the phone stopped working. Rudi at CPR did everything, and I mean everything, he could to get that phone to work. He ended up replacing the motherboard - on a $49 phone. (Thank you, AT&T, for not allowing me to buy a new phone until November.) I felt awful knowing that there was a very good chance the dropping of the phone was the cause of the trouble; however, CPR made sure I was a satisfied customer and fixed it anyway. They also gave me a free loaner phone while they worked on mine. If I had more phones to take there, I would. If you ever damage your phone in any way, head to CPR. They're great.

52.description: "While you wait" service comes at a price, and since I was a sucker enough for spending $400 for a Blackberry it's only fitting that I should pay through the nose for a minor LCD crack.  After a little bit of haggling (no haggle=$189, haggle=$100), we agreed to a somewhat reasonable price for getting the cellphone repaired in 30 minutes.  30 minutes later, I had a new screen.

50.description: It certainly looks like a shady hole in the wall, but these guys know their stuff and they could work out of a dumpster for all I care if they do their job well for the right price.  Besides, we're talking cellphone repair--its not like they're fixing your Mercedes.I walked in with my broken Motorola Razr v3t which had recently had the screen die and go black leaving me unable to access the vast majority of my contacts which were unfortunately stored on the phone and not the SIM--I also couldn't transfer them to my computer because I couldn't navigate through the menus to set the USB mode to data/fax.  I had taken apart the screen housing to see if it was a loose cable and while I didn't have the tools to get the hinge open to investigate further, my hunch was that it was the flex cable, even though it looked connected on the display part of the phone.I called and got a $35 quote over the phone--not bad.  I walk in, the guy takes one look at it and says "yep, severed flex cable" and then compliments me on my nice phone since they don't really make them this durable anymore.He said it would take about 30 minutes and cost about $45.  I said "wait a second--the guy on the phone said $35" and he responds "well, if that's what he said its not a problem."30 minutes later after hanging out in the bookstore down the street, I come back, phone is working great and I'm a very happy customer.I can't speak for others but reading these other revies, if you go in here knowing what you are talking about and don't appear like a clueless bag of money, you will get solid service and a fair value.  Costs are negotiable and if you would be comfortable haggling prices with a car repair shop, you'll be fine here.  If you constantly get ripped off at those places--don't waste your time, just go to your phone company and get a new phone.

4.description: Shattered my iPhone 5s screen yesterday (accidentally dropped on sidewalk). I randomly saw this place a few hours later while stopped at a red light along Damen. I walked in to get it fixed after reading countless reviews on how they work their magic. I dropped off the phone after quick check in (2 mins) process where they took some basic info down. Then I dashed out to run an errand. Came back in 90 mins (he told me it would take 45 mins but I allowed for  extra time just in case) and paid $109 for new screen. So much more bearable than (a) going to ATT or Apple Store to get new phone (b) shelling out $300 + for new phone and renewing contract for 2 years. Whew. Highly recommend this place if you shatter your smartphone screen.

6.description: Horrible experience! They wanted $45 to look at my phone while most places in town charge nothing. Never contacted me when they were done, so I went in there about 4-5 days later and they said there was nothing they could do for my phone. I took it to U Break I Fix and they were able to fix it. I feel like Cpr took my $45 dollars and never looked at my phone, or there just not competent enough to fix a water damaged iPhone. Either way unless you want to throw away money do not go to this place. 0 stars for sure!

22.description: Really quick, nice and knowledgable service. These guys know what they're doing and are very customer service oriented. I hope to never have to go back for a repair, but if I do, I know where I'll go. The owner is honest and wants to check all of the store's repairs before sending the product out the door.  I strongly recommend CPR.

15.description: Hands down this is the best place I have ever taken my laptop to be repaired.  Honest, detailed and look to find the best option and cost to the customer.  Edgar was great and was able to suggest options for the repair of my laptop which had liquid spilled into the keyboard. Con: Not all staff is friendly or as eager to satisfy the customerPro:  Affordable, timely turn-around and most staff want your business.  If you weren't satifisfied - go back and get management involved!

57.description: I now know why they call it a CrackBerry.  Take away my phone for a couple hours and I start to get the shakes.  But thanks to a little mouth to mouth from CPR, I'm as good as new.So last week whilst my phone was charging on the kitchen counter I accidentally knocked it off - which caused the thingamajig you plug the charger into to get knocked loose.  For a few days I could still charge it if I whispered sweet nothings into its ear and wiggled it around and found its sweet spot, but this morning there was no hope.  No matter how much I wiggled, pushed, pulled, prayed, yelled, and maybe even cursed the charger would not connect to the thingamajig and the phone wouldn't charge.  As my CrackBerry beeped at me that it's battery was low and was about to be rendered useless, I panicked for a moment...  but then remembered reading Yelp reviews on CPR, and while they were mixed, I was willing to give them a shot.I hopped on my bike and rode over there, praying that they could not only fix my phone but that I wouldn't have to sell a kidney to do it.I entered the store, and a lovely man greeted me.  I explained to him what my problem was, and he took one look at it and said, "OH...  yeah, that thingamajig needs to be replaced."  He told me it would be $65 and 40 minutes.  I said no problem.  He then noticed my bike helmet and told me I could bring my bike inside so I didn't have to leave it locked up outside.  I thought that was nice.I wandered into the nice, spacious, centrally air cooled waiting room and took a seat.  Note - other reviews mentioned stick chairs?  No idea what those were, but rest assured they now offer plenty of comfy seating and a big TV to watch.  There was one other customer waiting, though a couple more trickled in after me.  We all watched "Cheaters" in silence, until we all laughed at an especially idiotic boy, then we all started trading horror stories about our phones.  It was nice, and it kept our minds off the waiting - I likened it to waiting in a  hospital waiting room, waiting and hoping for good news.  We were all bonding over our loss...  of communication.  Sad, isn't it?About 45 minutes after I'd come in, my phone surgeon waved me over.  My phone was fixed!!  The thingamajig didn't move anymore!  He had my phone on a charger, and it was charging!  PRAISE JESUS!I quickly paid (came to $68 after tax), and was on my way.  Now my CrackBerry is as good as new, and from now on will only be charged on soft cushiony surfaces...  like clouds in heaven.

20.description: My phone had water damage from falling in the toilet (go ahead and laugh). It was positively dead, stuck on this strange screen with weird script.These guys took it apart, cleaned it and now it's as good as new. My husband convinced me to try this business, I was totally skeptical, but it worked! Great job.

36.description: Good and fast service (1 hour), but fairly expensive.  It was $65 for an iPhone battery replacement.

14.description: These guys are so sweet and very knowledgeable. My iPhone 4S power button broke a while back and they fixed it within an hour for a very reasonable rate (esp. as I did not need to replace my whole phone). Super nice employees who treated me with patience and respect -- I was a little worried I would feel or sound like an idiot in there, but they were encouraging and acknowledged that I was much smarter than I thought, haha. Thanks guys! Highly recommended!

1.description: Ohhh International, how I love thee!I've been going to this store since I was, ummmmm, in my mom's belly?! It's a family run grocery store, they are all soooooo friendly. Sales are always good, meat fresh, fruit fresh too. It's two blocks so of course I do a heck of alotta shopping in there. I moved out of the neighborhood last year, my dad still lives there though, and I find myself stopping in there from time to time. This is a great neighborhood grocery store, I recommend it!

0.description: This place is that old school sort of grocery store.  They have all that you would expect such as meat, produce, beer, wine and cheese.  I still cannot believe how much cheese a horse can eat.  I have popped in here from time to time when I am in the area and just need to bang out some chores such as getting food for the house.  The owner Telly? is a really cool guy; friendly and has a great sense of humor.  The rest of the staff is friendly especially Oscar the meat man.  Uhhh, that came off a little weird but still the guy is really a great guy.  Also they will except checks which I really do not know who uses but even less is who excepts them.

1.description: While I like to call myself a "Chicago foodie," my love for food really comes from my observant nature and analytical mind.  I also like to drift around the city, by foot, and to find some inspirations for writing.  Poncitlan Jalisco Taqueria is located diagonally across from the Unique Thrift Store in the Hermosa neighborhood (a transitional neighborhood in between Avondale and Belmont Central/Cragin).  I saw many Mexicans walk into this place constantly.  I told hubby that we would have Mexican for brunch, but he insisted on eating three (3) strawberries before walking out of the door.  Here's a little foreshadowing: he would suffer from the consequence of consuming these fateful strawberries later on.  What happened to him?  You would have to stay tuned, my friend.  This place appeared semi hole-in-the-wall.  There weren't many tables and sitting at the bar, but we were fortunate enough to spot a table before the church crowd was let out.  We had two (2) large horchata, menudo (weekend only), and chilaquiles en salsa verde (without meat, just huevo).  The service was prompt.  Even if the service was slower than what we expected, no worries, because "Day of Thunder," dubbed in Spanish, was on TV to keep us company.  We might be impressed by how well Mr. Tom and Ms. Nicole conversed in Spanish, but we were surprised by the portions of our food.  Especially the chilaquiles en salsa verde con huevo, the entire edge of the oval place was filled with the beans and salsa verde.  I didn't know how the plate was delivered, since there was no way to grab onto the rim of the plate.  The salsa verde was flavored well.  It was comfortably spicy.  Hubby didn't know that he was approaching to the "danger zone."  As he was attempting to finish up the last bites, he took a long pause and decided to raise a white flag.  He felt awful because he didn't like to waste any food.  Was the strawberry-trio really the culprit?  I wouldn't say the answer was affirmative, for we also had the large horchata.  The horchata was on the lighter side, which was how I typically like my horchata to be.  However, a stronger kick with the cinnamon would be much desirable.My menudo was palatable.  For $6.25, the portion was also generous.  Our $20 spent in Poncitlan Jalisco could have split into two (2) more individual meals.  We were going to run errands around town, so taking the extra food with us on the road wouldn't seem too feasible and convenient.  Remember to come here with a 100% empty stomach.

9.description: The best tacos I've had in my life! The chicken is so juicy and seasoned perfectly! The burritos are great to, they are so huge and priced amazing.

23.description: I've been there a lot of times, the service is great, the staff.is friendly, and the food is delicious. I love tacos de tripa and tortas.I used to drive all the way to southside(little village) to eat tacos, now I just walk two blocks and enjoy  some of the best tacos in chicago.

12.description: My Spanish comprehension may only be so-so, but I am proud to say I have a keen ear for detecting a good intellectual debate in *any* language."Si, pero [insert incomprehensible intellectual Spanish here]" the one man at the next table over stated calmly, before taking a bite into his torta."Si, pero [insert incomprehensible intellectual Spanish here]" his dining companion responded, opening his mouth wide both to pick up the volume and also to sink his teeth into an enchilada.It gets a bit confusing, there being no less than *four* taquerias named Poncitlan within the small pizza-slice-shaped neighborhood called Hermosa. Just like the other Poncitlans, there's a very broad range of decent quality Mexican food here, the standard options of steak, chicken, avocado, etc. on your choice of taco, tostada, burrito, torta, etc. The possibilities for above-average Mexican dining are endless. This place has some interesting seafood options available as well, but your irresponsible reviewer has yet to try them (some day!)."SI, PERO [INSERT INCOMPREHENSIBLE INTELLECTUAL SPANISH HERE]!" the first Latino shouted, underscoring what must have been such a forceful point that his dining companion dropped his fork.With my untrained palate, I really can't taste much difference between the food at this Poncitlan (Poncitlan Jalisco) and the unrelated Poncitlan Azteca on Armitage & Keeler and Lindo Poncitlan on Armitage & Kostner. Good experience with the tostadas and enchiladas so far, and with three table salsas I can fine-tune the adrenaline kick and flavoring to my liking. The difference seems to lie mostly in the atmosphere... Whereas Lindo Poncitlan casts a clean, family-friendly vibe, Poncitlan Azteca is plastered with Corona posters and margarita specials, clearly targeting a drinking crowd. Laid out like a diner, it seems Poncitlan Jalisco is a bit livelier than both, and has something for all types- solo diners, girls' nights out, dates, intellectual conversationalists."SIIII, PEEERRROOO [INSERT INCOMPREHENSIBLE INTELLECTUAL SPANISH HERE]!" the second Latino shouted, slamming his fist onto his table and leaping to his feet.All was quiet for a good moment, until a smile slowly came across the first guy's face."Es lo mismo," (it's the same) he said, softly and gently. The other nodded, "Es lo mismo." The first got up, and they both shook hands.Nothing brings people together like a good meal at a solid Mexican restaurant.

21.description: I love this place! I eat here all the time. Great tacos, tostadas and all of the sauces are fantastic too.

16.description: I was craving a good Mexican breakfast for about three years now. Which was the last time I was here.This was a great way to start my morning. I flew in to Chicago today and my parents took me straight to their favorite Mexican breakfast place. Poncitlan has been here for years. They have become good friends with my parents. Jose the owner of Poncitlan jokes with my dad about which soccer team they root for.The place is pretty big. I mean it is no Kissimmee. This has much room and the staff here are working hard in the kitchen making every order as quickly as possible.Guacamole. I love going to good Mexican restaurants and ordering this. All of the ingredients nice and fresh. Just what the doctor ordered.Salsa and Guacamole.Elvia was our server today. When we walked in the table was set and the menus laid on the table. Elvia knew my parents would be coming today since they come every Sunday. The place gets full quickly with all the locals. By the time we left people were waiting outside to be seated. Now lets talk FOOD!!Desayuno Poncitlan. The Poncitlan breakfast. 3 over easy eggs, topped with ranchero sauce and ribeye.Desayuno Poncitlan.This is the same dish with no ranchero sauce. My mom and dad like it plain. I enjoyed it with the sauce on top.Chilaquiles Rojos.I was very hungry after a short flight from Orlando. I always have to order one more thing just to have something extra. I ordered this as a side. It tends to come with eggs and steak as well.Elvia y Jose, Gracias for todo. Mis papas siempre hablan de ustedes y que siempre los tratan muy bien. Se los agradezco mucho.

10.description: Delicious, inexpensive & not to mention authentic! Horchata is so good, even had my boyfriend hooked! And that says a lot from a man who dislikes the stuff. Me? I would love to chug it down right this minute. I always order a steak burrito with everything in it. Quick and delicious! My boyfriend eats tortas and gives the place an A. I live 7 minutes away so it's great for when I am hungry or just quenching for Horchata with my boyfriend! A hidden gem for sure!

5.description: They make the best Menudo in town, good service, excellent food! If you ask for things in a certain way they accommodate it to your taste! Love this place! Recommend it 100%

11.description: Love coming here, great food, great atmosphere, and it may not look as wonderful as other restaurants but it's at least peaceful without the noise of other places... My favorite would have to be the gorditas with there red sauce that's given with the chips.....

22.description: I am really surprised more people haven't reviewed this place.I had a sopes and a gordita with ground beef. First off this was almost too much food. They used fresh ingredients and The made the sopes and gordita shell fresh as far as I could tell.They don't get a five star cause the seasoning wasn't perfect by my standards, but this personal preference. I can see others totally  giving it five stars.

0.description: Tasty fast food! If you leave in the area you must check out this place, they have tacos,tortas burritos, and delicious Mexican plates. I have ordered the gorditas de aguacate for when I'm feeling vegetarian and the lengua en salsa verde and skirt steak when I'm feeling carnivorous. I'm never disappointed! It comes with a salad rice and beans which are not bland. Try it out and thank me later.

20.description: I loved going to this place when I lived in the area. Now we live a little further away and don't get to go very often. I am very picky about menudo but this place has awesome menudo. It's a small place but the service is very good and the staff are excellent and very attentive. Their Desayuno Alpastor is mouth-watering and you get large portions.

19.description: I am really surprised more people haven't reviewed this place.I had a sopes and a gordita with ground beef. First off this was almost too much food. They used fresh ingredients and The made the sopes and gordita shell fresh as far as I could tell.They don't get a five star cause the seasoning wasn't perfect by my standards, but this personal preference. I can see others totally  giving it five stars.

2.description: I live a few blocks away from this place, and hubby and I come often.  They have pozole and menudo on the weekends which never dissapoint.  Their parrilladas are good and the portion sizes are pretty big too.  On my way out i always always always get a mexican coffee (coffee with cinnamon) to go.  Simply delicious.

18.description: Great Staff, Great tasting food! Their Gorditas are amazing as well as their tacos de Al pastor. Their Agua de Horchata is the best one I have ever tried, hands down!! Their quesadillas are so cheesy and delicious!! They make your food quick too! :)

13.description: Amazing place ! Very friendly staff, good price, the plates are well-done. I came here a few times and it has never failed me :-) always been pleased with the customer service and my food! Favorite dish from there is "camarones a la plancha", honestly i felt like they take care good of their tables compared to other places which take forever! I highly recomend this place . :-)

4.description: Loved it! Three massive plates with 3 drinks for a total of $25. The service was fast, the food was great, and the price was perfect.

24.description: I've eaten here several times. The food is quick, delicious, and authentic. I do not eat meat, but I love their chile rellenos and their avocado tacos. They also have an amazing guacamole. After you order, you can watch your food being made, because the grill is right behind the register. It's fun to watch them make the guacamole right after I order it. People I know who have eaten meat there have claimed it as one of the best taquerias in the city.

6.description: Easily the best tacos I've ever had. They are inexpensive and huge. They give you twice as much meat as anywhere else I've had tacos. I eat here a minimum of 2 times a week, up to 6 times. They make most everything in house. There's usually a large pot on the stove where they're making their latest batch of soup or ranchero sauce or hibiscus tea (aka jamaica). My usual is an al pastor taco and a ground beef taco. Also their cheese is fantastic.

15.description: This place is a hidden gem. The whole staff is very friendly and the cooks can move 100 mph. When you sit down you're greeted with complimentary chips and salsa and given a huge menu. Personally I get the steak burrito or tacos and it's always on point. I work down the street and usually end up getting lunch here 3 times a week. Great place for takeout as well, food comes very fast! Overall a great place to munch!

7.description: Love this place. I came here so after to pick up Steak Gorditas with a red sauce that my pregnant wife got hooked on. When we are too lazy to cook at home or want something good and freshly made this is our spot.

8.description: Came here for breakfast with my family on a sunday morning.  The place is dingy, but I always had good food experiences.  Very authentic mexican food.This time around my dad found a LONG BLACK HAIR on his gordita, mind you he is bald; when we told the waitress she got all offended and my dad had to ask her for a new one.   All upset, she took his plate and change the gordita, left the same plate and just kind of threw the plate on the table.   "No im sorry, no what I can do for you," just plain rude. A friend had warn me before about how she had gotten sick from eating here, and after this I belive her, and I am never eating here again.  No matter how good their tacos are.

3.description: Complimentary salsa and chips!! And it's good! Their chicken tacos are my favorite! Very reasonable prices! Not the "fanciest" of places, but it works!

14.description: Loved it!!! Makes up for lindo ponciltian!!! And they didnt over charge me!!! I can say I found a new home. It is kinda of dark, and waitresses are stickly buisness but we were okay with that. The meat was tastier and more meat in the tacos. The plates were ultimately bigger prtions. I'm just really happy with it.

3.description: I brought my girlfriend here on Valentine's day, she loved it, so I do. Very good prices! Awesome staff!

1.description: I loved my red color I came in with a picture and Elizabeth gave me the color I wanted and was patient threw the whole coloring process. I came in with multicolor black hair and came out with the red violet color I wanted.

2.description: Elizabeth is amazing. She did a permanent tattoo making my life easier waking up every morning. I don't need to apply make up anymore. Coming back!

0.description: I got my first short lob haircut  at another salon a few days ago. It wasn't what I was going for and I was quite disappointed given that my entire life I've had long healthy hair . I was considering returning to the salon I had gone the first time but I decided to go here instead- boy was it the best call ! I went in after work with very short notice. The owner was working on a client and I patiently waited for her to help me. She was very friendly and asked a lot of questions.  She definitely knows what she is doing ! I'm very happy with her help and expertise !  Yay! Finally an angled Lob that I love.

1.description: This is the closest liquor store to my house (1 block away) so it would only be logical that this is the liquor establishment that I give a large portion of my earnings to on the weekends. Lol  hey don't judge me I work hard and pay my taxes!! I love to indulge on champagne after a long work week and this Liquor Store of Convenience is a block from my house. They do charge a dollar more for my bottle of choice than the liquor store on the corner of Armitage and Cicero does, but their service for regulars is the dominant trait that keeps me coming back to this local watering hole. The owner has become quite accustomed to consistent taste for of chilled champagne , so he goes out of his way to order lots of my favorite brand and chills them in a separate cooler just for me. No dusty bottles, no fuss trying to find my fave brand, just a frosty bottle of my choice champagne ready to be popped and enjoyed. The guys at the register always got jokes and keeps their patrons laughing in line. I've also witnessed on numerous occasions the cashier giving the kids who got dragged in by their alcoholic parents free pieces of candy. Sooo sweet! 5 star review for 5 star service.

0.description: Like the other reviewer, this is the closest liquor store to my house.  Pioneer is a locally-owned liquor store in Hermosa on a stretch of Armitage that doesn't have much happening besides taquerias and storefront churches.  No, this isn't a fancy liquor store with a humongous selection, but they have what you need: liquor.  There's a decent beer selection and they're even expanding to offer the more hipster stuff like Lagunitas, Revolution, and Half Acre brews for your drinking pleasure.  They have an oddly large selection of sparkling wines but that's cool if you're into it.  There's pop, milk, candy, and a small selection of salty foods if you need a snack.  All in all, not the fanciest liquor store around, but definitely has what you need and always feels like the neighborhood store.  The owner and workers of this place are super friendly, always willing to laugh and joke, and clearly have a good rapport with all of the regulars that come in here.  I'm happy to say this is my neighborhood liquor spot.

3.description: I shop here monthly for my meats best stuff especially ground beef veryf resh... menudo n homemade salsas are delish so is the nopales salad n carnitas very friendly family nd da xurly head boy is hilarious!!!

1.description: I work twi blockes away. Great small mexican grocerry store. The best thing is that they have a restaurant attached to the store. Really good home made mexican food. Daily specials!

2.description: Burned my eggs, overcooked my meat, cold rice, old avocado, chilaquiles were good, waitress had a shitty atitude. Never again!

5.description: I usually go here for little groceries ghat I had may forgotten. The place is really small an clutter. I truly like they have a lottery machine!

6.description: If you are looking for arracherra or longaniza to put on the grill then this is the place. Also on the weekend you can buy delicious carnitas.

7.description: decent enough mexican grocery store, but the real attraction is the very no-frills cafe in the back.  all your typical taqueria staples, the best thing has to be the "combinacion el mitote", which consists of an enchilada, a taco al pastor, a carne asada sope and a guacamole tostada, all for only $6.99. seriously, order this with an extra taco or two and you've got enough for two people. and this guacamole i mentioned comes in a pile the size of one of chicago's healthier-looking pigeons and is pounded up fresh when you order!

0.description: I live in Bolingbrook. My family lives in Chicago and they live within walking distance to El Mitote. When I visit my family every two weeks, my mom has the menudo for me to eat. BEST MENUDO EVER. compliments to the person or the people that prepare it. The best menudo we've ever eaten. Seriously. I'm eating a bowl as I type this review. :D

4.description: This place has the best deli meats. The butcher guys are friendly and have your meats cut just the way you want it. Everything else is a little over priced.

attributes.Good For: Breakfast, Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Late Night, Dessert

58.description: There be hipsters about.And I don't mean that in the perorative. The term "hipsters" can refer to people who see themselves as annoyingly superior in their cultural tastes, but as applied to Metropolis I'm talking about the people who work there. Low-key. Unassuming. Slow to anger. Quick to smile. Nothing seems to faze them. I've seen total assholes move up to the register and by the time they are through ordering they've calmed down because how can you stay angry in the face of such calm  imperturbability? That so many have ponytails and wear flannel and skinny jeans is secondary and irrelevant. What matters is that this is one of the best coffee houses I've been to anywhere, much less in Chicago which has decent-to-nice independently owned coffee houses every few blocks. The hot beverage selection is unmatched whether you drink coffee, tea or something else. The coffee is delicious and cheaper than Starbucks for basic coffee. (Order a Red Eye!)The cold beverage selection is a bit lacking and slightly expensive (diet soda, please!) The snack and pastry selection, while not extensive, is perfectly fine for someone who comes to a coffee house to do serious work. And this is the place for serious work or just have a coffee with friends. Two and one-half large rooms of seating with free wifi and electrical outlets nearly everywhere. Don't let the fact that this place is huge (for a coffee house) fool you. It's large but it's also crazy popular. Get there before 10:00 am and you should be OK. Later in the evening closer to closing time and you might snag a table on your first cruise through the place. There is communal seating in some places and two comfy sofas, so finding a place for one person is easier. Two or more and you take your chances. You  learn the ebb and flow of the crowd after a while.I love this place. I'd bet you will also.(This supplants my previous short review.)

56.description: I am in town visiting and came across this coffee shop. I ordered a caramel latte and a bagel and loxs. The staff was very nice and my order came out pretty quick. The cafe was filled with people but the line moved quick. I'll definitely be coming back when I'm in town again.

29.description: A classic urban coffee shop; eclectic, mellow and welcoming.  Delicious lattes and one of the best bagel and lox sandwiches around. The side salad is a welcome touch.

42.description: Breakfaest eggs are good and affordable.

23.description: Love the espresso drinks and the vibe. In the morning they have pastries from the Middle Eastern Bakery!

47.description: I'm normally pretty unimpressed by most coffee places. But I was here the other day for a meeting, and for the first time in a while I had a delightful experience.Most coffee places I find the service to be a bit smug and standoffish. Here I found the staff to be enthusiastic and informed. I had some questions about their tea selection, and even though it looked a little busy, one of the baristas took the time to help explain the differences and give his opinion. There were no rolls of the eyes, or terse responses, it was helpful and considerate.The atmosphere was relaxing, and had a good buzz about it. If you're in that northern area of Chicago--and are either trying to find space to get some constructive work done, Metropolis is the place for it!

8.description: Two stars.  Coffee is fresh roast but their gimmick seems to involve playing around with different varieties of beans and mixing light/dark roasts together to make some of their signature blends.  Not a huge fan of this sort of apostasy--having a coffee with both a loud citrus (underdone) and a scorched plywood flavor (well done) is just not palatable, IMO.Facility is good sized and hipsterish in decor, replete with cafe tables, weird furniture and avant-garde artsy pictures on the walls.The baristas seem aloof and forcibly nice, and act like they all belong to some exclusive coffee guild that only tolerates customers if they genuflect and pay proper homage to their skills. They appear to communicate with each other using eye rolls, smirks and odd looks, usually while you're ordering. Not sure of the exact dialect, but if you're into having your coffee made by a guild-like group of folks then you're all set.Despite having a cash tip jar on the counter they will SHAMELESSLY AUTO-TIP YOU on your bill if you use a CC to pay.  This tees me off, especially when I'm just buying a coffee and leaving the premises--what service am I needing to tip them for?  There is no real service involved.  And if you dare to check "no tip" on your receipt then they get kind of short with you--zero to bitch in 3 seconds.The desserts are usually creative in nature and reasonably priced--had a great oatmeal pie there once.Two stars.

31.description: Amazing coffee while somehow having a cozy and non-pretentious atmosphere. This seems like a rarity nowadays in Chicago. Seriously this is the perfect place. Located right down the road from home and not as crowded as some other coffee shop experiences.

34.description: Nice coffee place...i love their tea and how it is served. Very good customer service...i like this place

16.description: Of all the local roasts, Metropolis is by far the best coffee in town, and perhaps the best coffee period. It is brewed in such a way as you can really taste all the various flavors which almost seem to be translated in to "tones".  They all complement each other and give a really full flavor.  I buy them by the pound for my espresso machine.  The cafe is awesome.  The bakery is incredible. I had the Dutch apple pie made with sour cream.  Yuh-Ummmm!  So incredibly rich.  I don't get in the area very often, because I live downtown, but I try to detour my way over to Edgewater so I can pick up coffee, and enjoy the atmosphere. The coffee is spectacular.

13.description: About as cool as an independant area coffee shop can be. Comfy seats, lots of room, excellent coffee, an all around excellent societal setting. The folks are friendly, the food is great, but the java is the star of the show. Roasted on premise, this really is as fresh and high quality as there may be, also it reveals. From their espresso based beverages to the entire bean coffee to bring home, everything tastes wonderful.

11.description: Pretty cool place, the drips are very interesting and definitely a conversation starter. They always accommodate my big orders in a timely matter. Staff is always friendly as well!

39.description: A perfect balance between being rundown/shitty and cool. Whoever put this place together was clever - minimal art on the walls (much of which is by local artists and for sale), a large space to utilize, and some pretty good coffee. I enjoy coming here for these reasons.  Understandably, every time I come here it's pretty packed.  The crowd seems to be mostly students and friends hanging out. Be prepared to get overwhelmed by the amount of hipsters that are within a 20 foot radius of where you're sitting.  Whatever, though, they don't bother me.As far as drinks go, I have tried their iced chai, regular coffee, and Italian soda.  All were good.  They don't carry almond milk, sadly, but they do offer hemp milk for those who don't do dairy or soy.  Parking is plentiful.  Out front is regular paid parking.  Further down the street, in the residential areas, there's free parking (just a short walk away), and the company provides a small lot next door for customers (but good luck finding parking there).  I am a big fan of coffee shops and the environment they provide when I'm studying for school.  At the moment, I'm taking a break from a 20 page paper that's due in...oh...two weeks (only 16 more pages to go!).  Places like Metropolis provide just the right amount of human contact for people like me who don't like working in total silence.I'll definitely be coming here for a long time to come.

37.description: Just moved into the neighborhood and am so happy I came across this coffee nook. Great for a good cup of coffee and delicious pastries.

0.description: This is probably one of my favorite coffee shops in Chicago. The coffee is excellent! The shop has a hippy feel to it with a welcoming environment. It's usually crowded with students probably from Loyola since it's close by. It's also close to the lake. So my friends and I like to grab coffee from here and walk over to the lake nearby. The lake also has a playground that the kids can play at while you enjoy your coffee and the view. In terms of parking there's a good amount of free street parking. The service is always excellent!I like to get the house blend of the day, mocha and my friend got the Mexican hot cocoa( I think)it was excellent. In terms of coffee my three favorite places  to get a good cup of coffee are from metropolis, intelligentsia and ipsento. Definitely check this place out! They also sell there house blend coffee beans at target if you can't make it out to the store.

38.description: Thank you Jennifer Greenburg and Melissa Sands for recommending this spot!The cold brewed Kyoto style coffee is wonderful. Plenty of seating. We joined the coffee club.

51.description: Metropolis is a mainstay for me.  I can count on Metropolis to provide great coffee, truly free wi-fi and a cozy environment to read, write or procrastinate.  I can't say I have ever had a less than delicious cookie, cinnamon roll (with a generous amount of icing), slice of cake or some other treat here either which is a plus when I need to indulge while studying.  The cafe is pretty spacious, seating spans two rooms and the stream of patrons ebbs and flows somewhere between steady and overflowing.  In other words, I have never seen the place less than half-empty during the various times I've popped by for a "spot" and a squat' I've generally been lucky to snag a seat during peak times provided I have time to wait patiently.  The music played here is truly "eclectic."  Sometimes it's more conducive to dancing on a table than relaxing with a book or staring at a laptop screen vigilantly and waiting for inspiration to hit so you can finish that paper.  Bring headphones.  The end.

27.description: Damn. The stereotype about Japanese "salarymen" working late into the Tokyo night must be true, if the Kyoto-style, cold-brew iced coffee having a groovin' house party on my tongue right now is any indication. This stuff is good and strong, good AND strong--all three combinations.I don't know what's with the folks in Kyoto, though. I once travelled there, and it was a mellow city with a rich history and a relatively slow pace of life, at least compared to the major cities of Japan. Maybe they are like the drug dealers that source & sell the stuff, but have a rule not to use the stuff. They just ship it to shaking addicts in Tokyo and beyond.I'm not up this way too often, but Metropolis has been on my 5-star cafe list since the first time I set tongue on it, about the time that it opened. The coffee is good, and I especially appreciate the ambience: the big couches and small and group tables; the multiple rooms, both quiet and with music; and the diversity of people here: a many-bean salad of ethnicities and earnings, students and salary-(wo)men, the young and the still-youthful, paper- and pixel-lovers, the engrossed and en-gossiped, those alone and accompanied... Stop me if I'm boring and belaboring you. The counter staff has always been friendly to me, and they've always had a sense of humor in this oh-so-serious world of coffee, where they clearly know beans about beans. When I've seen Jeff, the owner, he's regaled me with stories of his trips to Brazil and the large stacks of sacks of coffee we were standing by, and about the virtues of making espresso with a not-so-dark roasted bean. While I wish they were closer to my abode, I'm glad that they're not, because this place is one-of-a-kind.

32.description: Seth and other staff members helped me repeatedly by giving me used coffee grounds that I could use in my garden.  I'm extremely grateful for this.Also, at the main office, I was able to get giant burlap bags for free.  Yay for recycling!In addition, I like their hot chocolate and that they have cinnamon sticks among the complimentary items you can add to your drinks.  The space is large and not too crowded, and they also have a small sidewalk area where people can sit with their purchases and friendly dogs.Thanks again!

54.description: This is the best coffee in Chicago.  We are longtime residents of Edgewater and have been loyal to Metropolis since they opened on Granville. The coffee is exceptional, friendly service,great selection of food, and lots of seating (yet always full!). Now that we've moved to West Ridge, we make special trips to Metropolis for our coffee. I would love something similar within walking distance of our new home, Metropolis is such a wonderful anchor to our former neighborhood.

48.description: If Metropolis exchanged places with Starbucks and there were zillions of MCC's and 1 Starbucks, I would be okay with that. This perspective is coming from a Starbucks devotee. There is something  special about Metropolis. From the attention to detail of every single drink creation to the carefully selected espresso, coffee beans, tea leaves, unique sodas; there's something refreshing, aromatic, caffeinated and simply divine, for everyone to quench their thirst or merely wake up. Metropolis has the competition in the bag as far as quality, delicious tasting baked goods. Some are homemade, others are brought in from a bakery - all are simply delicious and worth every caloric bite! Several months ago, they advertised on Craigslist that that they were giving away free coffee bags. I got a bunch of these cool cloth bags - in fact, several of them. Not because I had an immediate use for coffee bags, but because I wanted the aroma of Metropolis in my house and I do want to find an art project where I can use the most interesting coffee bags.

44.description: I went here on a Sunday morning and it was packed, almost out the door. The service was good, but the coffee was alright. It was not worth the wait, but it wasn't bad either. An alright experience. Their house made pastries are delicious though!

24.description: Was a patron for seven solid years. When I told them I was moving, they packed up a ton of their pastries for the day to send me off with. They get to know you FAST here and they love familiar faces. The coffee is the best in the city, although anyone can tell you that. Conveniently located next to the L on the west and the lake on the east. Decor is fun and hasn't changed vibes in years. Loved it then, still rave about it now. Conducive to instagrammers that love taking shots of their cappuccinos.

7.description: I love going to Metropolis - strong internet connection, plenty of seating, they'll give you more hot water for your tea as often as you want. What is there not to like? I usually get the weekly pairing, because why not? Also because it saves me the stress of trying to pick a tea off what I think is a very substantial list, and then deciding whether or not to get a pastry. Just get the pastry and the tea they suggest. You won't be disappointed. Protip: if you have 500+ followers on Instagram, download the app Popular Pays for a free weekly pairing once a month! Literally MY FAVE thing.

49.description: This place takes pride in making great coffee. They are the younger and cooler version of starbucks. They are cheaper then starbucks and they have better customer service. They have free wifi and a lot of places to sit. I like their mocha ice coffee and would suggest to avoid this place during midterms and finals because it gets packed with college students that cant afford wifi lol.

40.description: I like their green tea latte. Creamy n smooth in consistency. Not a huge fan of coffee

53.description: LOVE!!!!!! I'm a barista and I totally cheat on my cafe with metropolis constantly. High quality coffee and tea and a very sweet, knowledgeable staff! The latte art is always phenomenal. Not a coffee or tea drinker? No problem. One of my favorite things is the large cooler filled with rare, amazing sodas. Metropolis has a great environment for hanging out with friends or even quietly studying. The cafe is always filled and somehow kept clean and pristine at all times. Ok just writing this review convinced me to head there for my afternoon cup. Bye!

30.description: This coffee shop is quaint and has really good coffee. They offer a few pies and quiches that are also delicious. I ordered the green tea latte here and it was slightly foamy on the top with the smooth feel in the middle I like. Added bonuses:1. There's currently a deal on Groupon here. 2. If you buy coffee here often, they have a deal where the 8th (?) coffee or so is free. I've only seen others use this as I haven't done it myself.

46.description: Outstanding coffee, easily the best around. The vibe of the place is super chill. The only thing holding me back from dropping a 5* is sometimes the staff acys a little to cool for school for me. Its a solid 4.5 * spot for sure.

1.description: I hung out all day here and it was great for studying! Although it was hard to find a table in the morning, by the afternoon there were plenty of open seats. A bonus is that they have lots of outlets all over so it's a great place to study. Their chai is so delicious too! A little pricey but definitely worth it on a cold day.

55.description: So delicious! Comfy, cheapish, and cool. Doesn't hurt that its right by my aptmt too :)

9.description: At the recommendation  of someone I'm following on Instagram, I decided to try out Metropolis. The hipster vibe is very much 2010, but the coffee is fantastic. I got the ginger coffee brewed with Kenyan Weithag as a pour-over. I liked it a lot. The coffeehouse is a nice size and seems to pack quickly. I will go for takeaway in the future.

26.description: This coffee shop feels like a nice quaint local establishment, with lots of great options of good coffee. We each had something different, and each was done with a lot of love and artistry. It's a pleasant change from the normal Starbucks that we normally get.The Green tea latte was definitely a highlight. Obviously it doesn't have as much caffeine... but it was superb.

25.description: Amazing! Excellent place to study, talk, read, think, relax, or just chill. I love the local artwork and the staff is incredible! Very cool place. I am grateful they are here!

12.description: This coffee shop feels like a nice quaint local establishment, with lots of great options of good coffee. We each had something different, and each was done with a lot of love and artistry. It's a pleasant change from the normal Starbucks that we normally get.The Green tea latte was definitely a highlight. Obviously it doesn't have as much caffeine... but it was superb.

59.description: Metropolis is that rare specialty coffee shop that also serves baked goods and other foods prepared on sight. The kitchen is wonderful, hatching up delicious tea-infused cakes and nourishing salads. Everything, including the baked goods from other businesses (such as pies and quiche from Hoosier Mama Pie company), is always fresh and generously portioned. The coffee and espresso--and my favorite, the Kyoto-style iced coffee--is invariably well-prepared by skilled baristas. My favorite indulgence: Kyoto-style iced coffee with a slice of Hoosier Mama chocolate cream pie. Not for the faint of heart!

21.description: Great little shop. The people who work there are nice, even when there is a complete jerk placing an order. The coffee is very good, I prefer darker roasts, but that has nothing to do with quality. Their espresso however, is very good. It is roasty but doesn't taste burnt. Smooth and sweet. It is also a great place to sit outside on a nice morning. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because it is not my favorite coffee shop ever. The fifth star is reserved only for those places.

17.description: I liked this shop, even before the expansion, because of the great coffee and the ample seating. After 7 years, I find myself struggling to continue to make it part of my regular routine, since exchanges with staff can definitely be enough to make you want to take your $6 coffee to go and forget you ever went in.Pros:Really great quality coffees and teasExcellent variety and selection of beveragesSpacious and conveniently arranged seatingCons: Shockingly pushy and rude men at the front of the house (It's every Monday now and it's a real bummer.)Pricey

10.description: Minus two stars for rude staff. Seemingly chaotic as to what station to go pick up items. Bagels come from the kitchen window quiches come from the cash register coffees come from cash register and espresso drinks take 20 minutes and come from the espresso bar. There really is zero sense of urgency from the baristas which is annoying because not all of us live the life of Riley and can afford to waste the entire day hanging out at the coffee shop.  Less than pleasant staff, really no accommodation to help the customer or deliver items, just rude instruction on where to go fetch everything.  Probably won't make it back here.

5.description: It was a great experience for me, because I'm a coffee lover. So I was visiting my friend nearby and we decided to get some coffee. She asked me if I tried this one and I didn't. So we went here. As I said before this was a good experience.

3.description: I cannot find a place like this serving sophisticated latte and nice intensity and flavor of coffee :) I enjoyed my latte with free wifi.Two things, I want to suggest this place are 1) spacing and 2) cleaning. I think they can organize interiors to fit more people and be wise to use space efficiently. This large crowd of people fighting for seating leads my second concern. It won't let any staffs to clean up the tables and floors because as soon as table is open, It was taken in a second, so it kept uncleanliness all the time. I hope they will fix these soon.

35.description: Of all the local roasts, Metropolis is by far the best coffee in town, and perhaps the best coffee period. It is brewed in such a way as you can really taste all the various flavors which almost seem to be translated in to "tones".  They all complement each other and give a really full flavor.  I buy them by the pound for my espresso machine.  The cafe is awesome.  The bakery is incredible. I had the Dutch apple pie made with sour cream.  Yuh-Ummmm!  So incredibly rich.  I don't get in the area very often, because I live downtown, but I try to detour my way over to Edgewater so I can pick up coffee, and enjoy the atmosphere. The coffee is spectacular.

19.description: I took the family on a walk around Edgewater, and I knew I wanted to stop in here  for a snack before we headed home. While I was there, I figured I'd get some iced coffee too.I can't tell you much about the Kyoto process, but I can say that it makes some fine iced coffee, one I'm very happy to drink black (okay, with a little bit of simple syrup). It's strong, definitely bold but not that bitter. We also had a blueberry crumble bar and a piece of apple cherry pie. The bar, which is made in-house, crumbled nicely and wasn't overly sweet. The blueberries were fresh, and the texture was excellent.The pie was even better, though I wish I knew which bakery it came from. The crust was flaky but sturdy all the way through, from the bottom of the crust out to the edges. There was an ample amount of fruit, and the pie topping reminded me of a great brown sugar crumble. I think a piece of pie runs $4.50... it's definitely worth it.A coffee house like this deserves to be well trafficked. There's many nooks and crannies for people to sit, and it's nice and quiet on the inside. I wish I had one of these closer to home!

28.description: I love Metropolis. I moved and I still get my coffee from them every week. Open a shop in Avondale ;)

45.description: The hazelnut latte is AMAZING. I really like this Metropolis location --lots of seating, friendly barristas. The only downside is that on the weekends, it can get too crowded. Otherwise, great location with free wi-fi.

33.description: I am not the biggest coffee drinker. I only started drinking coffee in the past 2 years, but I can honestly say this place has AMAZING coffee! I usually get a small sugar free vanilla iced coffee, put a little skim milk in it, and I'm good to go! The people who work here are always friendly, helpful, and patient. I don't ever feel rushed when I'm ordering a coffee here, which I sometimes feel at other coffee shops. I also love that I can sit and do work here. They play music, but it is relaxing music and not too loud - more of background noise. I think Metropolis is a hidden gem in Chicago and I am so glad I stumbled upon it one day!

43.description: I love Metropolis so much! I love walking in and smelling the coffee. I don't drink coffee, but I still love the smell! (If I could drink coffee I would start here! My BF & most of my friends are obsessed w Metropolis coffee.) Every time I come here I find my experience here so delightful. Awesome staff, delicious hot cocoa & whipped cream, great atmosphere, fun location, and yummy pastries! Support local business and check this place out. You won't be sorry!

2.description: I really like the atmosphere of this place. It's your usual cafe with great wifi. There are many seats and there are a lot of people, but it's not noisy, just the soft background chatter. I find this place perfect to study or get work done individually.I would definitely come here again, and take advantage of the free parking! I didn't know there was one, and ended up parking a couple blocks away in the residential areas because I didn't want to pay for parking! The lot next to the cafe is for MCC customers as well as those going to the thai restaurant across the street.

18.description: This coffee shop is quaint and has really good coffee. They offer a few pies and quiches that are also delicious. I ordered the green tea latte here and it was slightly foamy on the top with the smooth feel in the middle I like. Added bonuses:1. There's currently a deal on Groupon here. 2. If you buy coffee here often, they have a deal where the 8th (?) coffee or so is free. I've only seen others use this as I haven't done it myself.

41.description: Great customer service, good pies, amazing coffee. Convenient location, comfortable seating, free wifi.

52.description: Their pastries are to die for and their mochas are the best I've had in Chicago! Oh, also, all of their breakfast items (egg sandwich, oatmeal, and parfait) ...SO.GOOD! Seriously, if I didn't have time to make breakfast I'll head here and leave so satisfied.

50.description: I took the family on a walk around Edgewater, and I knew I wanted to stop in here  for a snack before we headed home. While I was there, I figured I'd get some iced coffee too.I can't tell you much about the Kyoto process, but I can say that it makes some fine iced coffee, one I'm very happy to drink black (okay, with a little bit of simple syrup). It's strong, definitely bold but not that bitter. We also had a blueberry crumble bar and a piece of apple cherry pie. The bar, which is made in-house, crumbled nicely and wasn't overly sweet. The blueberries were fresh, and the texture was excellent.The pie was even better, though I wish I knew which bakery it came from. The crust was flaky but sturdy all the way through, from the bottom of the crust out to the edges. There was an ample amount of fruit, and the pie topping reminded me of a great brown sugar crumble. I think a piece of pie runs $4.50... it's definitely worth it.A coffee house like this deserves to be well trafficked. There's many nooks and crannies for people to sit, and it's nice and quiet on the inside. I wish I had one of these closer to home!

4.description: Damn. The stereotype about Japanese "salarymen" working late into the Tokyo night must be true, if the Kyoto-style, cold-brew iced coffee having a groovin' house party on my tongue right now is any indication. This stuff is good and strong, good AND strong--all three combinations.I don't know what's with the folks in Kyoto, though. I once travelled there, and it was a mellow city with a rich history and a relatively slow pace of life, at least compared to the major cities of Japan. Maybe they are like the drug dealers that source & sell the stuff, but have a rule not to use the stuff. They just ship it to shaking addicts in Tokyo and beyond.I'm not up this way too often, but Metropolis has been on my 5-star cafe list since the first time I set tongue on it, about the time that it opened. The coffee is good, and I especially appreciate the ambience: the big couches and small and group tables; the multiple rooms, both quiet and with music; and the diversity of people here: a many-bean salad of ethnicities and earnings, students and salary-(wo)men, the young and the still-youthful, paper- and pixel-lovers, the engrossed and en-gossiped, those alone and accompanied... Stop me if I'm boring and belaboring you. The counter staff has always been friendly to me, and they've always had a sense of humor in this oh-so-serious world of coffee, where they clearly know beans about beans. When I've seen Jeff, the owner, he's regaled me with stories of his trips to Brazil and the large stacks of sacks of coffee we were standing by, and about the virtues of making espresso with a not-so-dark roasted bean. While I wish they were closer to my abode, I'm glad that they're not, because this place is one-of-a-kind.

6.description: Best coffee I ever had. Period. Also great environment to chill alone or with a friend or date. Really close to Loyola University so there's a lot of that vibe too. They literally have every contraption known to man for making coffee and they'll make it as you wish. So cool.

22.description: I've never been in a Metropolis coffee before, and I'm more than pleasantly surprised! I'm not from this area, but I feel at home here. The staff is friendly, the soy almond latte I got is excellent and they have sooo many flavours. The internet process is easy to work. But, best of all, I asked for a quiche and the staff called me over to say, "The quiche pieces are really small." I thought they were just fessing up about it (I worked in a coffee shop where the quiche was often tiny and I felt really bad), but they gave me two pieces! I'm considering making the commute from Sheridan just to come here again and try their other coffees. (Also, fun fact, they have my exact same address number. It's fate.)

15.description: I recommend this place for people who want to get some serious work done!First of all, there are enough outlets for your laptops, tablets, and cellular devices.  Although chances are that you may be sitting with some working strangers diagonally across you at a large table, you will still have your own privacy.  Clientele is consisted of college students (Loyola), working professionals, and career yelpers like myself.  The entire place is comfortable to sit for a considerable amount of time.  Toward the back of the coffee shop, there is a couple of cozy sofas with a small coffee table just in case you want to snuggle.  Well, it's a coffee shop.  I know the coffee has to be good, correct?  I had the 12 oz. chai and green tea latte.  Even though the chai wasn't the best I've had (Bridgeport Coffee Company is more superior in the chai category), I couldn't really complain because it was still quite good.  I'm fond of the green tea latte though.  I liked it that it was savory, but not at all cloying.  The prices of the coffee are pretty reasonable.  You can get a cup of regular for a little over $2.  Mr. SB and Miss DD: retreat your footprints in Chicago; your coffee is subpar.  They didn't require the password for the free wifi, and I was able to log on it after registering with an e-mail address.  They do have some profound, philosophical books for you to peruse, but I will pass because I've had my life figured out.  It's located two (2)-minute walking distance to the CTA Granville Red line station.  The surroundings seem to be safe because the Loyola dormitories are in proximity.  I saw the Chicago Police and the Campus Patrol Unit constantly going around to watch suspicious activities.

57.description: This is just the type of quirky coffee house that every college town/area should have. A great mix of hipsters, old-school hippies (that's me) and a gaggle of chic little gay boys and feminists ---- coffee is better than most and the outlets are great for finishing that project at work, or school.

20.description: Great spot! Fantastic and unique coffee. I'm a black drip drinker and I will go out of way for this joe. The place is always busy, always a line so prepare for a wait of up to 10 mins at times. Reminds me of living in Los angeles, hipster java at its finest. Pleasent, competent staff that clearly have a passion for coffee. (And ironic tshirts) I visit 3 to 5 times a week. Try the chemex brew, always worth it .Say what's up to Packer when you visit. Nice guy.

36.description: I came here to use my groupon deal - two coffees and two breakfast sandwiches for $15. Which turns out to be a terrible deal. There was ONE sandwich available - a egg muffin something something and my barista was definitely high. Bahahha

14.description: A perfect balance between being rundown/shitty and cool. Whoever put this place together was clever - minimal art on the walls (much of which is by local artists and for sale), a large space to utilize, and some pretty good coffee. I enjoy coming here for these reasons.  Understandably, every time I come here it's pretty packed.  The crowd seems to be mostly students and friends hanging out. Be prepared to get overwhelmed by the amount of hipsters that are within a 20 foot radius of where you're sitting.  Whatever, though, they don't bother me.As far as drinks go, I have tried their iced chai, regular coffee, and Italian soda.  All were good.  They don't carry almond milk, sadly, but they do offer hemp milk for those who don't do dairy or soy.  Parking is plentiful.  Out front is regular paid parking.  Further down the street, in the residential areas, there's free parking (just a short walk away), and the company provides a small lot next door for customers (but good luck finding parking there).  I am a big fan of coffee shops and the environment they provide when I'm studying for school.  At the moment, I'm taking a break from a 20 page paper that's due in...oh...two weeks (only 16 more pages to go!).  Places like Metropolis provide just the right amount of human contact for people like me who don't like working in total silence.I'll definitely be coming here for a long time to come.

3.description: Ordered delivery here to try something new. Food: Greasy, bland, and disgusting.Fish: Not fresh. Owner: Rude.No.

1.description: Delicious jibaritos!!! And their arroz con gandules is like no other! AMAZING.#rightbymyhouse

2.description: Recently came here after hearing that there was a local Puerto Rican spot in the neighborhood. Was impressed with the Pinchos and Alcapurria. Will be visiting again will update review.

5.description: Definately willing to come back and give this spot another try in another couple of months once they are in their groove. (From what Ive been told they are newly opened)  The food was good, the prices were decent, they had a varied menu with good selection and when the food came the  portions looked small but were very very filling.
