On the downside,  on a Friday night more than one waitress is needed for the whole floor .  I will say this -the waitress was very friendly and apologized for the fact that 1) the kitchen ran out of the traditional puerto rican rice that normally is served with the dinner and we had to settle for white rice  2)alcupurrias (offered as appetizers)  were cooking and would be at least 20 mins and 3) our meals had taken so long to get to our table .. With only one waitress, it was no wonder we had to wait til the meals were up before she remembered that she had asked if we wanted our drinks when we ordered and that we had said yes .. and that she didnt have a chance to really check on us after we started to eat.  The complimentary chips and salsa because of the wait and the substitutions were nice ..and the edge was taken off of both the wait and the subs because the waitress WAS so genuinely friendly. All in all id say give the place a try and hope the kitchen is in full swing and that u get the same waitress we did

0.description: Our experience here was a bit... weird.  My husband and I just moved in to Hermosa and we were walking along Armitage looking for a new place near our house to try for dinner.  This place was open and, based on the menu posted in the window, looked to offer some traditional Mexican and Puerto Rican dishes so we went in.The place was totally empty except the two women behind the bar.  Neither really spoke English and we don't really speak Spanish.  Needless to say, some weird iterations of the word "comer" on my part indicated to the one server that we wanted to eat dinner.  According to their hours they close at 8 p.m. (even on Saturdays) and we arrived at around 7:30 so we didn't know if we'd even be able to eat.  Both women seemed a bit confused about the fact that we entered and one asked the cook something (perhaps if he/she was still making food) but she sat us anyway.Menu was plentiful and the beer list was decent (Mexican and American bottles) and well-priced.  The chips and salsa came out in a basket with the salsa in a bottle so you had to squeeze a bit on to each chip.  Weird, but delicious all the same.  The food we ordered came out pretty quickly and was piping hot. Standard Mexican fare, for sure, but well done and nicely priced.  My only complaint is was the lack of salt and flavor in the food.  It was like the rice and beans were so bland they were almost tasteless and I found myself putting a ton of hot sauce on my tostadas because they were so plain.  When we asked for the check, we realized we were just short the amount of cash we'd need to cover the bill so we asked if they took credit cards.  Our waitress flat out said no.  Then we asked where the nearest ATM was, she conferred with the other lady behind the bar, and then changed her story and said she could, in fact, take our credit card.  Again, weird.  They ran the card and that's how we paid but why say you don't take them?  Or how do you not know if you take them?All in all, an OK experience.  The atmosphere was definitely a bit bizarre since we were the only customers and they closed so early, but the food was good and we'll go back since it's so close and so cheap.  An odd note: last Saturday they were clearly open and catering to several groups of people after 8 p.m., so I'm not sure what the deal is with their hours...

4.description: Bad customer service. Here's the thing... I love this place when they offer everything on the menu, but they cook things based on whether the cook feels like it or not. My favorite happens to be piononos, a Puerto Rican item that is not available at many restaurants, Puerto Rican or not. El Vigia has them on their menu. I have ordered them three times on different occassions. The first time, they made them and they were perfect! The second time, they said (20 minutes before close time, 7:40pm) that there was not enough time to make them. Third time, which was today, they said that they don't have any. I asked if they were taken off the menu and they said "She doesn't want to make them." Horrible service!

1.description: Great place!  If you're ever in a pinch, I can attest to the fact that my luggage did not break during travel, and that the owner was very pleasant.

9.description: This place is fantastic. I went here and immediately thought of a crazy souk in the Middle East with stuff piled everywhere. Then, I heard the friendly owner speaking Arabic with a colleague in the store, and my reverie was complete. Now I know how to handle this place . . . haggle like a camel trader!A collection of random stuff and a LOT of luggage. He also has some hilarious bright, cheap blankets that would be great for . . . dog blankets, if they weren't so ugly. Men's shirts, women's clothes. Tube socks. Shopping bags.But, the luggage. Wow. Incredible variety from supercheap construction to some great stuff at good deals. Every color you want or can think of. We got several pieces that made me dream of all the trips we'd take them on . . . and their eventual collapse from happy overuse. 'Cos really, the way airlines manhandle bags, they never last, so why pay a lot for them? Plus, no one steals beat up luggage. Worth a trip. To the store, and anywhere.

23.description: Simply amazing deals for luggage!  I just got a Samsonite full sized luggage for $35 (originally marked $275!!!)Any luggage you need for traveling is here.  Duffel bags go from $5 - 15, carry-ons from $15 - 35, and full sized $25 - 45.  Pretty much every size or style you will want is here.Yes, everything here is "Like New", not perfect but not used by any means.  Most luggage still has the original stickers on it from department stores.  Just make sure you check the zippers and insides before you buy.The owner was very nice but explained to me that his credit card machine just broke and no one was out to fix it yet, so I had to run to the  ATM to pull some cash out, but he didn't charge me tax for the inconvenience.

5.description: So much to choose from and many different styles. And super affordable without breaking the bank. The owner was super sweet and I would definitely recommend and come back.

25.description: Magna, the owner, is very nice.  That is good because this really is like a warehouse.  You should just ask for what you want, as it's too packed to the gills to really browse.  I needed a garment bag, and he had quite a few at half the price of Target or Walmart, and a better selection of styles.  I never thought I was a big fashionista regarding luggage, but I had been paying way too much for the current styles or something.  I think my bag looks as good or better than anything I would have gotten elsewhere, and at a good price.  Magna speaks English and Spanish.  His credit card machine was hinky when I was there, so it might be good to have some cash in case.  Though the parking meters out front don't seem to ever break down.

12.description: This is a great place to find cheap luggage. There is a wide selection laid out all over the store. It's not all particularly well sorted so a little bit of searching is required, but I managed to find myself a bargain (a large and very robust case for $30). I understand from the other reviews that the store doesn't offer refunds; however you are perfectly free to check that the luggage is fully functional prior to purchase without any pressure being put on you whatsoever. This makes sense because some items do have issues (e.g. I looked at one case where the zip was jammed) but hey, you're getting a bargain so you've got to expect some effort!This store might not be for you if you need beautiful presentation of the products or the thought of not being able to return your purchase scares you. But if you're the type of person who is willing to put in a bit of effort to find a bargain and doesn't judge the product by the surroundings that it is sold in, then this is for you. To me it actually felt wonderfully old fashioned and no nonsense. Oh, and all I can say about the area is that anyone who finds it sketchy has probably lived a very sheltered life! It's a nice and safe enough area, just not very affluent.

21.description: This neighborhood is a shady ass place. Even the luggage warehouse looks a little scary. The metal bars on all the windows doesn't exactly evoke a homey place of comfort. But regardless of all the exteriors, I rate this place 5 freakin' stars!The luggage prices does not get better than this! I've search on ebags, target, walmart and the prices they quoted was pretty astronomical ($50-up) Here are Luggage Warehouse, I found similar luggage carriers for $18-35 the most. Literally, 1/3 of the price that you would find in department stores.  When you initially first walk into the store, you feel overwhelmed by all the luggage and blankets (+ coldness, because there's no heat) but sorting through the luggage, there are some great finds. There's Samsonite, Dockers, Chaps and some other brands I've never heard of. Also, majority of luggage were soft covers and not hard ones. I do agree with Samantha M, to indeed check all the zippers because I found a luggage I really like for $25 but the zipper was stuck. In the end of my excursion, I found a nice dark beige 21' inch Dockers luggage for $30 (really satisfied). Note: I found it quite funny and weirded out at the same time when after I paid, the owner wielded a sharp long knife to cut the tags off the luggage. Um, next time scissors would be nice to not frighten the customers!  I almost prepared myself with a karate chop stance to protect myself!

16.description: Magna, the owner, is very nice.  That is good because this really is like a warehouse.  You should just ask for what you want, as it's too packed to the gills to really browse.  I needed a garment bag, and he had quite a few at half the price of Target or Walmart, and a better selection of styles.  I never thought I was a big fashionista regarding luggage, but I had been paying way too much for the current styles or something.  I think my bag looks as good or better than anything I would have gotten elsewhere, and at a good price.  Magna speaks English and Spanish.  His credit card machine was hinky when I was there, so it might be good to have some cash in case.  Though the parking meters out front don't seem to ever break down.

17.description: Simply amazing deals for luggage!  I just got a Samsonite full sized luggage for $35 (originally marked $275!!!)Any luggage you need for traveling is here.  Duffel bags go from $5 - 15, carry-ons from $15 - 35, and full sized $25 - 45.  Pretty much every size or style you will want is here.Yes, everything here is "Like New", not perfect but not used by any means.  Most luggage still has the original stickers on it from department stores.  Just make sure you check the zippers and insides before you buy.The owner was very nice but explained to me that his credit card machine just broke and no one was out to fix it yet, so I had to run to the  ATM to pull some cash out, but he didn't charge me tax for the inconvenience.

10.description: Dina its called a warehouse for a reason. If you want aesthetics find a luggage boutique and pay 4xs the price. Two stars? Really?!? This place is great. Simply can't beat it! Like-new luggage at less than half the price. The woman working was sweet and helpful and the selection and prices are really great! Sure, you've got to check the zippers and handles but what's 5 extra minutes when you're getting more than half off ?

11.description: I just bought a 21 inch samsonite for $35.  The neighborhood is Logan Square but it's not as bad as people say..it's Chicago ppl! Anyway, the attendant was really nice and helpful.  As the others say it's only cash, no return, no exchange.  The products are not perfect, some may have a little stain, or dirt, but just make sure the zippers work, the wheels are not broken, there are no rips and that your handle actually works.  Overall I was very satisfied with my buy :)Oh, tips from someone who travel a lot, make sure you buy a lightweight luggage bag :)

26.description: Buy your luggage here.I just bought a Skyway suitcase for $29. I have no idea if it is a fake, but I doubt it. A lot of the luggage in this store still had a Kohl's tag on it. I know for sure I saw a piece for $35 that retails for $159 at Kohl's. Maybe it is scratch and dent. Skip Marshalls, TJ Maxx, and everywhere else if you want a luggage for  a good price.The phone number is not correct.I did a little more research on my bag and it's a 2007 Kohl's version.

27.description: School is starting and then there's that Christmas trip with all those gifts to carry...For a wide selection of low-priced bags from purses and back-packs, to some of the biggest pieces of soft-sided luggage I've ever seen, the Luggage Warehouse is the place to shop!  In addition, there are other retail items such as blankets and T-shirts at wholesale prices.When I travel I prefer to use the cheap luggage, hope to get a couple of trips out of it and then toss it...so I shop at the Luggage Warehouse!

0.description: How this place doesn't have a line waiting for the doors to open blows my mind!  The luggage here is so bloody cheap it is ridiculous...and by cheap, I mean, it's inexpensive!  They have several brands, top to bottom, and you will easily save 75-80% what you would anywhere else. To top things off, they have these huge cozy blankets, total hipster clothing that is just silly cheap.  There are so many finds in this place, I can hardly believe it.  The owner of the company is very nice, knowledgeable, and speaks multiple languages.  Swing in, buy a bag for the cost of just a few gallons of gas and coffee....and talk to the owner for a bit.  You will love this place and all your friends will love you when you send them there as well.  Yes it is a little dark and dank inside, but if you can get past the smallest thing, you'll have a place you can count on.

20.description: Bring Cash. They don't take credit. We decided to check this place on on Monday after reading the reviews. It was easy to find and there was plenty of metered street parking in front. Walking in I was overwhelmed by the sheer number of suitcases. Hundreds and hundreds. Floor to ceiling, all over the sales floor and shelves and shelves in the back. There is no method to the madness. The hubby and I narrowed it down to 5 Samsonite styles. We tested all zippers (working) handles (attached) stains (none) wheels (excellent working condition). There were other suitcases that had some obvious issues, but if you are willing to search you can come up with some real gems. We purchased a black Samsonite Drive that was priced at a large department store for $419.99 for $75.00! It has: four dual spinner wheels for upright rolling, removable toiletry kit, laundry bag, two shoe bags and a removable tri-compartment divider. Also included was the combination lock that can be accessed by TSA & 10 year warranty information. There are no returns and no exchanges so make sure you know what your buying before you leave.

19.description: Bring Cash. They don't take credit. We decided to check this place on on Monday after reading the reviews. It was easy to find and there was plenty of metered street parking in front. Walking in I was overwhelmed by the sheer number of suitcases. Hundreds and hundreds. Floor to ceiling, all over the sales floor and shelves and shelves in the back. There is no method to the madness. The hubby and I narrowed it down to 5 Samsonite styles. We tested all zippers (working) handles (attached) stains (none) wheels (excellent working condition). There were other suitcases that had some obvious issues, but if you are willing to search you can come up with some real gems. We purchased a black Samsonite Drive that was priced at a large department store for $419.99 for $75.00! It has: four dual spinner wheels for upright rolling, removable toiletry kit, laundry bag, two shoe bags and a removable tri-compartment divider. Also included was the combination lock that can be accessed by TSA & 10 year warranty information. There are no returns and no exchanges so make sure you know what your buying before you leave.

2.description: Nice mom and pop store. Came here to buy a carry on and duffle bag. Bought that and saved a good amount of money. Was surprised to find clothing here as well. Girlfriend bought some clothes and I had to wait for her to pick what she wanted, but she was happy too.

18.description: This place is absolutely amazing, even though the area is a little scary if you are not familiar with it. I got off the blue line at Logan Square and walked in the opposite direction before someone pointed me in the right direction. The bars on the front of the store are a bit alarming at first, but as soon as you get inside you feel extremely  safe. The luggage are top notch! I bought myself a Chaps luggage originally priced at $199.00 for a mere $25 dollars! It is amazing quality and while looking around I saw so many nice luggages! I couldn't believe it at all. Thank you so much for giving me a amazing luggage at a good price!

13.description: As others have mentioned, there's lots of stuff, but I found it fairly easy to find my way around. Perhaps there are times when there's more stuff in stock, but the floor was pretty well covered with merchandise. I looked around for about 30 minutes, and after finding a couple pieces with zippers missing a pull tab and one with a telescoping handle that kept sticking, I found a Samsonite piece for $45. My friend also picked up a similar Samsonite suitcase for the same price, originally priced at $199.I definitely would shop here again and love the feeling of a good deal, so definitely check this place out if you're looking for something inexpensive yet quality!

4.description: I recently went there because someone referred me.  When I walked in, it was very cold inside, and the store employee had a coat on while she was working.  Most brands are generally offered at Macy''s or Kohls...no top brands...some j.lo, ricardo, but lots of samsonite and other mid-level brands.Medium bag 40...large 60-80...Yes, they are marked down considerably from $200-$300 BUT that comes with the an extra price:  some may be broken slightly, have scratches, rips, scuffs, etc.  and I hate to say things like this because it sounds stuck-up but the place had a mildew/moldy odor to it.  Not a pleasurable experience- but it you are willing to literally pay for anything.  This place is for you.  Better go to Marshals and pay a little more for luggage that's closer to new than the damaged goods offered at Luggage Warehouse on Milwaukee.

24.description: This place is fantastic. I went here and immediately thought of a crazy souk in the Middle East with stuff piled everywhere. Then, I heard the friendly owner speaking Arabic with a colleague in the store, and my reverie was complete. Now I know how to handle this place . . . haggle like a camel trader!A collection of random stuff and a LOT of luggage. He also has some hilarious bright, cheap blankets that would be great for . . . dog blankets, if they weren't so ugly. Men's shirts, women's clothes. Tube socks. Shopping bags.But, the luggage. Wow. Incredible variety from supercheap construction to some great stuff at good deals. Every color you want or can think of. We got several pieces that made me dream of all the trips we'd take them on . . . and their eventual collapse from happy overuse. 'Cos really, the way airlines manhandle bags, they never last, so why pay a lot for them? Plus, no one steals beat up luggage. Worth a trip. To the store, and anywhere.

6.description: Some seriously nice luggage for super cheap. I saved around $100 shopping here. I don't mind the grit of the places around this area so really, no complaints there.

22.description: This warehouse is located at a soso neighborhood.   Yes, the inside looks just like a warehouse, with some luggages appeared used and some even with customs tags or flight stickers.  Some even have spiderweb on it.  But don't let this fool you, this place has some of the best deals you would ever find on luggages.  I was so impressed I wrote this review.  I bought a samsonite carry-on with tags on for 25$.   Although an older model, I mean how fancy did luggage technology got in the past twenty years anyway.  Highly recommended.  Great if you are looking for a steal.

15.description: This neighborhood is a shady ass place. Even the luggage warehouse looks a little scary. The metal bars on all the windows doesn't exactly evoke a homey place of comfort. But regardless of all the exteriors, I rate this place 5 freakin' stars!The luggage prices does not get better than this! I've search on ebags, target, walmart and the prices they quoted was pretty astronomical ($50-up) Here are Luggage Warehouse, I found similar luggage carriers for $18-35 the most. Literally, 1/3 of the price that you would find in department stores.  When you initially first walk into the store, you feel overwhelmed by all the luggage and blankets (+ coldness, because there's no heat) but sorting through the luggage, there are some great finds. There's Samsonite, Dockers, Chaps and some other brands I've never heard of. Also, majority of luggage were soft covers and not hard ones. I do agree with Samantha M, to indeed check all the zippers because I found a luggage I really like for $25 but the zipper was stuck. In the end of my excursion, I found a nice dark beige 21' inch Dockers luggage for $30 (really satisfied). Note: I found it quite funny and weirded out at the same time when after I paid, the owner wielded a sharp long knife to cut the tags off the luggage. Um, next time scissors would be nice to not frighten the customers!  I almost prepared myself with a karate chop stance to protect myself!

7.description: My visit to the Luggage Warehouse was awesome. The guy over there was soooooooo nice and I got a very very good deal on the Luggage bag that we bought. I just loved the experience and at the end the man over there gave us a small bag on the house. That was so sweet. Keep up the good work. I would definitely recommend everyone to go get their bags from them.

8.description: In response to Dina's review..... She is simply not being honest.  There are SEVERAL name brands in this store, I've bought three pieces of luggage here... ALL have been Samsonite.  As far as her complaint about the temperature, it is cool in there in the winter.  BIG DEAL!!!  This isn't Macy's or Nordstrom's!  When you can get luggage for a true fraction of the cost of retail, are you really going to complain????So, if you go here... don't have silly expectations.  Here is what to expect:1.  It's chilly.  You won't freeze, but it's cool.2.  They want a cash transaction.3.  It's NOT a fancy showroom.4.  Most of the items have some sort of blemish or even defect.  This could be a stuck zipper, a smudge of dirty, a dent or even a small tear. 5.  Knowing point four, you do need to search some to find what you want.  BUT, you can find it.  6.  You'll save a lot of money.  7.  I bought two pieces of luggage for an oversea's trip, and probably saved $200 - $300!!

3.description: Now, I know this is a luggage store, but I don't come here for the luggage, since I don't really travel much. I come here for the amazing selection of vintage clothing. My roommate came here awhile back for luggage and told me about all the vintage clothing. I stopped in and was amazed by all the selection available. I bought a white leather jacket, denim skirt and member's only jacket. This stuff is so cheap, and changes throughout the month. I love it here. The lady who works here is really nice and helpful. They accept cash and credit. Overall, my fav new place for vintage clothing.

14.description: I went in to find a deal on a carry on suitcase and wound up walking out with one of the models I was looking at online but for half the price.I got a Ricardo spinner with a built in suit compartment.  They have a bunch of no name Chinese luggage for cheap, but the real value here are the department store rejects.  Be careful, though, many of these are broken in some way: broken zippers, broken handle, stains so be sure to thoroughly check whatever you plan to buy.  Some brands that they have: Delsey, Samsonite, Ricardo.The owner is very nice, although it was inexplicably twenty degrees colder in the store than it was outside.Great place!

29.description: Thanks guys! I live right next to a furniture store, opted not to go because of it's reviews. Instead after reading rave reviews I decided to try this place out, it took me a total of 2 hours to pick a bed out, pay, and have my bed delivered!! I am so impressed with them, if I need anymore furniture I WILL go there first!

42.description: On NYE I decided that I needed to purchase a couch so I went down Milwaukee with a friend and we hit up a couple furniture stores. The minute I walked into Lubinski I met Ken who is the owner. He was very helpful and not pushy which I liked. I ended up finding a couch that I liked and I said to my friend that if I can get the couch delivered to me today I would purchase it. Ken informed me that he couldn't get it to me until a couple of days later. I was sad and ready to walk out of the store until Ken called me from across the room and told me that he just spoke with his delivery guys and he could have it to me in two hours. SOLD! The couch, delivery, and setup fee was so reasonable I definitely plan on going back to get a few more pieces to go with my couch. Highly reccomend this store!

23.description: I walked up and down this so-called "furniture row" of Wicker Park in search of a sectional sofa. This place had the best deals. The sales associate was a little too much for me, but that's to be expected. With a cash discount, I got a beautiful leather sectional for less than $1,000 delivered (I think it was $800, but I can't remember). It is soooooooooo incredibly comfortable. The reason I'm only giving Lubinski's three stars is because of the delivery. It seemed like a delivery after normal work hours was out of the question, and even doing 4 pm was a hassle for them. The day of the delivery, they called me to say that 4 pm was too late for them and they could do 3 at the very latest. They said that they needed to do it at 3 because they had "a delivery out by O'Hare and wanted to beat rush hour." Er, I don't remember giving a crap about their schedule-- they should have honored the agreed-upon time. I told the sales guy on the phone that I would try to do 3, but expected the couch to still be delivered at 4 if that wasn't possible. His response was: "Uhhhhhhh." Fortunately, I was able to get my friend to my apartment by 3 and the couch was delivered quickly and easily. He said the delivery men were really nice, too.

8.description: One of the owner, Ken is amazing. Very nice. Awesome service. I bought a couch and a love seat here. Everything went great. Just bought a new dining set from them this past week.

31.description: Awesome service awesome bed awesome sleep

34.description: Ken was awesome! he got me everything i wanted and was very helpful. This is my new favorite place to get great furniture

16.description: I walked up and down this so-called "furniture row" of Wicker Park in search of a sectional sofa. This place had the best deals. The sales associate was a little too much for me, but that's to be expected. With a cash discount, I got a beautiful leather sectional for less than $1,000 delivered (I think it was $800, but I can't remember). It is soooooooooo incredibly comfortable. The reason I'm only giving Lubinski's three stars is because of the delivery. It seemed like a delivery after normal work hours was out of the question, and even doing 4 pm was a hassle for them. The day of the delivery, they called me to say that 4 pm was too late for them and they could do 3 at the very latest. They said that they needed to do it at 3 because they had "a delivery out by O'Hare and wanted to beat rush hour." Er, I don't remember giving a crap about their schedule-- they should have honored the agreed-upon time. I told the sales guy on the phone that I would try to do 3, but expected the couch to still be delivered at 4 if that wasn't possible. His response was: "Uhhhhhhh." Fortunately, I was able to get my friend to my apartment by 3 and the couch was delivered quickly and easily. He said the delivery men were really nice, too.

13.description: I was so happy with Lubinski Movers and the work they did.  I will never move without movers again.I know how much of a hassle it is to find good, reliable movers and I have to say, Lubinski is the best I've seen in the city.  I have a HORRIBLE time with Two Men and a Truck and was very grateful to have a friend recommend Lubinski Movers to me.Also, very reasonably priced.

11.description: We used Lubinski Movers yesterday and they did a fantastic job. They showed up early, had all of our stuff out in about an hour, and figured out how to get everything up to our small third story apartment which was not an easy task! The quote was spot on which was very nice and it was very reasonably priced. Our movers were very courteous and professional as well. Would definitely use again!

39.description: I went in an ordered a dresser and paid $20 extra for next day delivery. I missed the first time they tried to deliver, my bad. The second time they came to deliver, they dropped the dresser down the stairs. Okay sure, accidents happen. Then I was notified that was the last dresser of that particular style they had in stock, so they'd have to reorder it. Ken there kept telling me different dates that they'd receive it. One month later, I received my dresser. No refund on the $20 for same day delivery, but he promised me to send an extra special free gift for my wait. I did not receive any free gift at all. I didn't get to spend a lot of time in the store because I found out what I wanted right away. It's a big store though, so you should check it out while furniture shopping on Milwaukee. Ken there is the main salesman (I think). He's a nice guy with a good sense of humor. The prices are CHEAP! My dresser was only $240 (including tax and the fee for the next day shipping).

37.description: Ask if you don't see it in the window, they may be able to get it for you.We had been looking for a coat rack for many months. A basic, standing, coat rack/hall tree....no bench or anything. One would think that would be easy to find but its not. Luckily, I noticed one in the window of Lubinski Furniture.However, we didn't like that particular coat rack, so Ken pulled out a catalog with PAGES full of coat racks and told us he could have any one of them by Thursday (which was just a few days away). He was informative and warned us which coat racks may break. We decided on a $40 model. They offered to assemble the rack for free.Thursday came and we received a call that the coat rack we had chosen was out of stock. The gentleman on the phone asked if we would like to come in and select another. We dropped by that weekend, chose another one, which was supposed to arrive in a few days. We were told they would call. They didn't call, and when we called approximately one week after we chose our second coat rack, they said to come in and pick it up.Get this...waiting for us, assembled, was the $80 coat rack we had admired but decided we didn't need to spend that much. I don't know which staff member was paying attention to our conversation, or why they gave us such a discount...it wasn't like the week delay in delivery was so irritating or anything...they just said "consider it a holiday gift". I wouldn't expect all customers to be so lucky, but I can tell you all three people I spoke with here were very helpful and, obviously, generous. They refused to let us pay the difference so I guess the best I can do in return is forward this to everyone on my friend list. Remember, if they don't have it in the store, they may be able to get it for you.There is parking in the alley behind!

0.description: I didn't wanna go to IKEA and pay for deliver fee. I've been browsing around this area to fine a good furniture store, and i've found one.Got a bed from here. Jimmy was a great, very polite guy and know how to service his customers without being pushy. Kudo!Can't complain anything. Great experience. I'll come back and recommend my friends to come here.

38.description: After receiving a generous wedding gift from some family members, we decided to buy a bedroom set. We walked up and down Milwaukee Ave, and went a about 5 stores and Lubinski's was by far the best selection and the friendliest staff. Ken is very non-pressuring but still attentive. If you have a question or want more information he is there but he doesn't follow  you around like they do in some stores. We ended up purchasing a set that they didn't have in stock - based on the picture we saw in a catalog he had. I am usually a very timid buyer and was hesitant about buying something I hadn't seen in person, but my fiancee loved the set and Ken gave us a very reasonable deal - around $1,000 for a 6-piece set! And that includes the tax, delivery and assembly. Delivery + assembly is only $35 for Chicago! We had planned to have the furniture delivered today at 10am. At 10:20, I called Ken and found out that the first item on their delivery truck was causing some problems and they would be delayed. Around 11:30 I started to get nervous because we had scheduled the elevator from 9-12 and I didn't know if we had the elevator past that time. At 12:30, they finally showed up and apologized for running late. They quickly unloaded the furniture and assembled it with no further problems. In general, they were friendly to work with fairly accommodating. I just wish that if they knew they were going to be late, they would have called me, rather then making me call them repeatedly. I guess they can't really control other people/deliveries, but it's nice to keep your customers in the loop. If they had called and/or had been on time for delivery, I probably would have given them 5 stars...

27.description: Listen!  If you need furniture or movers, call Lubinski and go see Ken!  He is the best and really fair.  He made us feel like family and I refuse to go anywhere else now.  When I go to that store I look forward to dealing with Ken because he's honest, funny, and really helpful.  I can't say enough about his moving crews too.  They have moved us in/out of two homes and have delivered new furniture to us too.  Never a mark on the walls or a scratch on our furniture, and man are they fast!  I wish more business that I dealt with took a page from the Lubinski book, I would have a lot less headaches.

32.description: Bought a couch and two months later the arm was coming loose. Called and asked if it could be repaired. The owner sent two guys out the next day and quickly and quietly fixed it for free. I love the couch and the service...well done!!!!!

44.description: The furniture is cheap and the place is very easy to find.

24.description: This place was ok enough. We went in looking for 2 dressers+mirrors and a couch, at the time they had a 30% off sale and were offering free delivery.  Found the 2 dressers we liked but couldn't agree on a couch.  We wanted stuff that was in-stock since we had been dresser & couch-less for several months then and were not willing to wait any more. The total was a little under 800 for 2 dressers which I felt was decent, but not all that cheap (that was after 30% off and free delivery).  We really like our dressers, and their delivery guy showed up within the 1.5 hour time frame they said they'd be here, so we were pretty happy with our purchase at Lubinski.

7.description: My roommate and I bought our first couch here. We just happened to be walking by one day and stopped in. Jose helped us stick in our budget and made sure we were getting a quality item. He threw in a beautiful print for $10. On the day of delivery the truck was involved in a fender bender. Jose called to tell me our print had broken in the accident but our couch would be on time. He refunded me the $10 and gave us a different print for free. HIGHLY recommend this place if you're looking for furniture and appreciate a helpful salesman.

40.description: Just bought a bed here over the weekend.  One man shop, or at least it was on Saturday morning.  Very nice guy.  Asked me if I needed help, told him I was just looking, and he let me be until I approached him again.

30.description: I just came from Lubinski's. My parents and I had been searching for a new bed and were daunted by options at places like Crate and Barrel, West Elm and Arhaus Furniture. As soon as we walked into Lubinski's and met Ken (yes, Ken Lubinski), we knew we were in good hands. We got our entire bed set- frame, headboard, box spring, mattress AND a nightstand- for under $900... and they'll deliver and set up for free. Pretty impressive. This was a great find.

1.description: I have hired Lubinski Movers to move me more than once... and I recommend them to everyone I know who's moving. I have no clue how these other folks could have had a bad experience. Really!  I have even had them pack my whole house It was so much less expensive than I guessed. I'll never pack by myself again..  Jimmy took more care with my crystal than I would have. They moved a TON of stuff and absolutely nothing was broken.  They wrap everything like crazy. Really great. They even moved a grand piano for me TWICE.  That takes expertise and they have it.  Ken is a great guy who will give you an honest, and fair price.  They guys are really pros. Strong and steady. They could fit a king mattress through a keyhole.  And they never run out of energy.  The same guys have worked there for years and years and are still strong and healthy.  These guys are wonderful!THE BEST MOVERS IN TOWN!

9.description: The owner of this place Ken is awesome...really knows how to treat a customer and knows how to make a deal. Great selection of furniture!He will get my business going forward!

26.description: I have shopped at Lubinski for years and purchased something on 5 different occasions.  They are my go-to guys.  I've gotten an entertainment center, beautiful pub table, mattress/box spring, and media console, as well as used their delightful movers once.  Ken is so friendly and not a high pressure, skeezy salesman like some of the other furniture shops down Milwaukee.  They have a large showroom, but you are not limited to the items at the store.  They have a ton of catalogs that you can spend a ton of time looking through, or better yet you can do your shopping online before going to the store by going to their website.  I did this for my most recent purchase and it was so easy!  Didn't even go into the store and set everything up over the phone.  Only problem with this method is that the 3 links on their website to their furniture distributors do not list prices, so you have to write down your favorites, then call back and get a price quote from an employee at Lubinski.  They are reasonable with their pricing compared to other stores I shopped at, and they can deliver within 2 days.  Their movers are so careful, quick, and nice!  Overall wonderful experiences with this company.  No wonder this place has been in business for so many years.

25.description: I placed and paid for my order on 8/30/2011, today is 10/6/2011 and I still have not received my correct furniture order.  First they delivered the wrong chairs, then they delivered the wrong dining room table.  As of today, I am still waiting for the right dining room table.  Every time I call to check up on my order, I am told it will delivered next week, then the next week.  They have not once called me to update the status of my order, I have to call them.  DO NOT SHOP HERE.  There are plenty of other furniture stores on Milwaukee to choose from.

12.description: I also forgot to mention that Ken sent us a handwritten note thanking us for shopping with Lubinski's! This was such a nice touch, and rounded out what was already an amazing customer service experience.

21.description: The owner of this place Ken is awesome...really knows how to treat a customer and knows how to make a deal. Great selection of furniture!He will get my business going forward!

17.description: So my experience started off smooth Ken is a great guy and helped me pick out a great recliner / loveseat and the scheduled me for a move at 2pm then that changed to 10:00am which is fine so they show up late at about 11:00am which Ken told me about that's fine so the movers arrive and things start off smooth I helped move as well after everything is packed all my belongings and they tell me they aren't going directly to my house there making a stop out south keep in mind with all my belongings in the back while the deliver a sofa to a diff. location what makes me mad is that ive been waiting 3hrs now with no eta and the Internet and cable guys calling me set up my eqpt which hasn't arrived at all here I wait at my new place no eta on my belongings no calls nothing, I'm pissed now.. update they arrived after the delay I got my things delivered so I'm giving the movers a update of 3 stars (fair)

10.description: Just used Lubinski movers for a move yesterday, and they did a great job.  I spoke to Ken to set up the appointment, and he gave me a quote that was almost dead on (I actually ended up paying a bit less).  On the day of my move, 3 guys came and moved me out of my 1.5 bedroom apartment in about 1 hour.  The move-in to my 3rd floor unit took a bit longer, but they worked extremely hard to get it all done within 3 hours (which is the minimum amount of time required).  John, one of the movers, was very nice and made me feel much less stressed about the move!The only 2 issues I had were they were ~20 min. late (I expected this from other reviews) and they forgot to put some screws back in my couch when re-assembling my furniture.  I think this was an innocent oversight, as I completely forgot myself. They probably would have gladly done it if I had remembered.

5.description: The movers from Lubinski were great. They were polite and easy to work with all the way through the process. All of of our stuff made the move without any damage, and when they noticed our landlord was nervous about them damaging the hallway and stairwell, they took extra care. That was appreciated by us and a relief for the landlord. I just wish we had more cold drinks to share, these guys earned it.

3.description: Terrible experience with the movers. The movers were slow and two of them were fighting with eachother.  They had lunch on our time and one of them had his wife come visit with him.  The worst part was the damage to our belongings.  They dropped and broke a shelf, nearly killed two of our houseplants by breaking several branches, and punctured and scraped our leather couch. They would literally drop (not place) boxes on the floor in front me that were clearly labeled fragile.We were mostly concerned with the damage to our couch, which Ken promised to reconcile by sending "his guy" to repair it.  I believed him because he sounded like an honest person and when he told me his guy would call me, I trusted him.  Every few weeks I would call and he would say that "his guy" has been busy but was still coming.  After months of calling him and he continued to tell me that "his guy" was coming, I finally gave up.  I'm sure I called at least 7 or 8 times. It has been 10 months since we moved, and we never heard another word.  I highly recommend that you DO NOT use this moving company.

35.description: It was the most painless experience of my life!I went in on a Friday after work, told Ken Lubinski my budget and the next day I had a bed frame, mattress and box spring delivered to my house with free delivery!They set it up and offered to take my old mattress away for me. I can not say anything bad or awful because it was all great.

19.description: Lubinski came through for me.  I recently went to the suburbs and bought a couch.  Upon delivery they couldn't get the couch into the elevator or stairwell...user error on my part.  Anyways I needed a new couch and I went into Lubinski Furniture, I worked with Jimmy and gave me exactly what I needed at a reasonable price.  They also had it delivered within a week.  I was very happy with the service, the goods, and process!  I should have went here in the first place.  I would absolutely recommend this place to friends and go back!

28.description: I can't say enough great things about the quality home furnishings, the affordability and amazing service that I received shopping at Lubinski's Furniture in Wicker Park. I've passed this place 20 times on my way to get my haircut at Art & Science, but always snubbed my nose since the exterior looks dumpy.  However, it was the great reviews by fellow Yelpers that convinced me to give Lubinski's a shot.  Yelpers were right!  This place is amazing for furniture shoppers that are operating on what I call "Champagne tastes with a Beer budget."  I'm in grad school for my MBA and still want a cute apartment, so this place was perfect!  I bought an Ashley love-seat sofa and matching coffee table.  Including tax and delivery (next day), I paid $400.  I politely negotiated the pricing (which other Yelper's recommended doing -- not taking furniture at listed price) and promised that I would share my positive experience with buying from their store. When I graduate in May, I will look first at Lubinski's for furniture deals ... since I'll be back living on Champagne tastes mitigated by student loans. :)

45.description: This building on Milwaukee Avenue has a furniture store on the ground floor, and a bunch of artist spaces during the Around the Coyote festival right after Labor Day.

33.description: I walked by Lubinski's after work one day shortly after being new to Wicker Park.  I had done lots of seaching online to find the cheapest yet highest quality kitchen chairs.  Even at Walmart and Overstock, I couldn't find what I was looking for. I walked in and worked with Jimmy. He had the chairs I was looking for for a more reasonable price and they were much nicer than everything I found online.  He delivered the chairs for free the next day.  I highly recommend this place!  I looked at their huge area rugs, and there are some that are attractive, high quality AND $129-and trust me they are way nicer than Target rugs.  They also have great bedroom furniture and can order pretty much anything. Another plus is that you don't have to put anything together- what a breath of fresh air!  I would start here and plan to use them for more pieces in the future.

43.description: I've been furniture shopping for friends, and came across this store on a late night out when it was obviously closed, and was attracted to some of the furniture I had seen in the window.  I stopped in during the day only to find that they were closed at 6pm on weekdays and 5pm on Saturdays.  I reminded myself to get out of work a little earlier to make it before closing.  The store looks at little scattered and doesn't have the showroom appeal that the chain stores like Wickes and Harlem furniture have, but maybe that's what they end up charging you extra for at those places.  I didn't happen to find a few things I liked here, and found the sales person, Jimmy, to be very friendly and helpful.  He also gave me a catalog to look at other items that weren't in the store.  He wasn't pushy at all, and gave me a great deal on the set if I wanted it.  They also have free delivery if you live nearby.  Unfortunately, it wasn't me that was the one buying the stuff and had to wait for my friend's input.  I really liked this brown leather couch in the catalog and would have loved to buy it, but you just have to sit on it before you can buy.  Pictures cant do justice to the way you'd feel sitting on the couch...

2.description: There is a lot of cheap and affordable furniture but I also think the furniture looked cheap. With anything I  guess, there's always a trade-off: Price versus style. The sofas were comfortable and I would have loved to sleep on one right there and then. Besides that, I think the furniture was sub par.The one thing I did notice and liked a lot is the artwork on the wall. I am not sure if these are painted from local artists but they are unique and very bold. There was this submarine painting that I thought would look great in my bathroom. Also, there were two blues brothers paintings that I liked too. It is expensive for me, but if you guys are interested in buying good art, I would go in and take a look.

18.description: Just bought a mattress from these guys. Jimmy was very helpful and was not over the top salesman-y. They even checked for overstock and wrangled out a mattress that was even cheaper for my tight budget. Gracias por todo, Jimmy.

41.description: Ken, the owner is a great guy - not pushy, gets out of the way to give you the space to browse. Delivery was free and fast. Great prices as well. Only drawback was that all selections may not be available immediately - when the dining table I wanted was not in stock, Ken promised free delivery within 3 days - so it worked out after all. Will definitely use again.

4.description: Just bought a sofa from here and Jimmy was a delight . Very friendly and informative without being pushy. We will be back to fill the rest of our apartment!

6.description: I have had the pleasure of using them five times.  Twice when my company moved and three times when I personally moved.  Ken and Jimmy and fantastic and Ken (the owner) has even stopped out to check on one of my moves.  They are always friendly, work hard and take care with my belongings.  One of the indications that a company is good (in my opinion) is if they employees stay there, especially in a hard physical labor job like moving.  I have dealt with the same people for over 7 years now.  I can't imagine ever moving and not using Lubinski!!

22.description: I just bought a bunch of furniture from Lubinski because I read the reviews, and I am glad I did.  It is good furniture at a decent price.  They delivered it when they said they would, and delivered exactly what i wanted.

15.description: Terrific service.  They don't accost you or harass you.  Really friendly, and they give you space and time.  They also accommodate and work with your schedule.  The owner is consistently positive and kind throughout the entire process - from the moment I stepped into the store, called the store back to change dates and delivery, and then called them on the day of delivery where he was very reassuring and helpful.  In fact, I never interacted directly with the owner.  My salesman was Jimmy who was great.  The store is terrific.   I'd highly recommend and intend to return for future furniture needs.

20.description: Highly recommend this place.  Some of the furniture stores on Milwaukee are a little sketchy or overly pushy.  Not Lubinski.  After reading the positive Yelp reviews, and after searching for a new sectional for more than 2 months all over the city and the suburbs, I decided to try Lubinski.  I was skeptical, as I've done a lot of research on how to determine good quality in furniture, so I was not going to be easily sold. I spotted a sectional I liked and did all my tests.  I asked the sales guy about the construction and I could tell he didn't know and was making it up.  That's ok, I would have googled it anyway.  I did, and the construction was actually better than what he had described.  It is extremely well made and very comfortable. The original price was $1700 and I got it on sale for $995.  I live nearby, so delivery was only $25.  I had expected to pay at least $100.  We scheduled to have it delivered in 2 days.On delivery day, they called before they came and arrived right on time.  It's not easy getting furniture in our tiny doors and weird layout, but they did it quickly and efficiently.The best part was that today I got an actual personalized letter in the mail thanking me for my business and stating to contact them if I had any problems or questions.  Very impressed.

36.description: This place deserves its wealth of five-star reviews. I went here a couple of weeks ago after moving to the area, and Ken was affable, helpful and extremely low-pressure. Prices were quite reasonable and delivery was free, even though my order had to be brought over on two different days. Highly recommended.

14.description: Lubinski is a full on solid 3.5 for me. But, just not enough to get into the 4* range. Still, it was well worth coming in here as their prices are very good and they are now fully on my radar for the future. I didn't end up buying anything as all I needed was a loveseat. Lubinski did have some of those, but it seemed that they specialized more in sets for both couches+loveseats as well as dining sets. I didn't see that many single loveseats for sale. I definitely did see some, but nothing was really striking my fancy. The dining sets were very nice. I wish I had checked here out before I bought my table, but I'm not really complaining about what I have in all honesty. Still, it's one of those things that is good to know. The selection here is pretty good. While I wasn't bowled over by any of the sofas or loveseats, they were certainly good pieces of furniture. Since furniture is a very personal thing, its all good to me. The prices are very good with a very helpful staff to boot. If I need a dining set in the future, this is the first place that will be on my list.

3.description: I had a burger with fries. The fries are amazing. I added an egg with the burger. It's very fresh. The owner was very nice. There is also a cool wall with Marvel comics.

1.description: A gem in the heart of the Hermosa neighborhood. The food is really good. Everything is made fresh to order and the execution is superb. There is really no other comparison in this neighborhood which makes Hermosa stand out. The grilled cheese and soup combo is perfect. The quality bread is really toasty and the cheese is quality. To echo other reviewers, the fries are also a big hit. They take credit cards now! Skip the Dunkin Donuts line and go here for the donuts. Great donuts that are really fresh and great iced coffee too!

2.description: Love love love this place! The burgers were amazing and the Oreo milkshake was PERFECTION! Definitely recommend this place! P.s. The fact that I could have a jarrito, a Chinese shake (sorry, sounds super ignorant because I don't know the actual name), or a coke was AWSOME!

5.description: Excellent hot dogs, and the fires are crispy. Really cool atmosphere and artwork, vintage Coke machine is cool as well. Friendly staff and quick!

6.description: I went in for an avocado smoothie and they had none. My next option was a berry smoothie. It's a cash only place. There was nothing impressive about the smoothie besides the $6 price tag.

7.description: Everything is delicious. The hot dogs are made to perfection, poppy seed bun and all. Do not shy away from their delicious Italian Beef either the Au Jus is amazing.

8.description: Great donuts at great prices. This place has been only open a week. I checked it out yesterday with my family and the donuts were great. Everything is made from scratch. Although I have only tried the donuts, i'll definitely be coming back again for the smoothies.

0.description: Amazing food! I've lived in Hermosa for about 4 months and have yet to try something so delicious and fresh. I got the chicken parm and my girlfriend got the bacon tomato grilled cheese, both great takes on what is already a delicious sandwich.Also got a chance to eat Ethan picking up my food and he was very professional and you could tell how passionate he is about his business. I will definitely be eating here again!

4.description: Donuts were good. Nothing exciting.. I think the milkshakes were a little pricey. I didnt like the burgers but fries were tasty. Disappointed the next day my donuts were hard and stale when I opened the bag. Was an ok place but won't go again.

3.description: I've been eating at this family owned business for 15 years, since it was a small whole in the wall named Lindo Poncitlan , and on past their expansion and name change. I like this place for a couple solid reasons. First reason being it is a very clean restaurant. It is consistently good and taco dinner is cheap. They have the best chips and salsa in my opinion and sometimes go in just for an order to go. If you are a fan of local, quality family owned business and this is definitely one of them!!

1.description: This place is awesome,friendly and fast service staff.I've had the lomo burrito which is excellent juicy and tender and also poncitlan breakfast,chilaquiles verdes and mole rojo are to die for.

2.description: One of the best carne asada burito ive had in a long time. Great food. Tasety in every bite.

5.description: Just eat it all, it's that good.Close to work, been coming in for a couple of years now.  Always delicious and the service for take out is always friendly.  Just had tacos and rice - never disappointed. They never forget anything in our order, which is nice knowing I don't have to check thru the bag before I leave.  Oh and the place is super clean, which is also great for obvious reasons :)

6.description: I consider this place my local family dining restaurant. The menu is Mexican and the service is excellent. When we go here, the restaurant is usually full or almost full and we get a table immediately. The service is very well-timed and we always enjoy the food. I recommend trying a variety of items on the menu although you may feel like you want to settle into a groove of two or three different things if you dine here regularly. They never fail to surprise me. I was a little bit miffed by a recent increase in prices on the menu but they are certainly worth the money.

7.description: Very pretty place inside.  Pleasant service, and most importantly, really good tacos de lomo, carne asada etc.

8.description: My fiance and myself were in the home depot at cicero and armitage the other night and was in the mood for mexican food so I asked someone that works there where is a good place for mexican food.  He told us about mi linda hacienda.  The best mexican food we ever had.  We had tacos,tortas and gorditas.  $1.75 for a taco that's twice the size of most places,steak was tender and spiced just right.  When I told the owners son how impressed we were, he brought us some of their homemade flan which was out of this world.  Next time we feel like mexican food we will most certain make the half hour drive from the suburbs to go there again.

0.description: Love this place The people and the food are greatWould recommend itAlso order food for catering events and never had a problems with orders

4.description: Love this place, the employees, and the food! Food is quite pricey but I love the atmosphere here. The girls love when I bring my son and he loves coming here because he gets attention. The chilaquiles, tampiquena, chiles rellenos, and carne asada meals are all my favorites!

3.description: Just went to this cute little gem in Hermosa park. It's different than any other spots in the area.The staff was friendly and attentive. The only thing I think they should add is some mimosas on the weekends.It would compliment the patio decor.Besides that,I'm definitely returning.

1.description: We really enjoyed our breakfast here! Stopped in here on a rainy morning and were greeted by a friendly woman who made us feel right at home. We grubbed on a chorizo skillet and bacon omelette along with fresh cut fries and some nice strong coffee. This little spot is warm, homey and prides itself on natural, fresh, quality ingredients. While there were some kinks in service, I attribute them to being new, and since the food was so delicious, I will also give them a pass on refusing to serve Diet Coke because of its health dangers - grrr.

0.description: What a little gem in this neighborhood! I rode by this a few times and last night found myself a minute away fixing my car at Aaron's Glass, so my wife and I stopped in here to soak in the last days of being able to sit outside. We're glad we did!Breakfast all day is just a winning deal for me! I ordered the chorizo skillet and my wife ordered the cheeseburger. Both were super tasty and the burger was nice and juicy. Be mindful though that the skillet DOES have jalapeños, so it's got a kick. Tried the coffee and it was pretty good too. But the selling point is the sweet little courtyard that gives it an almost European feel to the place. You almost feel like you're not in a Chicago neighborhood for a little bit. There's a covered area too for winter time and inclement in weather, and the space can be rented for parties. Met the brother of the owner. Nice guy. Keep it up guys, you got something good going! All done with tip was about $17. Most likely going to come back!

2.description: Yumm!! Stopped in for brunch with my pops and was very pleased with what I ordered.. I had the bacon breakfast sandwich .. Cheesy goodness!!!  slammed in less time than it took to make... Low prices, great customer service.. Definitely will return soon, gotta try out the rest of the menu

5.description: Oh my God I am so glad that I stopped in this place the food is fresh very natural and the owner was the friendliest person ever sometimes you forget you're in the restaurant and it feels like home. So if this is one place that you thought about don't think about it. Just go The atmosphere is so welcoming you do not want to leave

6.description: Glad I found this little gem! It's small, hidden, but so nice! If your looking for a inexpensive breakfast or lunch AND a patio this it. It's newly remodeled and it's so cute, no other way to describe it. The food is nothing extraordinary but it's yummy. Only wish they had a bigger selection on food.

7.description: This place is so chill great place to bring your friends or family have a small meal, have a ci hole drinks and just relax. Hopefully this place gets well noticed I like the food and maybe of it get more people they'll add more to their menu :)

8.description: What a great little gem tucked away on Armitage Ave. :) There is a courtyard for outdoor seating when the weather is nice but there are also a few tables inside for cold/bad weather as well...don't forget about take out too! Prices are great - a juicy handshaped burger with fries (my fiancés fave!)  will run u $3.50 ..and the breakfast offerings include omelettes with hash browns and toast for $4.99.  The food is good, staff is super friendly and they even have a 10 coffee punch card where u get the 11th free. Nice selection of coffees, lattes, espresso, teas and even some baked goods. Parking on Armitage is good. These guys have only been here for a few months, but I hope they stay and grow. They are in walking distance from our house and what a treat to be able to stop by for a biscotti and coffee ..or a pot of tea!

9.description: I absolutely love this place!.I just moved to Chicago from Michigan and this is by far the best priced place in the city! I had the cheeseburger and fries and it was so delicious and very Inexpensive. I loved the outside seating. It's such a clean place with great friendly staff. The food came out quick and very fresh. Their coffee is very very good (I'm a big coffee fan and am very particular about my coffee!) I recommend this place to everyone because it's good quality for an amazing price . I can't wait to go there again and eat outside :).

10.description: was getting a new windshield across the street at Aaron's glass. they get 5 stars also. Asked them for a place to eat while my car was being worked on and they recommended Armitage Courtyard Café.  delicious food. can't beat the prices. the help was nice and helpful. Definitely will go back. Can't wait till it is warm enough so I can eat outside in the courtyard

4.description: I really wanted to like this place. Its a cute small place which deserved one star for that and I'll give the other star for the fries. Went once to grab a quick burger and it was a pretty crappy burger honestly. The fries were very good at least. Second time I went to get french toast... had to wait for the cook to get off his smoke break and the french toast was so bland . I dont know if theres only one cook but there should be 2. After both times I don't think I will go back. This little place has potential tho. Too bad.

1.description: The Pizza puff was delish. The pizza not so great. It reminded me of grade school pizza,dough with sauce on it. The cheese had no flavor what so ever. The prices match the pizza. Cheap.This review is for Margherita pizza that was formerly Mamas Pizza.

9.description: Horrible. We found Mom's through gubhub and ordered online a thin crust pizza.It took forever, arrived cold and the crust was the worst I have ever had.

23.description: First off, if you are a vegan-- cheeseless pizza is no problem (not a silly request to them at all.)  They have tons of veggie (and meat) toppings.  The deal is two one topping medium pizzas for 12.99.  Buuuut, you can get half one topping and half another and not be charged extra.   Aaaand, if you get cheeseless, then two toppings is technically a one topping pizza.   This is an oustanding deal on food, people.  Plus kind and considerate service.  All around, Mom's has provided some of the best pizza experiences in my life.  5 stars for consistent excellency.

12.description: Ordered delivery on Christmas day for me and another Christmas orphan. Pizza was great, driver was super friendly and fast, they even included a handwritten Christmas card with the pizza. Love this place.

21.description: I have been looking for a decent pizza place in the logan square area and finally found one! Mom's is more than decent, it's the best pizza I've had in Chicago! The food is completely authentic....like Mom actually made it! The crust is so fresh and tasty and the cheese is not overly greasy. When you pull a piece the cheese actually stretches like real cheese should. Nothing fake here; no corners cut. GREAT pizza. Also, had the cheese sticks...nom nom nom! ORDER here - you will not be disappointed. BTW - delivery on a Friday was supposed to be an hour...pretty much to be expected. However, the super nice delivery guy showed up 30 min after my order was placed with a nice hot pizza! And...free drink. NICE!

16.description: First off, if you are a vegan-- cheeseless pizza is no problem (not a silly request to them at all.)  They have tons of veggie (and meat) toppings.  The deal is two one topping medium pizzas for 12.99.  Buuuut, you can get half one topping and half another and not be charged extra.   Aaaand, if you get cheeseless, then two toppings is technically a one topping pizza.   This is an oustanding deal on food, people.  Plus kind and considerate service.  All around, Mom's has provided some of the best pizza experiences in my life.  5 stars for consistent excellency.

17.description: The first positive thing that happened was they were out of oreo dessert so they called to tell us that and replaced it with a wonderful fresh fruit flan. Second positive; the food was piping hot and delivered in a timely manner. Hubby had the baked mostaccioli and he said it was good, didn't rave but said it was good. We also had an order of cheese sticks which were very good. I ordered a thin crust 10" pizza with spinach and fresh garlic and asked them to please not cut into squares, either pie cut or leave it uncut. It arrived, too much minced garlic out of a jar, spinach was not fresh spinach, it was frozen or worse canned and it was cut into those stupid little squares. The pizza ruined the deal for me. Not sure if I'd order again and if I did I'd make sure to just get plain pizza and follow up my computer order with a phone call to say please don't slice the pizza.

10.description: I'm sad to say we had a terrible experience from Mom's Pizza.  After reading the reviews, I had my hopes up.  Just to be clear, this order was 1 large deep dish pizza (3 toppings, $23.00).  The pizza had black olives, mushrooms, and artichoke hearts.  All ingredients were clearly canned (including the mushrooms).  The pizza seemed to come in 3 layers, crust/sauce/topping (not traditional deep dish), with each layer sliding around on its own.  It made me feel ill.  Though starving, I stomached 1.5 pieces before throwing in the towel.  The pizza we ordered was so bad that though I've kept it in my fridge, I will not be consuming it for a meal or for a snack in the coming days.  It just wasn't edible.  I had a  great conversation with Mom while ordering, and the delivery was prompt.  I'm disappointed to submit this review, but be warned.  It simply wasn't good pizza and you'd do better ordering elsewhere.

5.description: First time ordering and it was awesome! Had stuffed pizza and the taste of the crust was amazing the beef/combo sandwich was huge with tons of fries, will def order again, cant say enough about the pizza...and close to home...

11.description: Truly a mom and pops place; The mom runs the cash register!! lol she's a very sweet lady...I just stuffed my face and all i can say is WOW!! it's not too thick and not too thin, and it's filling. Although, slice or two or seven isn't enough! :)...In fact it was sooo good that i'm not ashamed to add that i did need to unbutton! HahahahOne itsy bitsy tiny problem though, I ordered a pizza with black olives, and one of them still had the pit... :/...it could've been a problem, but luckily I know CPR ;)oh and very reasonable prices!!

22.description: Don't bother with tourist traps, Mom's Pizza is possibly the best DD pizza I've had in Chicago.  The customer service is friendly, the delivery is fast, and the prices are reasonable.  They also always give me a free liter of RC.  Hooray!  Support small businesses!  (Just stay away from their Jibaritos-- go to Borinquen for those.)

0.description: I'm giving this place five stars only after having been a loyal customer of theirs every Thursday night for the last three years. I don't normally do reviews, but the hipster douchebag who bitched about the artichoke heart pizza he couldn't eat, yet left in his fridge for some insane, yet no-doubt esoteric, self-righteous reason was enough to get me to respond.This is the neighborhood pizza joint Guy's used to be, before they became ashamed of being in Humboldt Park, and began chasing the ever-flaky, perpetually idiotic Wicker Park demographic. Mom's is small, unsophisticated, humble, and just downright terrific. I have no idea who the owner is, other than some older lady who called my cell one time to ask why I was spending so much ordering through grubhub every week when I could've saved $6 on every order by going through their new website. Say what you will about your petulant "Big Brother" nonsense - if my pizza lady is willing to keep track of what I order to provide me better value, I'm totally sold.The pizza speaks for itself. The gravy is perfection, the mozzadell is plentiful, and the sausage is the best I've had since my childhood in NYC.However, I tried the baked mostaccioli with meatballs a few weeks back, and as a result, will probably not order another pizza from them until December. The meatballs are, beyond any shadow of a doubt, the best I've ever had. They are sublime, and are enough to resurrect memories of my Brooklyn childhood. If Mom's ever decides to start selling meatball parm sandwiches, I'll gladly go to my Heavenly reward with one stuck in my piehole.As for the delivery time, I'm fortunate enough to live two blocks from the place, so I've never had to wait more than 30 minutes. But, if you live in some over-priced, Bohemian shithole and have to wait more than an hour for food from a neighborhood you hate anyway, then perhaps you'd be better off calling Papa John's. They gladly cater to self-involved, elitist tools who order artichoke hearts on their pizza in a futile bid to seem "relevant."

20.description: Truly a mom and pops place; The mom runs the cash register!! lol she's a very sweet lady...I just stuffed my face and all i can say is WOW!! it's not too thick and not too thin, and it's filling. Although, slice or two or seven isn't enough! :)...In fact it was sooo good that i'm not ashamed to add that i did need to unbutton! HahahahOne itsy bitsy tiny problem though, I ordered a pizza with black olives, and one of them still had the pit... :/...it could've been a problem, but luckily I know CPR ;)oh and very reasonable prices!!

19.description: Don't bother with tourist traps, Mom's Pizza is possibly the best DD pizza I've had in Chicago.  The customer service is friendly, the delivery is fast, and the prices are reasonable.  They also always give me a free liter of RC.  Hooray!  Support small businesses!  (Just stay away from their Jibaritos-- go to Borinquen for those.)

2.description: Seriously, I love this place. The stuffed pizza is delicious, the price is fantastic, and I defy you to find a more consistently enjoyable delivery experience. Don't wait, order now and start living your life on a whole new level.

18.description: I almost want to write a bad review so that it won't be any slower with delivery.... but I can't.  It is just too yummy.  I love the pizza!  I especially love the pizza bread.  it is so yummy.  I would highly recommend trying Mom's.  Except for the fact that I always want it on Monday and they are closed!  Just a warning, It takes a while - so order before you want the food!  As long as you aren't starving, it is well worth the wait.  So good!

13.description: Mmm good pizzzzoooowww!

4.description: Our go to for thin crust pizza in Logan Square/Hermosa. Staff is very friendly, food is always delivered on time, and it's very reasonably priced. I think we're on their Holiday Card list. And you know what, if we sent out holiday cards we would return the favor. Thanks for three solid years!

6.description: Fishy on the pricing. Booo! The pizza was good the first time we ordered but trying to rip you off is not cool.

15.description: This is the sweetest little family joint you'll ever visit.  These people are working hard and it shows.  The pizza isn't the best I've ever had (native New Yorker here, sorry Chicago), but you will not find a better family-run business or a more honest and engaging owner.  The kids are literally in the back rolling dough with their dad, and Mom brings the salad dressing out in a bottle from the refrigerator.  They will do whatever it takes to make sure you have a nice dinner and a good visit.  I loved being here.

7.description: Mom's is now Margaritas Pizza.  The thin crust pizza is ok nothing about it really stands out.  They forgot a topping on one of our pies and they gave us a free medium pizza with the correct toppings. Nice People.

8.description: My 2nd Favorite Pizza in Chicago (Lou Malnati's is my Number One). I came across Mom's Pizza Inc. on Grubhub (It was late night & I wanted pizza). This place showed up and I gave it a try. The PAN Pizza with Half Sausage/Half Pepperoni is AMAZING! It's the sauce. It's homemade! And the cheese...it's 100% real Mozzarella. You can tell because of it's texture (oil shouldn't sit on top of the cheese). I went to Le Cordon Bleu for Culinary and I highly recommend this Pan Pizza.I met the owner and she admits the consistency isn't always 100% because of her current health condition. My prayers are with her. Regardless, So far, this place hasn't failed me once.DELIVERY TAKES 1 1/2 Hours. (and I live 2 blocks away). It's a Mom & Pop Pizzeria, so it's expected. Be ready to wait, but it will be worth it!

3.description: The pizza is great! I was surprised to know they sold deserts here, I got a cheesecake and it's amazed at how good it was. I will definitely be coming here frequently.

14.description: My family and I ordered from Mom's this past Wednesday. The kids loved the pizza (very reasonably priced at 2 medium 1 topping for 12.99). My husband had the steak sandwich and he's still raving about it (the meat was slightly tough, but not tough enough to deter his eating pleasure). I would definitely recommend Mom's...I was surprised they delivered to my area (Austin Area). The service was quick (45 min) and my food was hot.

3.description: I went to this restaurant this past Friday with my dad and my feelings are really mixed. My biggest complaint was the extremely loud deafening Mexican music. I went for lunch around 2:00 pm and the music was so loud we couldn't hear each other speak. Going out for lunch with my father and niece should have been a social event but we are and left abruptly. The table cloths also made my con list because they were literally cloth, and didn't seem to have been washed or changed as frequently as they should. They had stains and crumbs on them. The food was very good though which would be MOST important at a restaurant. I ordered the fried shrimp and got a ton of them with fries, rice, and garlic bread too. I don't think the food was good enough for me to crave so I'm not sure of I would go back with all things considered; but I wouldn't rule it out completely either.

1.description: Sunday early afternoon,but by the time we received our food it felt like I had been there all day. It was just my boyfriend and I and the restaurant only had 3 other people in it. They must've decided to go fishing in the Atlantic for our food. I had to get my own ketchup from another table, and I was horribly disappointed after the food arrived. The waitress brought my boyfriend's plate first and when my plate came, his was cold. I almost didn't know where I was because of the variety on my plate. A bad mixture of flavors. 2 types of fries, garlic bread, salad topped w an orange, the seafood,  and a cup of rice.The octopus was the cheap defrosted bag version, and both the octopus and shrimp were overly salted and drenched in grease. I had to find the waitress to give her our card and she was on her phone. The best part of the meal was the free mint and hand wipe at the end, and the mints were old

2.description: This place has the best prawns ever!!!! Their food quality is amazing its just a matter of knowing what to order or asking the waitress for advice on what to order. Yumm I go here ever time I'm craving seafood! Oh and you HAVE to try they mineral water lemonade it's the best!

5.description: The food is so yummy.  My personal favorite is the camarones a la diabla. You MUST try.  The three stars are for the food alone.  It's missing two stars because the place itself sucks. It looks so sad and blah in there! I only order for delivery or carry out. :)

6.description: Excellent seafood place.

7.description: I had a $25 restaurant.com giftcard  which they would not honor because the NEW restaurant.com giftcards are not valid fridays and saturdays. Too expensive. Don't get me wrong, the food is good but I was livid that they wouldn't accept my giftcard. Never going back.
