0.description: Sunday afternoon and me and my main man Jorge aka bunono are hungry! 2 overgrown brown men buzzed and a lil tired after home improvements decide to hit this spot!!........this place is awesome!!!!!!!its small but well lit and the tables are set apart enought that your not on top of the bloke next table over!ITS  BYOB!!!!!! YEAH thats right.......you know these 2 brown brothas walked in with a 12 pack!!we flexed:a dozen oysters.......yumm yummsome ceviche(fish) it was great!fried fish body tail and all rubbed with garlic was out of this world!the hot sauce they make is HOTT be warned!PLUS Sundays there is live entertainment! dont worry folks there wont be some awful indie band playing..ha but a live performer singing  Spanish songs and doing comedy! good stuff when your buzzed and shrimped out!..shake and bake seal of approval!Hipster infestatgion level: 1 inevitably (because of  location)hipsters willl walk in here and order breaded tofu or something and when that day happens....my property value will go up CHA CHING! ....HA!

4.description: There's so many options here but be sure to try the fish tacos. They are heavenly...! We had the fish tacos and a huge shrimp cocktail, the Mexican way. Excellent!

3.description: Only reason why I gave 3 stars because it is nice inside and has computers. But prices are high and the snacks there aren't that great in taste. Went once and won't be returning.

1.description: Rosa J.'s new "partner in crime," Daddy J., has been joining her for some city adventures.  She wanted to show him some local bites, including her favorite type of place to visit: Mexican neveria.  Ok, let's get back to the use of first person pronoun.  After a short bus ride #53 (Pulaski) to Armitage, we walked one (1) block west and arrived at Cafe Internet Latino, located in the Hermosa neighborhood.  It's a family-friendly place to chill.  There are several communal computers, mainly for kids to play games.  I had a groupon that was purchased awhile ago ($8 off the entire bill).  We ordered the small mangoneada, an aguas frescas de papaya, and two (2) scoops of tequila almond ice cream in a peanut cone.  Our difference was $3.20.  The chili straw became with each order of mangoneada, which was why it was on a pricer side ($4.40 for small size).  From my experience, the chili straw wouldn't automatically come with as part of the package unless the customer asked for it (with an additional cost).  Their mangoneada was quite delicious, with a plenty of mango chucks on top.  I liked that they used "semi-ripened" mango, because it helped achieve the right "saturation" and "consistency" when mixing with the chili sauce and mango sorbet.  Daddy J. was digging the tequila almond ice cream.  He kept saying "forget about Ha*gen-Da*s...they ain't got nothing like what a neighborhood neveria offers."  Sorry, I believe he did speak with a correct grammar.  I just dramatized it with a sassy tone.  Hubby tagged along and was satisfied with his aguas frescas with the papaya flavor.  Their jugo was very fresh.  I haven't bought a bottle of Tropi*ana since I called Chicago home.  In other words, I understand what fresh juice is supposed to taste like.  Overall, it was worth the trip to provide a great introduction of Mexican-style neveria to Daddy J.  It was very eye-opening for him to see how Hispanic culture plays a major role in many Chicago neighborhoods.  I'm a firm believer in utilizing local eats as a way to access different cultures.  I'm so proud of being a Chicagoan because I can do this on a daily basis.P.S. They do charge a 4% convenience fee when using a debit or a credit card.  To avoid this hassle, bring some pocket cash with you.

2.description: Friendly service and big menu. My review is for the funnel cake I recently ordered. My kids didn't enjoy it at all! It was hard as if they had it sitting there for hours. I can't believe they would sell it like that.Next time we will definitely try the ice cream!

5.description: The Cafe Internet Latino is a nice neighborhood place to browse the internet or do some quick work on a computer. Prices are very reasonable and the small staff is friendly and helpful. I ordered a grilled cheese sandwich and a Sunkist soda. The grilled cheese sandwich had two different kinds of cheese and it was hot and delicious. Next time I will try one of their fresh and natural juice drinks when I want to sit down and do some reading.

6.description: Great place to sit in peace while using the internet. I've been here several times and always enjoy my stay. The servers are always polite and the food is great and won't cost nearly as much as anything at your typical coffee shop/cafe if you're looking to camp out somewhere for the whole day working on a project. The servers are also really nice and don't mind trying to explain many of their foods if you're like me and you aren't familiar with most of their menu at first. Definitely reccomend this place over your average cafe if you don't have wifi at home and need somewhere to go :)

7.description: If you love Mexican junk food (which is sooo good) then this is the place to go ;D they also have internet access so you can work on one of the computers after grabbing a snack. I looove ordering the mango parfait and carrot juice. For a large carrot juice its around $4.50...?

8.description: great location!Too bad the scaner wasn't working!

0.description: I really love this place. I love ice cream. The portions are pretty big for the cost. Very welcoming. Fresh fruit. It is a must visit in Chicago. First time here. Will be coming back.

4.description: My first review didn't get added to the recommended reviews, I'm not sure why. But this place is great! Look under other reviews for my detailed input! Friendly service, quality food & beverages, and good price.

3.description: If you are looking for a commuter bag or backpack of any sort you must stop by here. They will be able to explain anything about the bags and will identify which is the best for you. The staff were awesome, good sales people-- not pushy and genuinely interested in helping find what is right-- and they create a laid back browsing atmosphere. I have a classic messenger bag and it has been wonderful to bike around and go to class. These are great as they can be customized for colors and features (this can be done in the store). There are far more technical pieces available and that is where the sales people can be helpful in deciding. The store is in a great location and has a very aesthetically pleasing display format for the bags.

1.description: As a city dweller and daily commuter, I need a bag that's going to meet the following criteria:-attractive (color, size, shape)-highly functional-comfortable-washable-durableTimbuk2 bags offer all of this and more.  I purchased a bright blue skylark here about a month ago and am very happy with my purchase.  The bag converts from tote into backpack if you're riding your bike which is really nice.  The color is awesome and I love the hot pink contrast on the pretty blue.  The guys who work here (guy with glasses and beard, sorry, Nate maybe?) was incredibly helpful and brought the skylark to my attention, as I had original intended to purchase the scrunchie bag.  I'm glad he was able to better assess what I was looking for and offered a great product.  Thank you!Overall this was a great shopping experience and I encourage anyone looking for a new bag to stop in, you will definitely find something here.

2.description: I purchased a bag from Timbuk2 largely because of the "lifetime" warranty they offered. After a couple of years of light use the stitching attaching the strap to the bag completely unraveled, rendering the bag useless. I brought the bag into the store to have them evaluate the problem. They determined that the bag would have to be sent back to the factory for repair. After paying a $25 fee that I was told would be refunded after the bag was determined to be defective, the bag was mailed for repair. A few weeks after I received an email stating that the defective stitching was "wear and tear" and that I should be thankful that I get to pay $25 to have the bag repaired so that it will last for many more years (doubtful considering the initial stitching ripped apart in 2).  Customer service stopped responding to my inquiry regarding the bag. Overall, a warranty that doesn't cover the stitching holding the bag together seems like a meaningless inducement to sucker people into buying their bags.  There are many other companies making the same type of bag and I would definitely recommend any of those over Timbuk2.

9.description: Stumbled upon the new Timbuk2 store in Chicago the day after it opened.  Being big Timbuk2 supporters, it was great to see them in Chicago.  Made a small purchase in commemoration of their new store.  We went back a few days later to make another purchase.  It is a great store with great product, but being a new store, the employees knew less about the product than we did.  We found it difficult to believe that in a big city like Chicago, they couldn't find employees more familiar with their bags.  We know it's just a matter of time (and a few hours spent on their website) before they become the brand experts that we are.

10.description: When I walked in with my old backpack and all its contents, Nicole -- who helped me find my perfect, new Timbuk2 backpack -- didn't judge. And when the store filled up with customers, she still managed to provide my wife and I excellent customer service. On top of that, the store manager is awesome and also very helpful. And I haven't even mentioned how incredible the my Timbuk2 messenger and backpack are. Thank you, Timbuk2 for having a store in Chicago -- you rock!

4.description: Not purchasing a Timbuk2 bag after visiting the Seattle and Denver location then finally the Chicago location opens and finally I walk away purchasing a bag. Something about the new Chicago location store that finally won me over. Maybe it was the awesomely decorated Chicago flag brick wall. Maybe it was the awesome sample bags and swatches displayed. Maybe customer service from Nicole C just shined through. Or just maybe it was all of the above and more. Yes, yes, yes, and yes! As you walk in, the open spacious store invites you to check out everything. They even have a custom bar in the back with computers to allow you to custom order any bag they make. Next to the computers are the sample swatches of the different materials used to make every custom bag. The proud panted Chicago flag wall just hangs behind the registers. "Go ahead, take your things, and stuff it in any of the bags to see if you like any of the bags," as Nicole C suggests to me and I did just that. She was patient and suggestive based on the requirements I had. At the end, I ended up making a custom bag on one of their computer. Do it in the store! They get credit for helping you! Plus you can see every part in person! Within a week, your bag will arrive from SF made the way you want it! I recommend anyone looking for a Timbuk2 bag to go to the store in person. You will walk out happy as I was!Décor - 5Service - 5

6.description: This place. Nicole C was extremely helpful. I recently purchased a customized Timbuk2 bag through the website prior to this store opening. I went in to see if any one could point me in the direction of getting the strap on my bag replaced as it had started to already tear. Nicole was extremely helpful, she definitely went above and beyond. She gave me undivided attention and assured me that she would see that my needs were met. She truly left a good impression, which she didn't have to do because I wasn't even making a purchase that day in store. Nicole has been great with following up with me too. Amazing customer service aside, this store is beautiful. It has a very minimal, modern look to it. It's not the easiest to just "Browse" if you're not familiar with their products but that's what their team members are for. I've been a Timbuk2 fan for a while and I'm really glad to see a brick and mortar store here in Chicago! I'm just as glad that this experience owed up to the great quality of their products.

11.description: My husband and I were excited to see the store had opened when we were in the neighborhood for the Do Division Festival. The store was clean, well organized and easy to shop.The staff was not only friendly and knowledgeable, but also seemed genuine while interacting with customers.  It was a casual environment but not the hipster/fake vibe I've gotten from other stores in that area.  Alex was wonderful at helping us decide which bag would be best for my husband- not pushy whatsoever.  We were excited for the purchase knowing Timbuk2's quality and to support such a great store and local Wicker Park team!

12.description: I went yesterday morning to get a replacement bag.  The young lady working couldn't have been anymore helpful or pleasant.  Great store and neighborhood.

5.description: Great products and amazing service.I have shopped here 4 times (way too many already) and each time they continue to do an amazing job exceeding my expectations.  This past Sunday we were greeted with mimosas!Alex has helped me 3 times and this guy is a rock star.  Quite litterally slows down to ask relevant questions about use prior to just making recommendations.  Every time I go in I always walk out with something.

13.description: I absolutely love Timbuk2. The Chicago store is beautiful, well organized, and has lots of options on display. You can find whatever you want: a small bag, a big bag, a bag for cycling, a bag to keep your beer cold, a bag to transport your pet. Since they are specialized in what they do, you'll find exactly what you need. Also, I love the option to customize my bag with materials and colors that I like. Josh knew everything about the bags and was super friendly. He helped me select the perfect bag based on my needs. I'm really happy with my purchase! I strongly recommend you to experience the retail store.

7.description: I walked in the story about 45 minutes to close thinking it would be impossible to quickly find a bag. As soon as I walked in, I was greeted by Katheryne (sp?) who asked me what I was looking for in a bag. She showed me a few options and helped me narrow them down to the bag that would be best for me. It was great to actually be assisted by someone friendly and not pushy in a boutique-style store. I walked away with the Spire Backpack and I'm in love.

8.description: I was there to check out items I had seen on the website, so I was expecting to like what I saw. I was not expecting to find outstanding service and better prices than the website. Thank you and expect me to be back and spread the word. Special props to the guy who opened the store for an extra couple of minutes tonight to sell me a great suitcase!!

0.description: Thank you Facebook for the heads up the other week when timbuk2 was having a warehouse sale!! I made my way down there and realized that I wanted 3 different bags. Then I realized that I don't even need a bag....My be got a new messenger and I bought one for a friend who couldn't make it down there. Really great deals for nice bags and they love their new bags! One bag I really want is that backpack you can use to put your small dog in! Unfortunately, it wasn't part of the warehouse sale

3.description: ****************HAPPY 200th REVIEW*******************I came here for a friend's baby shower. The food was catered (by her mom, amazing delicious Puerto Rican Food, felt as if I were back in PR) open bar, good music, the place is very spacious. It is ample parking around the facility. I would come back or maybe even have a party here myself.

1.description: I had an awkward time here. I wanted to love this bar so badly. The ambience is perfectly kitsch. I love all the shiny glitter, lights, and nick-nacks. My problems were more practical in nature. The bartender seemed drunk and was bitter, ignorant of beer, and careless. There is no draught beer. The can of beer he managed to scrounge up for me, he couldn't describe the flavor of. The can was dirty or rusty when I received it. Revolution was the only beer they had in cans that was (IMHO) drinkable. It would be easy to stock up on some more rare and interesting brews.And then he was too present, lamenting the many types of flavored vodka on the market now, among other things. I don't want to be mean, but it was not fun and I will not be back.

2.description: Love The Levee. We go there often. Warren, the owner, couldn't be more nicer. The bar with the windy brass edge is so cool. They have another room in the back that is used for private parties. The bar continues on to the back room which is pretty cool. I totally recommend it!

9.description: A great working class neighborhood Chicago bar.  Friendly, no problems, not a meat market.  Fantastic place to go if you want a drink and good conversation!

10.description: This is the perfect bar if you just want to relax and have a drink. The place is always filled with good people. The staff are very friendly. Tons of extra room in the back, perfect for having your birthday party. And last time I was there they just got a ping pong table. So it basically just keeps getting better. As a matter of fact, I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this place.

4.description: This might be the perfect place to wear the $8 coonskin cap I bought at a truck stop in Iowa back in March.I've long admired the bold and rugged spirit of the Great American Frontiersman, the type who moved west to the Rockies during an age when someone who wanted attention would simply shoot their pistol in the air- even in an indoor setting. Aside from using my plastic gold to buy a cowboy hat and a snap button shirt from Alcala (and later the aforementioned coonskin), I've never emulated anything close to, say, the 28-month trek of Lewis and Clark. But in this Age of the Short Attention Span and Even Shorter Walking Strides, going just a few blocks west of all the Logan Square madness to find a quieter place feels like a big adventure.Despite the westicity of the place, the ceiling is not riddled with bullet holes, and aside from a solidly blue collar clientele this is not what I'd call a dive. In fact it's truly classy- on par with the Clipper, even, if much forgotten in the decades since this was the property of a successful showbiz star. The highlight is the winding brass rail along the wildly curvaceous barfront. It's amazing how many rascals you can look in the eye (and everybody's a rascal here, though of the friendly kind) and converse with at this bar, the counterpoint of the antisocial American-style flat bar. And then there's the sprawling back room, adorned with farm implements and featuring a pool table and darts. If you look hard enough (or drink hard enough?), I swear you'll even find a full height basketball hoop inside what looks to be just a closet.Between farming, shooting pool, making eye contact with strangers, and playing some basketball, I can't think of anything else I could possibly want from a bar.

6.description: I went to the Levee 10/15!My friend Erica's birthday, her boyfriends band was playing blues and they are AMAZING!....At first glance I thought....I've seen this place a million times....never .thought  to walk in ever.Will I be back HELL YES. Is it a Dive bar? ONLY THE BEST CLASSIC KIND! not in a cheap way but in a.....we've been here forever and we had a lot of stuff. They were decorated for Halloween and it was  SPOOKTACULAR! (corny but true)  THEY HAVE A BIG PARTY ROOM where I resent not having my birthday there....but it's PERFECT....and they have a jukebox.I definitely recommend this place!

11.description: Good old working class Chicago bar.  Baseball (probably the cubs unfortunately) on the tube, pool in the back.  Classic Chicago tavern.

5.description: "How did you end up here with two such gorgeous women?" How can you not love a place where a man is capable of calling you gorgeous without being crass about it, even if the man in question is pushing seventy? After that charming introduction, he went on to regale us with tales of his wife (also a librarian like myself and my female friend, obviously this man has a type), his eleventy billion boats and his grandchildren. Typical bar conversation, to be sure, but the gorgeous deco bar and obvious history the place is steeped in elevated this simple interaction into a sort of tipsy poetry. Further, how could I not love a bar where the patrons continually make me laugh until I snort? ("Oh, that laugh! Marry me, please!" "Isn't one librarian wife enough?" "Yeah, you're probably right.") For a introverted misanthrope, there's nothing more hard to find or sought after than a refuge where I can think, for even a little while, that this whole human race thing ain't so bad.

7.description: A great place to relax and watch sports or to hang out with your friends. Great staff, great jukebox and reasonably priced drinks. Plus, the stools in the front bar are the most comfortable ones in the known universe.Bonus, if you ask politely they will put the Sox game on for you.

8.description: We went here for a friend's birthday party and had a GREAT time watching the live band, drinking cheap drinks, playing darts, and dancing.  The place is large with a big main room with a full bar and then a side room with bar games, more tables, and live music.  Everyone was very friendly and I can imagine feeling welcome there with a small group or a big party.  Stop by if you're in the area!

0.description: I'm very happy to say The Levee is my neighborhood bar.  I moved in a few blocks away in September and didn't make my first visit until December.  Honestly, I should have gone in sooner.  The Levee is truly a neighborhood bar.  Warren (the owner) is friendly and available, ready to chat about the neighborhood, sports, politics, whatever. He's very involved in the community (even letting the Hermosa Neighborhood Association host meetings here) and even turns his back room into a polling place come election season.  The Levee is no frills, to say the least.  The beer is cheap, the selection is varied (they have domestics and 'fancier' hipster beers like Revolution and other local favorites) plus they have pretty inexpensive shots.  I even saw someone drinking (and enjoying) cognac one time, so to say they don't have a wide variety of drinks is an understatement.  There's no food, but people are welcome to bring in something to eat and sometimes there's pot luck style food on special occasions (like St. Patty's Day).  There's ample seating at a wonderful bar from the days of yore.  The whole bar wraps around the space and has brass rails, which reminds me of the 1920s.  I imagine this place used to have a live band and people wore some fancy cocktail attire when they came to sip some cocktails.  It's definitely a cool remnant of a different style of bar construction and makes the space seem more welcoming because you can see everyone.  On Fridays, a lot of local teachers hang out in here as well as a lot of other blue collar-ers from the neighborhood.  There's a lot of good conversation with friends and strangers and everyone is always eager to get to know your name.  I'm definitely glad to call this my neighborhood hang out and, really, what else could you ask for in a good bar?
